text: Oh My Gosh amazing!!! The Lasagna is to die for, the home made Italian sausage inside is amazing. I will be back again and again every time I come to Charlotte!!! I was here on a Weds night and the bottles of wine were half price, what a deal. My friend had the Chicken parmesan and couldn't say enough how much he enjoyed it, plus it was huge enough for  lunch tomorrow.

Went here his past weekend and I thought enough about it to write a review. Mama Ricottas is nestled in the corner of a duplex shopping center. At night the ambience is perfect for an intimate adult meeting place. The price point is mid grade, you're not gonna lose your shirt to have a decent meal. Yet a date is gonna know they are not at fizzolis'. I had the chicken Parmesan and a salad and everything was delicious. The atmosphere was nice and it is directly across from a park so you can walk off the bread afterwards. I will definitely be back.

I am new to the area and so I looked up some restaurants in a Charlotte guide book.  Saw the review on Mama Ricotta's and had to give it a try.  To start, we had the tomato and mozzarella appetizer.  WOW!  Simple dish but absolutely amazing.  Not sure what made it taste so fantastic but it might have been the olive oil that it was sitting in.  Then, my mom and I split the family style dish "Pollo Bianco".  Again, this meal was very good.  5 chicken breasts smothered in a delicious sauce and mushrooms.  We got the garlic mashed potatoes as a side.  Yum!  I, also, ordered Mama's Mojito which is a bit pricey but delicious, nonetheless.  I would definitely go back.  And since they serve family style, I think this place would be great for big groups.  The family portions are reasonably priced.
Great service.  Great food!! My favorite Italian in the city!

Read a ton of great reviews about this place, and since we're new to the Charlotte area, we were in search of an Italian hot spot. It was a real cold night out, so as we walked by we saw the fireplace roaring out on the patio and a nice table for 4 in front of it. When we walked in, we asked the hostess if we could sit there. She said someone was going to clean it off for us and they'd sit us right away. Another group was also being seated at the same time as us and as we approached the area, the other party of four was deciding if they wanted to switch and go snag our table in front of the fire. I said to our hostess "Oh no, they're gonna take our table we requested!" and not once did she step in and tell the waitress in front that she was about to sit us there. So yeah, that was kinda frustrating.

Other than that, our waitress Brie was helpful and had an awesome personality that lightened up our mood after the table incident. Drinks were good, although wine by the glass is pretty pricey. Beers were reasonable. I had the chicken and broccoli penne, which was more than enough and I ended up with lots of leftovers. My husband had the rigatoni with meat sauce. Everything was delicious and we will definitely be back!

This place is always spot on. The wine selection is always excellent and the food makes you close your eyes and say wow!  Great for any occasion and really fun for a special occasion. Desserts...gotta safe room or just do it anyway.

What an over rated place. This definitely is NOT big city, cool, REAL Italian food.  This is small town, pretentious, over priced, "They think it is cool but it's not" food.I came here expecting something special.  It's generic, it's dull, and it's OVER RATED.

This is a wonderfully comfortable place.  That is a good thing.

The portions are bountiful and well-prepared from quality and fresh ingredients.  There is no brilliance or even excellence in the cooking, but that is not what the place strives for.  It is the quintessential neighborhood Italian restaurant, located appropriately enough in a small strip mall just outside of uptown Charlotte.

I have been here many times and never had service that was not friendly and prompt.  I have enjoyed every meal there.

I am really not that easily impressed but Mama Ricotta's is outstanding in just about every way. They make it so easy to love them.

1. It's in a good location. The actual restaurant is cozy but not cramped. The outdoor patio is also nice and sealed in. 

2. The service (especially this one server) I don't know his name but he is the really muscley bald one...Yeah he's my favorite. Everytime my boyfriend and I go there we pray we get him b/c he is delightfully friendly and accomodating. He practically jumps to fill up your water, get you the best dish, seat you in the best lighting, whatever it is that you want he'll get it for you. We really love him. 

3. The food above all is one of the best Italian places in Charlotte. I love their penne a la vodka, calamari, and fish. The nutella pie is a slice of death it's so good!!! It is also alarmingly large...I say eat some there and take it home for later!

our favorite restaurant in Charlotte for a sit down experience

The only way you could complain is if you go there expecting authentic Italian
I argue this is better.

Goat cheese mascapone is to die for

Vodka penne is amazing 
Portion sizes will make you take home a box. 
Split a meal and can be very economical

I could spend a few pages glorifying this place.
I bet the negative reviews are from people that ordered a dish they would not like at any restaurant, or from people that go during restaurant week when they are slammed

DINE IN ONLY! I would definitely recommend food here, my husband and I normally order a family sized penne alla vodka there's plenty of food for both of us and we take some home. The other day I ordered the same size for take out, once we got home there was only enough for him to eat I ended up having to make myself something to eat. Totally disappointed, 20 something bucks later and I still had to make my own dinner!

If you're looking for a place to eat for prom dinner, thats affordable(20-30 bucks a plate) Mama Ricottas it is! I came here for prom dinner and was not disappointed; the service,food and portions, music and homey vibe was great!

I always want to like Mama Ricotta's more than I actually do, if that makes sense. 

Everyone I know loves it, and sure, it's acceptable and reasonably priced, they can handle larger parties with a little advance notice, and the service is always fast and friendly. 

I just wish the food were more memorable, I think. Standard fare, really, and executed without major flaws (though on some nights, yes, it can be a wee bit saltier than you might wish), but nothing to write home about. 

Sometimes, I'll get this "let's go to Mama Ricotta's!" urge. Every time I do, I wonder "now, why did I want that so badly?" 

I'm never really able to answer. I guess there's something comforting about mediocrity.

Our experience at Momma Ricotta's today needs to be shared. It's always been one of our favorite restaurants, but noticed a change over the past few months. The service continues to decline, there is a growing lack of attention to details, dirty restrooms (even at 11:30 AM- so this isn't due to them being busy), and the pasta is no longer consistent.  My suggestion is to train your team, hire managers to lead by example, and get the service back to the level that Momma Ricotta's has been known for.  I don't want to get into every little detail, but happy to answer any questions.

Ordered 1 salad and 1 family-sized chicken parm for take-out.  Once I got home and opened up the bag, I noticed there was not pasta with the chicken parm (just 3-4 cheese covered chicken breasts) plus they gave us the wrong salad dressing we requested.  Will definitely not return here if they cannot get a simple order like this correct.

Real deal Italian restaurant. Nothing they do here is not legit. Pizza, pasta,  shrimp & veal dishes all authentic.  NYC good and that is a compliment. Little Italy in Charlotte, it don't grt better than that.  Now that's Italian!

Wow! THE best Italian food in Charlotte. 
If you have not been you should try.
We go quite often and let me say I have NEVER been disappointed with service or food.

They start with wonderful rolls with oil and crushed red pepper. Delicious - then we usually get the cheese ravioli and chicken penne vodka pasta. 

I would highly recommended you give this place a try if you are looking for Italian!

This place was so delicious!  I ordered take out and halfway home, I thought I was going to have to pull the car over to start eating.  I ordered the Cannolicchi Pesto di Pomodoro Secco with chicken, which was heavenly. My boyfriend got the Tomato Basil Angel Hair Pasta.  He got it with the optional meatballs -- that made the meal awesome!

We also had the peanut butter pie for dessert.  We weren't able to eat very much of it, since the entree portion sizes were pretty generous, but worth it for sure!

Overall, a great little pasta place!

Visiting Charlotte for the weekend and participated in the Tour de Food event which featured this restaurant. The restaurant was clean, quaint with nice ambience. The food was excellent. They featured the Penne alas vodka and penne chicken and broccoli. If you're in the mood for good Italian cuisine, this place is definitely worth a visit.
Mediocre Italian food. I had a pizza and it was quite bland. The waiter was nice, though.

Mama Ricotta's is a great neighborhood Italian Restaurant.  We often take guests from out of town as the food is great, reasonably priced, and the atmosphere is fun without being too loud.  You can order food family-style but we typically opt for individual dishes.

Try the Tuscan Salad, Penne Alla Vodka, and Nutella pie.  Wood fired pizzas are also very good.  Thursday night they feature a "date night menu" which lets you pick an appetizer or salads, two entrees, a dessert to split, and a bottle of wine for $50.

The good here is good but every time we have attended the service has been mediocre at best. We usually sit at the bar of a restaurant because the service is fast and friendly. Not here. There is a strain and tension in the manager, the kitchen and then the bar is seldom serviced. Maybe we should try a table..

Update:  the management staff had contacted me a few times and have been very responsive. I look forward to returning and enjoying their food and service.

Seriously, Mama Ricotta's "had me" when they brought the bread to the table. I am in love with it. Soft, warm and it looks like they brush it w/ a little butter and herbs/garlic. Do I sound obsessed? Hope not...Anyway, a few dishes I have tried include:
Penne Alla Vodka
Lasagna
Both these pasta dishes are pretty good. I love them both but every once in a blue moon they can be a little off (dry, salty, etc)
Carrot Cake Cheesecake (for dessert I usually share and pick a bite or two and am over it, that's just me though. For my few bites, I liked it. It could have been a little more room temp, felt like it was pre sliced and taken out the fridge to our table but overall it was good. I liked the combo and it was huge--a must share dish. 

Love their sweet tea too!

Oh and the last time I went I had the BEST server. His name sounded like Lavender but I know it wasn't Lavender. He was friendly, patient and attentive--to the point that he was already filling my glass of sweet tea as soon as I finished my last sip.

Great restaurant.   We all ordered something very different from the menu and all 3 of us loved our meal.   The family style salads are awesome and save room for the Vermont Maple Cheesecake!   LOVE!!

I've been going to Mama Ricotta's for about 5 years and I've never had a bad meal. When we think about where to go for dinner and decide Italian we may go elsewhere 'just to try it' but every meal will compare to Mama's because we love it.. so I guess it's our standard for Italian here in Charlotte. The calamari is always on point and a must order. Penne Alla Vodka and the Penne, Broccoli, and Chicken are always amazing.. tip: order the family size so you are sure to have leftovers! The lasagna and chicken parm are great classics too!
Had the pasta special last night at Mama's and it was unreal.  Pure breast meat chicken bolognese in a tomato sauce with perfectly cooked rigatoni. Chef Drew hits another home run.

Oh Yeah! My wife brought home some cold pizza from them one day and even That was great! #NoHeatingNecessary I told her I Have to go there ASAP... So of course we did :-) 

The front/side of the restaurant is under construction, but once I enter the restaurant, I forgot all about it. They weren't loud and distracting which is a huge plus. The restaurant is dimly lit and has a romantic ambience, even during lunch. 

First, we had Italian bread brought out to us with a seasoned oil. The bread was light, fluffy, and didn't even need to be dipped in the oil (but of course it was great with it too!)

For an appetizer, we got the eggplant fries. They were heavily fried and extra delicious. The crunch was phenomenal. I haven't had eggplant prepared quite that way before, and it was a surprising treat. 

Next, we shared a chicken sausage (yes they have that!), red onion and spinach pizza with extra sauce (we made our own). The crust has such a satisfying crunch. I usually do not eat all of the crust off of pizza, let me tell you, there was no crust left from my slices! (I didn't even notice until my wife pointed it out!) The chicken sausage was cooked perfectly, and the onions and spinach played a perfect compliment to the sausage. 

The service all around was great and I will definitely go back again. Go Mama Ricotta's!

I've been here a handful of times and really love it.  Definitely try the goat cheese & marscapone (sp?) appetizer - so delicious - I could eat the whole thing by myself.  I've only ever had the penna alla vodka, which is usually top notch.  However, the past couple times I've had it, the sauce seems to have a somewhat glue-like consistency.  Still tasty, but that bothered me.  I've always had great service there and really can't complain.  A fun, great place to go to eat. Very laid back, so if you're interested in a stuffy/trendy restaurant, this won't be it. Definitely solid.

The only reason I gave it a 2 (and not a 1 or 0 star) was because the food was decent - the service, not so much. I went with a group (8 of us) for a colleague's birthday luncheon. We arrived prior to the "lunch rush" (around 11:30) and at first, the staff was attentive and we got our drinks right away. I ordered a salad with my entree, which came out with no problems and fairly quickly. 

I cannot say as much for the rest of the meal.It was all downhill from there. We then proceeded to wait for almost 20 minutes for our food, which is no big deal if it is busy, but two things: 1) we arrived and placed our order BEFORE the actual rush started and, 2) we watched as 16 people at various tables around us, who arrived WELL after us, had their food come out and were almost finished eating -  and we still hadn't had ours yet. When we inquired about the food - TWICE - the waitresses (there were two - one was clearly a trainee - who is NOT learning good food service techniques for this establishment) kept explaining that it was "really busy" and we were there during the "rush." Finally our food came out, but not before one of us went to speak to the manager. He was apologetic, but then as soon as our colleague walked away, I saw him talk to the two waitresses and all 3 looked at our table and laughed. REALLY?? Is that how you conduct yourself as a manager/owner?? RUDE!! I believe his name is Frank. 

While he apologized, he never offered any kind of compensation, as I would expect when you make a huge mistake and treat your customers rudely - at the VERY least. Not even a, "I'm so sorry for your bad experience, we will take care of your _________." Now, I am not a restaurant manager or owner, but I AM a savvy diner and I do frequent several establishments owned by the same people. When I say frequent, I mean EVERY Friday. I am considering not going back to any restaurant owned by them (Bad Daddy's, Cantina 1511, Paco's Tacos...) because of how rudely we were treated and dismissed. Frank needs to go back to business management and learn how to treat his customers, especially if he would like them to return.

I will not be returning here, if I want mediocre Italian food, I'll go elsewhere. Like one reviewer below mentioned, this is just a step above Olive Garden. I have been to Italy and this food is nowhere near "authentic." If you want real Italian food, do yourself a favor and go to Dolce. You can actually hear them speaking Italian in the kitchen. And I have never had anything less than stellar service there.

Ate here on a Saturday night.   It was crowded but we had no wait. There's outdoor seating on a covered patio as well as indoor.  They serve warm garlic bows and bread with spicy dipping oil.   We had wood oven pizza with fresh mushrooms and Italian sausage.   Server grated fresh parmigiano over the top.   Molto Delicioso!

My husband and I had dinner with his co-worker and his wife. The atmosphere was cozy and family friendly. The bread was quiet good and our entrees were delicious and arrived on time. The portions were big. They were really good. However, my husband had the Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The spaghetti was so dry. Aside from that, it was perfect.

I've eaten here so many times that I have often had dreams about Mama Ricotta and I taking a long walk on the beach.  I have NEVER been disappointed.  The service is phenomenal, the food is fresh and flavorful and after eating Italian food in so many other cities, Mama's is unbelievably cheap and, dare I say it, as "authentic" as it comes!

Dinner for two with a pre-dinner cocktail and a moderately priced bottle of wine is only about $100.  Do it .. do it now.

I have been enjoying Mama Ricotta's for many years and went again last night.  Friends that were joining us were late, so I enjoyed a glass of wine and their delicious garlic rolls while we waited.  Never a bad way to start dinner.  Several of us had the garlic potato soup to start and it was terrific.  On Sunday nights apparently they offer rotating specials culled from one of their favorite Italian restaurants as a tribute.  Neat idea.  I had the Pork Saltimbocca special and really enjoyed it.

I adore this casual and family-friendly restaurant.  Its quality is consistent and they are great for take-out or dine-in.  The Penne ala Vodka and tiramisu are delicious.  All the salads are great and I typically order the chopped or Mama's with a meal.   I also like their optional "family-size" portions which are great to share or just to guarantee that you'll have leftovers.

Dinner was just okay for me.  Nothing terrible but nothing great.  I had heard rave reviews about this place and my in-laws were coming into town (who love Italian food) so my husband and I decided to take them to Mama Ricotta's.  Being that it was their 36th anniversary we called ahead to make a reservation and to see if anything special could be placed at the table signifying this event.  We spoke with the manager and spelled out the names of my in-laws and we were told that they would have something put on the table to signify their anniversary (this was after they said they could not print a special menu to say "Happy Anniversary").  Anyway, we were feeling good about that and excited to have a little surprise for them.  However, we showed up and there was nothing on the table.  I let my initial disappoint go and continued to be optimistic with the hopes that the food and service would make up for it.  I cannot say that it did.    

We started with the Calamari appetizer, which was pretty good, lightly battered and generally fresh tasting calamari.  The garlic bread tasted like store bought dinner rolls, which just are not for me; however the oil with chili peppers and fresh garlic was a nice touch.  

On to the entrees, I went with the primavera pasta (one of the only options for a non-red sauce or non-cream based pasta dish), which was in a garlic and olive oil sauce, but it just generally lacked flavor.  My father in-law got the chicken Parmesan, and said he enjoyed it, but he only had about 3 bites out of the 2 pieces of chicken that came with it so I think he was just trying to be nice since we were the ones that picked the restaurant.  My mother in-law had a salad (as she is not a huge eater), which was very nice and she thought it was delicious.  My husband's dish I can say was delicious as well, and may have been the saving grace of the entire meal; he went with the Penne Alla Vodka.  This I would recommend if you like spicy vodka sauce.

On to dessert, I had a Sambuca (which came out luke warm - I prefer it to be chilled) and my husband had a port wine, which was reasonably priced.  My mother in-law got the Kahlua cheesecake which was tasty.  However, after expressing to the waiter that we were there celebrating my in-laws 36th anniversary, he still charged us for the dessert.  On any given day, I, in all honesty, could care less but the fact that they brushed off our request about the anniversary in the first place, you would think that the dessert would be comped.  Oh well, we still had a fun night.  If I go back, I think I will try the pizza, as the pasta truly was mediocre.
This place didn't have the authentic taste I was looking for. The atmosphere is nice but the food quality was lacking.

Here's what I sometimes don't like about visiting a restaurant I've been to before for Charlotte Restaurant Week: the food is okay, but I usually end up wishing I'd ordered off of the regular menu. Then my bill would have been about the same or less, I would have gotten what I wanted, and I wouldn't have had to fight for a reservation at the most popular spots. Had I done that at  Mama Ricotta's, I would have ordered the Warm Goat Cheese and Marscapone Dip and Butternut Squash Ravioli or the Cannolicchi Pesto Di Pomodoro Secco.  My taste buds would have been doing the happy dance, because those are my "go to" dishes at Mama's, and they never disappoint.

Instead, I had the Mozzarella and Tomatoes Salad, which was good and should have been, because that is a tough dish to turn into a hot mess. I also had Mama's Pesto Pasta, which was on the bland side at the restaurant, but the leftovers were much better the next day after overnight marination. My main course was Veal Milanese Primavera, which was just okay. Judge me if you want, but if veal is on a restaurant menu, I'll generally order it. Like lamb or venison, it is something I'm most likely not going to prepare at home, only because I wouldn't know what to do with it. However, I've sampled quite a bit of veal in restaurants, and this veal was nothing special.

One of my dinner companions actually did order off of the regular menu, and chose the Canneloni Al Forno. It pains me to say this, because I generally like Mama's, but it was not good. I didn't even know this was possible, but it was fairly flavorless except for the aftertaste, which to me was sour. My companion disagreed on the aftertaste, but felt that it was below average in general because it lacked flavor.

Other companions had the Penne Alla Vodka and the Pollo Carciofi, which they enjoyed.

The Nutella Pie, though, was more than large enough to share, and was creamy and full of hazelnut and chocolate delectableness, and frankly was what drew me to restaurant week at Mama Ricotta's. As always, the bread was warm, garlicky carbohydrate joy. Service was amiable, if a bit slow on entr√©e delivery and water refills. The half-price wine on Monday nights was also a plus. 

Four stars are being given to Mama Ricotta's for their usual fare. For Charlotte Restaurant Week's offerings, I wouldn't be that generous.

Italian is my favorite kind of food, so it's no surprise that I would frequent this place when I was back home. The pasta, bread and chicken are so delicious. My only gripe was that the restaurant got crowded from time to time, but that's to be expected when you're talking about a fine restaurant such as this one.

My husband took me today to celebrate Mothers Day and I really was excited to come only to be ignored the entire time.  Alex the buzz boy was really nice and helped us the entire time. While we found out that Amanda was our server but we only saw her serving 2 other tables ajd came to drop off one of our appetizers for less than 30 seconds.  Never introduced herself and never offered us bread like the table next to us.  We had 2 other gentleman drop off food and dessert and then we were left hanging at the end.  We had to bring our own bill to the front to pay and didnt know who to tip.  We tipped Alex since we never heard from any other waiter/waitress.  We asked to talk to a mgr and the girl seemed ignorant, uninterested and not knowledgeable about customer service because she never really apologized and said everyone tries to help out.  But this was not the same experience I saw at the other 2 tables who got the real customer service all customers deserve while we were ignored and discriminated.
We are not coming again and it is a shame because the food is not bad.  Very dissapointed.

The food here is really incredible.  There were 5 of us and we were all very impressed.  2 of us ordered the cheese ravioli and then the others ordered a variety of dishes including an appetizer and a salad.  The salad was added after we saw one go by our table!   Every dish was superb.  

When we sat down outside we did have an issue with a smell from some sort of trash container.  The waitress noticed it as well and the restaurant did a few things to eliminate the problem...it was pretty bad...but they were quick to fix it and it did not ruin our meal.  We were just more impressed it went away so fast.

Wonderful dinner Friday night....per usual.  We have been enjoying Momma''s food since 2004. Special salad of arugula and beets was a nice change from the usual. Also the fish special and the ravioli florentine were delicious!. 
Daniel was our server (again) and makes dinner even more of a pleasure.  He is  both knowledgeable and  personable.
Love what you've done with the interior re-design. 
A definite dining pleasure.

Mama Ricotta's has had a change of either ownership or management.  Perhaps both.  Use to look forward to the bruschetta but sadly the ingredients and preparation have changed . . . NOT FOR THE BETTER.  Sad to see it go.  Also slightly downgrade the salads as well since the cherry tomatoes were not as fresh as I recall them being in the past.  The bread has also changed w/o improvement; instead of being hot and doughy with olive oil its now CRUNCHY/WARMED OVER.  There is less chicken and broccoli with more penne pasta in my favorite meal.  SMH.

Basically diners are being served less but are charged slightly more.  The quality of what's being served certainly has not been maintained either.  I DOWNGRADED all of my favorite restaurants for this reason.  Midweek/weekend lunch is $45 + tip.  Staff remains friendly.  AVERAGE.

I have eaten here several times the last 4 years.  Every time I have had a 9 inch Pizza. It's delicious.   I suggest reserving ahead of time on the weekend. The Staff is always nice. The bread and cheesE ravioli were also excellent.

Come
On
People!!!!!!!

This place rocks, it's my top 3 place to
eat in Charlotte why all the 4 grades, it's a total and solid 5.
The food is consistently great, they do
A wonderful job presenting the food, the staff is upbeat, know the menu, fast service.  The chicken  parmesan is amazing, they have all types of spaghetti options. O my gosh! have you tried the Mamatini? That's a martini made out of aged pineapple. Ok, if you don't order the  tiramisu for desert you have missed the best home made treat in the house.
Do I get a free meal for this review
for goodness sakes I'm Italian for
Christ sakes, well not really, but
If I was this would still be a 5.

Try this place you will not be sorry.

Mama Ricotta's is a great Italian restaurant! Tonight I had the penne with chicken and broccoli and my boyfriend had a pizza! Everything was very delicious! I would recommend sitting on the patio and enjoy the great Charlotte weather. Ben, our server, was extremely helpful and nice and it was such a pleasure talking with him throughout the evening.

I was so disappointed. I took someone who had never been to Mama Ricotta's with hopes of impressing them.  To begin, the bread was not homemade. They were white rolls you buy at the grocery store with seasoning put on top. WHITE ROLLS.  My entree was under cooked and my friends entree was not fresh.Proudly hanging in the restaurant were  awards and reviews of MR from 2008. When I ate at MR long ago, it was top notch, not the same restaurant now. I was embarrassed for Mama Ricotta's.

Mama Ricotta's is one of those places that you come back to time and time again when you have a craving for something flavorful and hearty. 
The portions are plentiful, even at lunch when you can  treat a coworker and still have a tab under $20. Pastas are cooked to perfection and the sauces all have a homemade, multi dimensional flavor profile that leave you mopping your dish with the house made herb rolls that are given when you sit down. 
For dinner service there is a much bigger menu with hearty entrees like beef risotto and chicken with chianti mushroom sauce.
A walk past the pizza station provides a brief glimpse of the kitchen, which was bustling with clanking pans and sounds of dishes being made from scratch. This is always a good sign and you can taste the freshness in all the ingredients. 
Service here is excellent ALMOST every time, but my server last night never even cracked a smile. She had a trainee with her and seemed on edge about it, but I hope that isn't a trait that gets passed down. A friendly smile goes a long way with my wife and I.
Overall, Mama Ricotta's is a great local Italian spot to bring your office for lunch or your family for dinner. Definitely make a reservation, even on week nights because this place fills up fast and for good reason!

I don't know what took me so long to dine here!!  It was on my radar but I just never made it in until my employer held our Christmas party there.  The tomatoes and basil in the bruschetta were so fresh and tasty.  I can always gauge an Italian restaurant by their Lasagna and I was very pleased with my selection.  I tried a coworkers steak & mushroom over risotto and I've been craving it ever since.  The vanilla bean cheesecake was delightful and I like the fact the slices were large enough to share.  I can't wait to return with my mom!

Definitely a solid option for an Italian dinner. Had a reservation, but it probably wasn't necessary for an early weekday dinner.

Ordered family style:
Warm goat cheese and marscapone dip - not exceedingly flavorful, good texture, but feel that overall it was a bit restrained
Roasted pepper salad - tasty, with a nice balance of sour and sweet, but was a bit overdressed so that it felt greasy at times
Rigatoni with meat sauce - well-sauced, quite good
Pollo carciofi - good portion size with a light, lemon cream sauce. Only complaint was that the chicken breasts were a bit too thick and therefore felt underseasoned

Place has great service and atmosphere for a family or group dinner and left happy and full.
Food was Amazing. Prices are perfect. Customer service was great. My new favorite restaurant! You should have been there like yesterday.

Love,  Love, Love this place. It is officially my go to when I layover in Charlotte! Since it is nearly always busy, I find myself a seat at the bar and order a nice big glass of wine. Beth has waited in me twice and I thinks she may be one of the nicest people that I have ever met! She knows the menu inside and out and has recommended some outstanding dishes. The first dish she suggested was not on the menu as it was the chef's special. It was a pasta with a braised beef that, I kid you not, was so tender and delicious that I very nearly wept! On my second visit she Nrecommended a chicken dish that reminded me if those Sunday dinners with grandma. You know, when the food is so good and comforting that you just can't push yourself away from the table! Honestly, this is some of the best italian food that I have ever eaten! It compares with some of the meals that I have had in Boston's North End. I almost forgot to mention the Nutella Pie...Oh Dear God ! It is heavenly!

I really want to give this 3 1/2 stars but halves are not allowed. The food was solid ok atmosphere but nothing I would HAVE to go back to. Pretty good wine list and about 5 super tuscans which is cool.

Decided to take my mother out for her birthday and her immediate suggestion was mama ricotta's and I must say her decision did not disappoint. Our server was Amanda and she was such a sweetheart, very helpful! We both had the Pollo Bianco, chicken wrapped in prosciutto and mozzarella over a bed of garlic mash potatoes (I could eat those things for days), with a vegetable of choice (I had mixed veggies and mom had broccoli- I did not care for veggies) all smothered in a mushroom sauce. DELICIOUSNESS!!! And of course we had to order desert, mom got the tiramisu and I got the apple crisp, both spectacular. But the best part is when "I went to the bathroom" but actually was trying to get Amanda, our server, to gather some coworkers to sing my mom happy birthday and a willing young man, Danny, was more than happy too. The two of them really made our night! The service here is great!!! So great that I booked my prom reservations here. The food was great as well! Only downside was no complementary bread, but that's not a big deal overall I would definitely recommend mama ricotta's to anyone!!
Very cute decor, great service, & the pizza is on point!!! Thin, chewy crust with just right amount of sauce.  We ordered the Joe's special and the sausage was absolutely amazing!!!

Old south Charlotte standby ... this is just a great option when you want something comfortable ... but not TOO comfortable (meaning you will eat well here).  Short of fine dining, Mama's is right there with Ilios Noche (now that is SOUTH Charlotte) for our favorite pasta options in town.

The management staff changed over within the last year or so, and the new crew seems to have even stepped it up a notch.  This place seems to be humming along at least as well as ever before.

This isn't about a dining experience with Mama's, but rather a review on their catering department "Plate Perfect Catering" out of the Mama's Kitchen.....

I hosted an event where I work (hush hush on that topic), and for the first time, used Mama's for the catering. I have been working here for 2 1/2 years, always cater events and this was, by far, the best catering I have ever received!!!

Okay, so the staff was very friendly, professional and timely (# 1), the display looked great and we had zero issues with quantity....those are things I expect out of most catering companies......the biggest thing you worry about is the quality and freshness of catered food. 

You usually think: cold, over-heated, dry....and your usual statement is "it was good, FOR catering"

NOT the case this time, it wasn't just good for catering, it was extremely fresh, delicious and good, for consumption. 

The menu: stuffed mushrooms, bacon wrapped scallops, passed shrimp cocktail ( in mini martini glasses, cooked, chilled, snapped to perfection), two types of pastas with a pasta station (nice and hot to order), prime rib carving station (perfectly pink inside),  bbq pork sliders, fresh vegetable display, gourmet cheese platter,spin/art dip, chopped salad and fresh fruit.......

It was ahhh mazing and my client thanked me over and over again and raved about the food (yesssss)

Not to mention, the cost is very reasonable, even with a private chef on site. If you ever need catering for an event, I highly recommend Plate Perfect Catering!

Went with the office to a holiday luncheon.  At 11:130 the week before Christmas, things were hopping, but thankfully, I had made a reservation, so we zipped right in.  Took a chance on the Turkey Meatloaf with spicy pepper gravy served with garlic mashed potatoes and boy was it the right move!

Soooo delicious, it's a shame it's only available at lunch.  That needs to be on the dinner menu for sure, as it was warm, comofrt food with a surprising twist in the pepper gravy (think pureed red peppers, not the black peppercorn kind!)

Melted cheese on each slice was the crowning glory and it was a hefty double portion.  Ate half, and took the rest home for dinner.

we dined at lunch today and had Jovana as our waitress, she was incredible. she suggested for me to get the penne broccoli and chicken, and it was amazing. she kept our drinks filled, despite how busy she was, and she was funny!!! I definitely recommend this place, the food and service will keep you coming back!

I'm always surprised how good the food at Mama Ricotta's is.  I've been there twice, and both times I went in thinking "ugh, this will probably be like a local Olive Garden."  Twice I was pleasantly surprised.

Likes:  The last time we went to Mama Ricotta's, I ordered canneloni al forno (stuffed with grilled chicken, spinach, and ricotta) and my boyfriend ordered pasta primavera.  Both were delicious.  

Dislikes:  Slightly pricey for Italian.  Can be a wait for a table on the weekend.

Take it or leave it:  Take it.  Good food and we always have a great time.  3.5 stars.
Our waiter Peggy was very polite and we enjoyed our food.  I really liked the warm bread.

We were staying overnight in the Charlotte area looking for a casual, Italian restaurant for dinner and chose this place after reading the reviews and we were not disappointed. 

We enjoyed the herb rolls and olive oil that comes complimentary, since we had a late lunch we didn't sample any of the appetizers.  I had the chicken parmesan and my wife had the shrimp scampi with linguine, both were delicious and we would order them again the next time we travel through Charlotte.

The entire staff did an exceptional job taking care of every table, Mama Ricotta's is a great place for an outstanding Italian meal.

Made a reservation for 7:30 via OT, which is something I've become addicted to lately. Upon our arrival we were given a coaster/beeper and went to the bar. Our table was ready in less than 10 minutes.

We were sat at the table just outside the kitchen, which is a pretty ideal place to be. Not only could I read the specials (and prices) on the whiteboard in the kitchen, but our server was always around in case we needed to flag her down.

The mascarpone goat cheese appetizer was... "meh". I encouraged my husband to order it after reading all the rave reviews here. Here's the thing, I hate the "mustiness" of goat cheese. I figured that perhaps the mascarpone cut that flavor, and that everyone was raving over it because it tasted better than I remembered goat cheese tasting. It really didn't. I wasn't thrilled.

My husband got the penne with tomato vodka sauce and some turkey meatballs. I got "Joe's" pizza. Both were very good, and even better the next day as leftovers. Frankly, I was sincerely hoping for a butternut squash pasta special but sadly, that was not to be. Probably only comes up in the fall...

We'll be back. This place is every carb-loader's dream. (Heard the table behind me ordering pasta in preparation for the next day's Corporate Cup half marathon, and we went there for my husband to carb load before his long ride... So if you need carbs, go here!)

For how expensive everything on the menu is, you'd think the food would be worth the money. The rigatoni was a 3 out of 10, the sauce was very plain and when asked to switch the noodles to spaghetti noodles the meal was more like bland spaghetti and ground meat. The carbonara was very salty and tasted similar to ramen noodles with heavy cream. Very dissatisfied with the meal & the price of the food.

The food here is great, the service is friendly but good gracious is it LOUD.  Perhaps I'm used to the old Mama Ricotta's that was much more subdued and intimate, but the noise level in here made holding a dinner conversation very difficult.  That said, the garlic knots are sinfully delicious, the tomato with mozzarella is stellar and the wine list is expansive enough.  We get the penne with chicken and broccoli every time (YUM) and like the standard angel hair pasta as well.  Very excited to come back and try their gluten-free menu next time I'm in town.

By far my favorite place to eat!!! Service is great! Food is amazing!! Especially the mamas house favorites!! Sangria is served here as well! Bruschetta is deff the best I have had! The only con to this restaurant is come Friday or Saturday night the wait is always long. But other then that mama ricottas is perfect perfect perfect! Bon appetit!

We have been to Mama Ricotta many times but last night everything was exceptional.   The waitress, Hayley, was one of the most engaging waitreses we've ever had anywhere.  She informed us it was 1/2 off bottle of wine and made a great suggestion for my sister and I - a delicious Italian Pinot Noir.  My husband is not a wine drinker at all but with her info, he ordered a glass of moscato. He enjoyed it so much, he plans on purchasing it for home. We shared a caprese salad and for dinner we ordered two penne a la vodka with shrimp, fettuccine carbonara with shrimp,  and rigatoni with an extra dollop of ricotta. Everything was finger-licking good. The manager thought we had waited a bit long for our entrees so he came to the table and sent us two desserts.  It was completely unexpected but it shows how they value their customers.  I believe Hayley's attention to detail and personal interest made the entire evening a great experience.  She should be recognized by the managers and her co-workers.

I agree with Nicole about the bar staff friendliness.  They are alway so happy to see you!

I stopped by Mama's for dinner last night and ordered some of the goat cheese dip and the spiedini di carne salad.  Great choice.  I was intending to go for a light dinner when I came in but ended up stuffed.  The goat cheese was the primary culprit.  Very savory.  The salad was solid as well.  The steak was delicious and enjoyed the many flavors the rest of the salad contained - full of grapes, tomatoes, olives, cheese.

Very satisfying!

Very disappointing takeout lunch. I ordered the rigatoni with meat sauce and paid $1.50 for ricotta cheese. Back in my office after quite a long wait I opened the container to find rather mushy pasta and watery sauce: no baked cheese, which it definitely needed. The ricotta was in a plastic cup and must have been all of 1/4 cup. And it was COLD!  Bleah. From now on I will make my own if this is the best I can expect from Mama Ricotta's.

I've been here a ton of times when I lived in Charlotte and it was on my list of places to go once I returned for a visit. The salad and dressing (Mama's Salad with balsamic) is EXCELLENT and the pizzas are on point.

The food here was great...went to another restaurant the day before where I paid 3 times as much, and the food was no were as good as 
mama ricotta's. I will be back ,and very soon!

Amazing service. Our waitress was attentive and we were probably helped by 7 other people over the course of dinner. Food was delicious and very reasonably priced. Nice atmosphere inside. I would definitely come back! Ignore the construction out front!

I was here for a business dinner and we had an incredible time, they seated us on the patio which was cozy and warm and private enough that we were able to be a little loud and celebrate without disturbing other diners. The food was excellent (I had the salmon) and the service even better - especially going out the way to accommodate our group seating request! If I lived in the area I would definitely be back!

I hadn't been to Mama Ricotta's in a while and decided to go with a friend. I had the roasted vegetable flatbread sandwich and it was delicious! Friend had the lasagna and she said it was great. 

The server was very personable and did a great job. I won't wait very long to go back!

Mama Ricotta's is one of our failsafe, don't miss Queen City picks, so I'm a bit surprised that I haven't Yelped it yet. Maybe I just assumed everyone else already knows how good it is? 

The warm garlic rolls with olive oil and red pepper flakes are a welcome starter when you're ready to gnaw your arm off. Last night, our server Danny (who was terrific) added a splash of balsamic to the usual mix, which was a nice addition.  The Mama's side salad is always a refreshing lead-in the main, featuring a quality blend of vegetables and olives. I've tried a few of the house dressings, and as the servers often recommend, the sweet (but not *too* sweet) Italian is their best. 

My husband is a diehard fan of the lasagna here, which is a flavor bomb on a plate. Last night, I went for the pasta special - fresh linguine with grouper in a tomato-basil-and-shrimp sauce. Can't say I ever found any shrimp, unless they were disguising themselves as fish, but the sauce was flavorful and fresh, there were plentiful, large chunks of grouper throughout, and the fresh pasta was delightful.

The pizzas here, too, are winners. We especially like Joe's Favorite. Yes, it's full of meaty, greasy goodness, but the house-made sausage is killer. 

We ended last night's anniversary extravaganza by splitting the legendary tiramisu. The stuff is made of clouds, I swear. Sweet, coffee-soaked clouds. Mama Ricotta's is some of the best we've enjoyed.

Whether we have family visiting from out of town, or are celebrating a special occasion - as we did for our anniversary last night - Mama Ricotta's is one of our go-tos for a good meal.
Probably my favorite Italian place in Charlotte. Great atmosphere, great food and great staff. Can't recommend Mama Ricotta's enough. This is definitely my go to spot for a great Italian meal.

I went here last night for the first time and I am a huge fan.  The bread and oil they bring out is delicious.  I got the lasagna for my dinner and it was SO SO good.  It was a normal sized portion which is nice - usually restaurants bring out crazy big dishes of lasagna and it's gross.  This might be my favorite lasagna I had at a restaurant - the sauce, cheeses and everything was perfect.  They have a really good menu - lots of options and lots of price ranges which is nice, too.

The service was excellent and there is a lot of seating which is good since they probably get super busy on weekends.

Went for dinner last night with sisters and was hoping for some delicious pasta. We ordered white spinach pizza, calamari and chopped salad as our appetizer which were all amazing!  The main course took forever to come out! We waited almost 40 minutes. When our main entrees came out it was a total disappointment. I ordered the carbornara pasta which was soooo salty it tasted like someone threw salt in my
Mouth! My sister Toni ordered the linguine with meat sauce which was also super salty. My other sister and bf ordered cheese ravioli with meat sauce and chicken parm. Both dishes were over cooked... the ravioli was hard and it was not good. We were all hungry so they all ate their dish but I couldn't even eat mine so told
The manager how salty my dish was. He was super nice and offered to remake but by then everyone was done with their dinner and I just didn't feel like waiting longer.  Overall the ambience is great and customer service is great! I would recommend making reservations but def be weary the food is overly salty and you will be waiting a while for your food.
Food was great. Desserts were exceptional. The only negative is the bread sucked. Its a shame it isn't that hard to make a bread that has a taste to it.

Took my wife on a date here and it was more than worth it to drive down from Concord.  The food was excellent and even though it was a busy evening, our server was spot on.  We sat outside where they have a very nice patio.  The prices are reasonable.  I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone and everyone.

We hosted a client lunch here and it went off without a hitch! Our table was ready on time and the service was very accommodating. All of us enjoyed our apps that were pre-ordered, our lunches, and our desserts. I had a small chopped salad with chicken and it was more than filling. Because I didn't know when I'd be visiting again, I had to try the Nutella Pie. It was so freakin' amazing! I shared it with some others at my table and I still had enough to satisfy my never ending sweet tooth with some left to spare. I'm looking forward to the next time I get to go to NC so I can gorge on that Nutella Pie again!

Let me just start by saying I can't WAIT to go here again. My boyfriend brought me here for a relaxed and romantic dinner, and he nailed it. We walked in to a slightly dimmed restaurant with authentic photos decorating the tan walls, beautifully designed red curtains pushed aside and comfortable seating full of chatty families. I loved it. Once we sat down, our waitress, a petite blond lady (whose name I forgot after my delicious sangria) quickly greeted us, got us water, and some of the best bread Ros I've had this year. Good. Ness. I ordered the angel hair pasta with turkey and ricotta meatballs, and my boyfriend got some flat pasta and chicken. The drinks came quickly, and the pasta came quick too. The servicing sizes were generous; my plate was about $13 and I would've easily paid more for it, and was grateful I didn't have to. On top of that, the food was AMAZING. Fresh, authentic and delicious. I might be back next week.
This will be short.  Everything is awesome.  Food, service, atmosphere, everything.  Definitely check it out!

I'd give this 6 stars if I could. I went during restaurant week and had such a positive experience. The bottles of wine were discounted so we were able to share some for the table. Overall great wine list with lots of options.
The restaurant week menu was very VERY good. I have dietary restrictions (no pork/red meat). Usually during restaurant week, people don't accommodate requests. However, Mama Ricotta's made that exception and prepared each dish without meat for me. 
Everything I ate ended up with a plate licked clean. So good.

This has been my favorite restaurant for years! I tried this place back in 2012 when I lived in Charlotte and nothing compares to this place. I currently live in Maryland but every time I come visit Charlotte a visit to Mama Ricotta's is a must. If only there could be a Mama Ricotta's in the DC area! The chicken Parmesan and the angel hair pasta with turkey meatballs are excellent.

I have some mixed feelings about Mama Ricotta's, but ultimately I leave the restaurant pretty happy and satisfied every time.

My biggest complaint is that they took the Butternut Squash Ravioli off the menu... WHY??!?! I truly loved this dish!!  The raviolis themselves were plump and yummy, the squash was rich and creamy, and balanced out with walnuts. Who knows why, no one ever wants to give me a straight answer. Apparently a lot of people still request the dish, so occasionally they will stock the ingredients just to randomly prepare it... but still, I would eat here all the time if they kept this!

Instead I've ordered the Penna Alla Vodka (minus the pancetta) and the Ravioli Alla Fiorentina. These are both pretty good and would definitely recommend them, but they're just not the same!!!

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND The Warm Goat Cheese and Marscapone Dip! This stuff is off the chain amazing! My mouth is watering just thinking about it! 

I like the dark, cozy feel of the restaurant with drum shade lighting. Thumbs up to the high ratio of booth seating. Worst thing about the decor here are the ridiculous pasta paintings. Good God, the color schemes on these things are hideous. Someone needs to remove those, ASAP.

Service here has been mixed, 85% of the time waiters have been quick, polite, and right on. But I have had an occasional dud.

The prices here are a little high, expect to spend over $12 a person minimum. The good news is they have coupons in the Charlotte Citipass book! Buy One, Get One baby! 

Expect a wait on the weekends (10-20 minutes at least). Parking is limited for the volume of weekend customers, so expect a hike.

The staff and dessert were exceptional but the food.....not so much. Perhaps it was because of the Mother's Day buffet, but the food did not impress my family. The buffet was $35 per person!! We were so blessed to have the cook make us lasagna for only $11.50 a plate. We chose to have 3 of our family members (including me) to eat at the buffet and the rest to eat lasagna. The buffet included salads, pastas, ravioli, chicken, salmon, bread, shrimp, brunch items, and of course dessert. The penne a la vodka was very good as was the baked ziti. I didn't really like the ravioli but my family did a lot. The dessert were so delicious and petite, they had 3 mousse varieties, cream puffs, eclairs, chocolate chip cookies, sprinkle cookies, and banana muffins. The lemon mousse was my personal favorite as well as the cream puffs. My family really did enjoy the desserts! As for the lasagna, it wasn't really a showstopper for us. My mom said it tasted pretty weird, but that's ok. Our server Anthony was so nice and on top of the game, we really appreciated his service.  Even though my family had a good time, we won't be back just because of personal preferences.

I went here with my family on a whim. The New Haven style pizza is amazing. I had the Tuscany salad with grilled chicken. It was really good. My sister had the chicken parm and said it was great. The place is packed on the weekend so make a reservation.

We were in Charlotte this past weekend and we were in the mood for Italian, so we went to Mama Ricotta's. I am glad we made the choice to come here. From the moment we walked in, the staff was pretty friendly and accommodating. We got the Burrata & Prosciutto appetizer, it was lovely. Our entrees were Penne Alla Vodka and Rigatoni with Meat Sauce. The ingredients were fresh and flavorful; just like Italian food should be. 

We noticed that the dessert portions were enormous so we asked if we could be served just half of a tiramisu. Our waitress was absolutely accommodating and she made it happen. We weren't expecting to pay half price for the dessert we just didn't want the rest to go to waste, but she did charge us half price. I wish this place was in DC, we would be here all the time.

I'll give them the 4 stars on the house made bread alone. When we arrived they told us the bread was making, so we'd have to wait a moment..I can't say I was overjoyed to hear that. However, I was overjoyed when I tasted it. For my entree I ordered the roasted vegetable sandwich (we were there for lunch). It was splendid! The only thing I would've changed was maybe taking off the lettuce & tomato. I did love how nicely grilled the wrap was &, that the vegetable did not cause it to be soggy. To top it all off the service was excellent.

I got the penne vodka and he got the Marsala with chicken.  It wasn't anything amazing but the service was truly fantastic.  We were here on CIAA weekend and the place was packed at 8:30 at night.  Our water glasses were never more than half empty and our waitress was great and preemptive to our needs.  We will probably go back and try something different next time.

This Italian restaurant is a neighborhood staple. I work right across the street so it's no problem heading over for lunch. It's quick and always with friendly service. Most people are going for the classic pasta dishes. I'm down with the pizza. Not an off-menu item but, Mama Ricotta's is definitely underrated as a good pizza spot. Check out the pie on your next trip

Went last night and it was great. The calamari was delicious. I then decided to order off the restaurant week menu. The shrimp was good, the penne all vodka was amazing, the chicken parm was good (needed more sauce for the chicken but overall good flavor) and the panna cotta for dessert was delicious. The people I was with really enjoyed their meals too.

Throughout our meal multiple workers would offer us water or more bread. Very attentive staff.

Our waitress was Raven. Even if our food wasn't good I would go back just for her. She was delightful throughout our entire dining experience.

Have been on multiple occasions and every visit has been wonderful. The food and service have been consistently good. The bruschetta is delicious as well as the tomato and mozzarella dish. Pizza, pasta dishes, seafood, and dessert- all were great.

This was really an awesome experience.  For the first time in I can't tell you how long every single person we interacted with was warm, friendly and seemingly happy to be there.  We are no strangers to fine dining, so I mean our experience varies from very high end restaurants to your run of the mill Flying Biscuit.
We were on our way to Dolce and they were closed for New Years so we headed over to Mama Ricotta's on a whim.
Rachel was our server and she was incredible, very sweet, totally knowledgable and seemed like she really loved food.  She was excited about their features, the ingredients used, the fact that they make their bread and mozz in house-just really genuine and lovely.  Our service was spectacular at every single stage.
The food runner was delightful, typically they drop the food unceremoniously but he was such a doll and really sweet the few times he stopped by our table.
The manager and hostess were both so polite, I was so happy to share our positive feedback with them.
My fiance who likes to eat and get the hell out of there was happy to linger over the most incredible tiramisu, it was just so cozy and comfortable!

Ordered the goat cheese and mascarpone app (10 out of 10) the Tuscan salads (10 out of 10) and we each had that Rigatoni (he had the meat sauce, I had vegetarian marinara which was no problem for them.  I graded it a 5/10, just boring and he thought it was wonderful) and the awesome lightly and fluffy tiramisu (10 out of 10)

Next time I will do the salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus, we are planning to return this Thursday and I already can't wait! 

THANK YOU!

We had a party of 5, so I made reservations in advance but we were still seated in the bar area right next to the restrooms. It was a little loud, and people were constantly walking by to get to the restrooms. The waitress had a hard time serving us due to the table configuration (not her fault and she was very attentive). Appetizers and entrees were tasty and plentiful, and the wine pour was decent! I had the penne vodka topped with shrimp, which I can see why it was a signature dish. Leftovers the next day were just as good. The desserts were good, but nothing I haven't had before. The apple crisp (which was my pick) was served so hot that the ice cream quickly became soup and it actually burned my mouth so bad that I had blisters by the time I left. Tasting anything after that was a bit difficult.

I'll go back to try other dishes, as the food was well priced and tasty. I gave this 3 stars because the food and service were good, but couldn't get past my burnt mouth and being crammed into a corner table in the bar area with constant foot traffic area even after making advanced reservations.

To avoid the wait we were asked if bar area was okay. We said sure. So we waited for our server and waited and waited. She appears and we order drinks. She comes back to take our food orders, never goes over any specials. We didn't even know there was s special until another waiter told his tables. We ask if we can get sausage added in to the penne ala vodka and she says yes. It comes, sauce is thick and paste like. The Italian sausage that was too be added tasted just like smoked game. It was not good. Then we waited and waited again for the bill. Too bad, based off of other reviews we were excited to try it.

Delicious food, pleasant staff! Every encounter I've had with this restaurant has been a positive one. I'm that person who has lots of questions and everyone was patient and more than helpful with suggestions. The Penne Alla Vodka with Shrimp is absolutely delicious btw!
First time here and service was exceptional. Food was great! The staff were very accommodating, I left the place very satisfied.

I'm not a fan of italian food, even after spending a month in italy.
I remember coming here as a kid with my parents and never liking it. 
Somehow, after a few other places fell through, my husband and I's rehearsal dinner before our wedding was held here.
 I was pretty bummed since I knew I didnt like it but didnt want to upset my husbands parents who choose it and would be paying.

I don't remember everything we had, but it was all DELICIOUS. The salads, pastas and meats, and desserts were ALL really good. Everyone else agreed too and raved about the food for weeks after. I'm glad I gave this place another try, and now I will definitely be returning more often!

Great food and service!  Our server Tiffany recommended the penne a la vodka for me, and the chicken parmesan for my husband since he does not like spicy food. She also recommended the wine feature, which I had a glass of and my husband enjoyed the local draft selections. Tiffany was friendly and made us feel at home. She went the extra mile to keep our drinks full and checked in to make sure we were happy with our meals. The penne a la vodka was so delicious. I am Italian, and it's great to find a local restaurant that reminds me of family dinners growing up. I highly recommend Mama Ricotta's!

The food was absolutely delicious! We made a 7:15 reservation but weren't seated until 7:40 which bummed us out at first but once we had our food it wasn't as big of the deal. We managed to squeeze our way near the bar for a drink while we waited. 

I got the Amma's Cheese Ravioli with meat sauce and the BF got the Penne Alla Vodka. Both were so good. We will be back when we are craving Itlian.
Great food! Our server David was very attentive. He recommended the vodka penne pasta, wine and Mama's salad! Definitely going back and requesting Dave.

Let me be clear: the 2nd star is based solely on the efforts of the staff to turn around our abysmal food experience. Based on food alone it would be a single star, however the staff really tried to make it up to us.

My husband and I ate here this evening. First off we were accosted by a quasi-speed metal song that was completely inappropriate to the setting. 

We were seated promptly without a reservation and the waiter quickly took our order.

The server brought some cold, salty garlic rolls. Not an encouraging start to the meal but we plowed ahead -- my husband ordered chicken parmesan and I ordered butternut squash ravioli. The chicken was breaded in what looked to be almost a cracker or corn flake crust rather than breadcrumbs, making it heavy. The plate was just a big pile of spaghetti topped with this chicken wedge glued with red sauce. Not attractive, adequately tasty.

My ravioli was barely cooked. Some parts weren't cooked at all, making an unappetizing paste-y glob. The server was quick to notice something amiss and  quickly replaced the plate with another entree, the eggplant parmesan. Way too salty and an unholy mess of cheese and overcooked spaghetti.

The side of spinach was also much too salty and I finally threw in the towel, completely defeated by this awful meal. Maybe it was an off night but the people around us didn't seem to be having the same issues with their meals. If this is the best Italian food that Charlotte has to offer, than I am forewarned. 

The manager came over and asked if there was anything he could do, offered to comp us a dessert and generally tried to make things right. It was unfortunate that the meal was unsalveageable.

Second time visiting Mama Ricotta's in a week!!  Can you say we LOVE this place!!??  The chopped salad is to die for!!!  A must try!!  We split the small sale three ways and it was plenty.  The penne Alla vodka with chicken is amazing!  I make my own, and the one at Mama Ricotta's is head to heads with mine, delicious!!!  The chicken used in the cheese Ken Romano is superior quality, so tender, full of flavor, juicy.  The tiramisu came highly recommended and it did not disappoint!!!  You MUST save room for this dessert.  Fabulous Italian restaurant in midtown.

Let me just say, the wine and company of my friend were the best parts of our experience.  

The complementary bread was dry, crumbly and not very good. 

The Bruschetta was absolutely terrible!!! The bread was soggy and topped with tons of acidic tomatoes. I was surprised when the waitress brought it out to us, there was no buffalo mozzarella. I asked her where the cheese was?  She said it doesn't come with any, and she came back out with a tiny condiment cup full. That was a nice gesture, I suppose. 

My friend absolutely loves tomatoes, and I could tell she was completely put off by this dish from the look on her face from the first bite.  We both only ate one to be polite.

I have been coming here since it was in its old location (the fantastic Indian restaurant Maharani now inhabits the space) and it is definitely a Charlotte mainstay.  I'm not the richest of people and I always find something affordable and yummy here.  I love their garlic rolls, their lasagna and their desserts are some of the best in town (big portions, too - good to split with a friend or on a date).  I always leave the place with leftovers... I like a place that can feed me twice.  

My only beef with them is that they took my FAVORITE pizza - the Balsamic glazed pork bbq pizza - off the menu.  Why!!!  Sometimes it can get a little crowded and quite loud, but the service is always nice and prompt and the food more than makes up for it.

I do not have much to say about this place other than the food is horrible.

the people are nice but the food is horrible if you are itialian and the cook is not even itialian.

stay away if you want real itialian food.
Pasta primavera and garlic bread were delicious. Our server, Ben, was fantastic. Highly recommend! The best Italian Restaurant in Charlotte!

Wow this place is pretty good, doesn't look so pleasant from the outside but once you go inside it looks and feels pretty nice inside. The goat cheese bread appetizer is highly advisable to get and its an outstanding choice. For dinner I had the lasagna, it's made with their hand made sausage and its loaded with cheese. If you're looking for a diamond in the rough kinda place to eat, this is your choice.

My wife had the ROASTED VEGETABLES sandwich with hand-cut potato chips and it was excellent.  I ordered the Calamari (not the Rhode Island-Style) and PENNE, BROCCOLI & CHICKEN and I was not very impressed with either one.  I like my calamari crispier and the chicken was cubes of chicken instead of strips and it was not roasted.  They served rolls of (looked like the kind you buy frozen) bread instead of the homemade loaf of bread you will normally find at an Italian Restaurant.

Been to Mamas dozens of times over the past 10 years.
The last few times out experience was just fair.
Last night we went there for a birthday dinner...mistake
1st thing they put the 7 of us in a small table for 6 max...how to you have any room for the food? DUH (plus the place was not even busy)
They did accommodate us after my request to put 2 tables together.
We ordered a few appetizers to start...one of them being the mozzarella and tomatoes, we ordered the big portion and asked for the red peppers addition as usual. The order came to the table with 3 small slices of mozzarella and banana peppers. I again had to request a correction. I don't mind paying restaurant markups...but come on a few tomatoes and the paltry amount of cheese for like 9 bucks...shame on you.
When the entrees came the runner looks at us like make room. Of course the table was full because the the app and salad courses had not been cleared.
Going to a restaurant should not be about correcting step by step...it should be about having relaxing and fun time.
There are many good choices in Charlotte, unfortunately Mama Ricottas looks like it may no longer be one of them.
We've been to Mama Ricotta's multiple times and it's been delicious every visit.  We will definitely be back!

My family and I went to Mama Ricotta's for Mother's Day dinner this past Sunday. I made a reservation through opentable which apparently didn't go through properly, however the host was very accommodating and able to get us a table on the patio. I do not hold the faults of open table against them. I want to start by saying that for the most part, the food was excellent. My mom had the penne a la vodka and it was amazing. I had the chicken parm which was also very good. This being said, my daughter's meal was ice cold (it was a grilled cheese) by the time the replacement came out everyone had already finished their meal and she was full from eating off everyone else's plate. The reason I am giving this place two stars is because of the service. Being that it was a holiday none of us were expecting the service to be super speedy, but our server was not only slow, but not attentive and rude. He never once wished us a happy Mother's Day, he didn't introduce himself, instead of asking what anyone wanted to drink he just brought waters, and anyone who wanted anything else they had to take it upon themselves to order it. If we needed a refill, we had to wave the server down and ask for it. Not to mention the fact that he came and refilled our water glasses with warm water. (We we're sitting on the patio where it was 80 degrees). He was not the server who delivered our food, and he never followed up to even ask us how our food was, or if we needed anything else. It was only after we complained to the manager that he even came to our table. The manager addressed the issue with the server, and he returned with a very sarcastic tone making sure to emphasize how our water now had ice in it and was cold. Our servers name is Stewart. It is because of him that I, nor anyone in my family, will return to this restaurant. This is a shame considering how good the food is, but being paying customers, I believe we deserve to be treated much better than that. If you do go to this restaurant and you have Stewart as a server have zero expectations of good service. I will also be posting this review on Facebook and google, because of how offended I am by how my family was treated.

Finally made it to MR's!  Wow!  It was sooooo good!  I can't wait to go back!  They even brought me a canolli for my birthday.  Service was great too!  I'm so hungry just thinking about that chicken parm I had.  YUM!

I am a big fan of Mama Ricotta's. The location does it ZERO justice (strip mall). But the interior is great and I actually love the outdoor seating - considering the Kings Dr. location.

They have really good pizza. Perfect for take out. I adore the angel hair pasta with added chicken. The rigatoni with meat sauce is also delicious. I normally choose one of those two. Though I have tried some others like the Pasta Fra Diavolo which was good.

The boyfriend loves the calzones. Which is totally random - but whatever, it lets me get to go to Mama's!

I went once for Brunch and had the richest stuffed panini french toast ever. Ohhh was it good!! 

Worth a visit for sure!
Everything was wonderful.  Had my birthday dinner here, party of 20. The staff were accommodating,  Mark was attentive and the food.. yum.com. Love dining here!

Our first time here and the food was amazing we mainly had pasta dishes my one daughter had a white pie that was delicious. All the dishes were delicious and I would recommend it to anyone to try, service was great and they have a outdoor seating area which was pretty cool.
Love everything about this place! The food is great and has been the only really good Italian place we have found that is not overly fancy. Have brought all of our visitors here for a nice dinner!

Found this place on yelp while on vacation in charlotte.  We wanted Italian since we had satisfied our palates on other foods throughout our trip.  Don't be fooled with the strip shop location, this is a nice little place very close to downtown charlotte.

I had the chicken parm-- way to much for me to finish.  Which was a shame since I was not going to travel with my leftovers.  Wife got the oxtail ragu dish, she was not a big fan of.  Fatty beef, etc.  our two small kids are just fine with buttered spaghetti noodles and parm cheese.

Wait staff was very good.  Highly recommend this place if you're looking for some nice Italian.  Family friendly, but you can also do a date night here just as easy.

I've been going here since 2000 but never have fallen in love with it like everyone else. Maybe I'm weird. Maybe I've got a very sensitive palette. Maybe I'm just not average, but I find Mama Ricotta's well below average and very very very salty.  I'm not someone who shies away from salt- I always have it on my eggs, etc.  But it seems like recently, everything at Mama's is over seasoned.  A lot of the dishes like the Pasta Primavera is very unremarkable so generally I like the chicken carciofi the best, but perhaps because of the capers it is so salty I can never finish it. I went there for a business lunch (basically the only reason I'll go) and had a roasted beet salad. I thought I was in the clear with a salad, but no- it was so salty too! A salad?? And not a nicoise salad?? It was very strange and it was very overdressed. Perhaps next time I'm forced to go, maybe I should try a sandwich? 

The other complaint i have about this place is the service. One time recently the server was really inattentive. The second time, the server was really bitchy (and it was a guy). I've never understood how someone who relies on tips is smug and rude. Anyway that paired with the mediocre food means I'm never going to intentionally go here. I'd opt for Fiamma, Luciano's or Hawthorne's Pizza before here any day.

Place has a great atmosphere. The customer service we received from Rachel and Kevin was outstanding.  The food was good, however the lasagna was a little burnt at the bottom, but all around good at the top.  Don't let my comment turn you away it could be all that yummy cheese falling around and gathering down...it is a place to try.

Great Italian cuisine! My first visit to Mama Ricotta's was this past Saturday and it was a wonderful experience. The staff were very nice and the food was outstanding! I had a steak special and the flank steak was tender and flavorful.  I also tried my friends pasta's and they beat Olive Garden or Carraba's no question. The bread pudding desert topped it off. I will definitely be returning.

Here's the deal, I've been going to Mama Ricotta's  for over a year. My family has celebrated many birthday dinners here. Why? Because the food truly is outstanding! Now over this past year I have constantly found that that great food is not enough for my to want to be a frequent customer. The service leaves something to be desired to say the least. Just tonight I felt like I should be honored that I could dine at MC's and not the other way around. I'm not looking for a 5 star experience but I am looking to be treated like a customer and not another transaction. My wife and I are pretty easy going as we both worked food service during college. Even tonight when the service was bad we still tip 20%. As we left the hostess couldn't even be bothered to look up from her phone to say have a good evening... instead she mumbled it to the stack of menus. I will continue to visit because I do enjoy the food but I think it terms of customer experience a local chick fil a has them beat x10. This is not the first time my family has felt like this after eating at Mama Ricotta's but I thought it was time to say something. Oh and it was weird that our waitress sat the tea pitcher on the ground near my table and left it sitting there unroll another table asked for a refill... just seems unsanitary.

If your looking for great food it's here as long as you are ok with just being another transaction. For me it just means we don't visit as often and are on the look out for a replacement.
Very casual, great Italian food with huge portions. The rub a wine special on Wednesdays. Great area to eat and walk around as well

I'd heard a lot of good things about this place so when I had the opportunity to plan an event for a group of my girlfriends Mama Ricotta's immediately came to mind!

I'm happy to report that this place didn't disappoint! I'd made reservations online and they called to confirm my reservations early that afternoon. When we arrived our table was ready with no wait! 

Our waiter was kind enough to go over all the specials and give us time to look over the menu. For such a large party, I was glad to see that our glasses were never empty and all our orders were right when they hit the table. 

I ordered the lasagna. It's not your typical lasagna, they call it "southern Italian style" and it's a mix of beef, veal and homemade sausage with a cheese blend on a bed of sauce. It was very meaty and cheesy as it should be with a classic sauce. I enjoyed every bite. Add to that those freaking addicting garlic roll (perfect for dipping) and I'd absolutely order it again. 

There were a lot of other dishes on our table that looked amazing so I'm definitely coming back for more goodies...and some dessert!

Believe the hype.  Best Italian in Charlotte (that I've had*).

Got some penne w/ Vodka that was straight doooope (word to the wise:  'add dat meat')

I would highly suggest that one goes here.

If you are looking for great Italian in Charlotte that is NOT a chain like Carabba's or Olive Garden, you have found it at Mama Ricotta's! How could you not love it with Ricotta in the actual name! I first went on a date with a boyfriend and really enjoyed it. But it wasn't until, when I eventually tried the Goat Cheese and Marscapone dip months later, was it necessary that I return weekly to satisfy my craving. If you are a big fan of cheese or pizza (who isn't?) then you will LOVE this. It's like creamy little salty, sweet heaven on a crustini. Dang, now I'm hungry... 

Moving on now... the service is always impeccable and the people are very friendly. I always spot the same two men observing and attending to the guests in the dining room. I could never figure out if these men are the managers or the actual owners, but I like that they are always visible. 

I have frequented Mama Ricotta's on busy weekend nights but seem to never have to wait for a table. The prices are reasonable. I suspect you could dine there for 2 at about $50 to $70. 

I highly recommend Mama Ricotta's if you live in the uptown or Dilworth area for awesome Italian but I also highly suggest fitting in lots of cardio the following day. ;)
I don't get all the hype, it wasn't that good. I expected extraordinary Italian  food and that wasn't the case. Only 3 stars on the first visit. I will give them another try based on the hype.

I came here thanks to Yelp reviews. This restaurant is delicious omg I found my new Italian spot. I brought my family here and they absolutely loved it.
