I ordered chicken penne with broccoli but subsisted the chicken for shrimp and it was literally the best thing ever! My son finished his whole pizza. I ate his crust and even that was so good. I'm already planning my next trip back here.

I was expecting to be blown away after reading some of the reviews but I hate to say that wasn't the case. The food OK, you can get the same quality from some of the nationally chains that are out there. SO the search continues for a authentic Italian food.

My husband and I came here for dinner before going to the Knights game. He usually stops in for the lunch specials from the Metropolitan and wanted to show me the place. We were sat right away and given bread and oil. It was ok, I don't think it was typical olive oil, but mixed with something else. 

We ordered the calamari, and we split the spaghetti and meatballs. The calamari was good, my favorite part of the meal in fact. Done the Italian way, flash fried, and with marinara. The meatballs were turkey prosciutto, and it just wasn't the same. I tried. My husband said he liked them. 

They do have $3 domestic pints on Thursdays which included OMB. My husband was happy about that.  The waitress was good, friendly.

Great food, great service, and great atmosphere!! If you want great Italian food this is the place to come to. Bruschetta is a must have, and you need to end the meal with a scrumptious slice of tiramisu for dessert!

This is some of the best Italian food I have ever had, and being from NJ, I have had quite a bit of Italian food. The atmosphere is laid back, and the service in impeccable. Our server Daniel was fantastic and I will be requesting him the next time I go.

I had the Penne Vodka which was great, and the Tiramisu was delicious. My wife had the special, which was braised short ribs and was also a hit.

I can't wait to go back.
Even though we sat at the pizza bar on a Tuesday night. It was great! This had to be the best cooked pasta I have ever had in a restaurant! Coming back next time in the area

Love this restaurant. You can always expect great service and even better food! We love to get the family size penne a la vodka with shrimp to share. Every server we've had has been very helpful and attentive without being pushy or annoying! Always look forward to going for casual date nights :) 
PS don't leave without ordering a cannoli- or two!

Service was good. Loved the ambience, but I just wasn't impressed with the food. Had the penne vodka and it was just ok. Also ordered a cheese pizza and it was soggy and bland. The best thing I had was the goat cheese appetizer which was very flavorful. My dining companion had the shrimp scampi and said it was ok but lacked in flavor. Overall not sure what the "hype" is about. I've had better Italian at pizzerias. Would maybe return for drinks bc I loved the ambience of the restaurant.

Maybe we came on an off night? We used to really like their lasagna and pizza. The visit before this one, they changed brands of Gorgonzola and  the pizza was too pungent to finish.  This visit we noticed the menu is getting lighter and lighter and not for the better. Even the rolls were almost stale. Glad we did not get the bread pudding for that probably would have been off too. I will say our server was great and very attentive.  Guess I will stick to a salad, appetizers and bread pudding.
This restaurant serves amazing pasta! I recommend the spinach tagliatelle carbonara. The pasta is fresh and delicious. I'll come again and try pizza. I heard they're great too.

Excellent Italian! I highly recommend the ravioli and the polenta was out of this world!! Both were close to the best I had ever had. The spaghetti and meatballs was ok. And the nutella pie was an obvious hit! Try Mama Ricotta's for dependable, quality Italian food in Charlotte!

A friend and I met here for early dinner before an event at Blumenthal. Our waitress was very helpful and friendly in assisting us with our wine and entree courses. We were very disappointed in our pizza. The crust was definitely burned and we pointed that out to waitress who immediately offered to have another made for us . We were constrained by time and didn't want to leave a pizza in the car for several hours. She had manager comp us a free dessert which we were going to get anyway. I know this restaurant has been a mainstay for Charlotte residents and visitors for years and have frequented it myself many times over the years. This anomaly of burned pizza was a shock because I expect more from a restaurant of your reputation. Surely quality should be a given. At the very least we shouldn't have had to pay for it since we left half of it there and ate only toppings of the rest.

I was in town for an interview and picked this place at random for some Italian food, which I have been starved for since moving to NC from P A. I had pasta with a wonderful carbonara sauce. I'll go here again. Manager Marco is a really nice guy, great service from Beth at the bar. Super quick service, friendly staff. A winner.
We dined there yesterday, and my husband got severe food poisoning. It was the last day of restaurant week, and the restaurant was packed, so I'm not sure if they mishandled the food in the process.
Good place for lunch. I recently went for the first time and the service and food were good. Convenient location and nice ambiance.

This was our third visit to Mama Ricotta's. We took my husband there for Father's Day. We were greeted and seated by their hostess, Madison, who was wonderful!! She was so hospitable, friendly, professional and super attentive. She greeted us immediately with a warm smile and checked on us twice during our meal to make certain we were having a great dining experience. She rocks! The food was once again excellent! I had the shrimp scampi and my husband had chicken parm which was also excellent. Our kids had penne alla vodka which they loved!! The food and hostess were a 5, but our server brought our experience down a notch. We did not have reservations and it was packed so we opted to sit in the cocktail lounge. The server there was very slow, inattentive and overall not good. He didn't listen well and we had to repeatedly ask for refills and ice. He never checked on us. He just didn't seem committed. Other than that everything else was excellent.

It has been a really long time since I have eaten at Mama Ricotta's, and I can't believe that I had not previously written a review for it! So, when I found myself in the area around lunch-time today I decided to stop in and see what's on the menu these days.

For lunch, they have several sandwich options as well as yummy looking pizza selections. However, I haven't had pasta in a while, so I decided to go for that instead.  I was sort of in the mood for a red sauce, but as I perused the menu, nothing in that category jumped out at me. Instead, the chicken & broccoli penne pasta was calling my name.   So, I went with it and sure am glad that I did.  The sauce was somewhat creamy - but not too heavy.  It had a lot of garlic (yum) and a nice lemony flavor.  I enjoyed it very much.   At lunch, this entr√©e was $8 and I had enough to take some home for later. 

Since I was by myself, I just sat at the bar.  The guy behind the bar was a bit busy since he was taking care of all the take-out orders.  The service was a bit "meh" but that's what I get for sitting at the bar. Next time, I would skip the bar area and just get a table instead.

This would be my second time going. I went with a friend around 3pm for a late lunch. The first server who was with us seemed to be off--as in I sort of got the vibe that he didn't want to serve us. We knew what we wanted and after telling him he stated he didn't have his notepad and pen to write it down and that he would be back. He didn't come back and we were given another server, Anthony. Anthony brought us our drinks and fresh bread. He was such a great server and really compensated for the weird interaction with the previous server. Anthony was very attentive throughout the whole time we were there and would be one of the reasons we would return! 

We started off with the calamari. The calamari was DELICIOUS. It was plated beautifully and for an appetizer the portion is well worth your money. The calamari was well fried and I personally enjoyed dipping it into the marinara sauce that was also came with the dish. For our meals I got the angel hair pasta with the tomato basil sauce and chicken and my friend got the ravioli. For my pasta, the amount of chicken was a generous amount and made well. The pasta was cooked to perfection and overall tasted really good. I would definitely recommend this dish.

For our lunch ended up being around $30 which is not bad for the amount of food we got. As for parking-- there is a lot of space behind the restaurant if the spaces upfront are full.

We decided on Italian for the evening since my brother is a vegetarian and no one else was interested in dining at the Penguin Drive-Thru or Price's Chicken Coop.

The atmosphere is very relaxing and comfortable. I am a fan of dim lighting, it's very calming and soothing. We are immediately greeted by our server who wasted no time with the drink and food specials of the evening.

I opted on the alcohol because I was still feeling nauseous from the 6 hour flight. We decided on sharing a large pepperoni and sausage pizza with a family style portion  of their Rigatoni with this sausage meat sauce. 

Service was great, the refills and warm herb bread with a spicy chili oil kept coming. I was stuffed but satisfied. Not bad for my first Italian meal in North Carolina.
Very good food.  We had lasagna, chicken with spaghetti and rigitoni.  Appetizer goat cheese in sauce was excellent   Waitress was very attentive.  Very casual and relaxing.

I had heard really fantastic things about Mama Ricotta's. Being new to Charlotte and looking for a great place to celebrate my birthday, a few friends and myself decided to try it out.

I'm giving it 2 stars not because of the food, the food was amazing - rather, it was the way we were treated by the staff. Our server was impatient, hurried us along in our orders, and really just seemed to be bothered by the fact that we were there at all. When asked if we needed more time and we responded with "yes," they were visibly annoyed by our request for a few more moments. Twice, the servers also sat the plates down in front of the wrong people (definitely not a big deal, it happens). It was just the reaction when we started rearranging plates that was surprising - they treated us as if we were wrong, as if we hadn't known what we ordered. 

Upon walking in, the hostess seemed to be inconvenienced by the fact we had no reservation. Rather than adopting an accommodating attitude, she really tried to undersell the section we were seated in. Numerous times, we all felt very rushed during our time there as she was constantly peeking around the corner, very obviously checking to see how close we were to finishing our meals.

Long story short, not impressed by the staff. Luckily, the food is so good I'm sure I'll probably return - but, next time, just for takeout.

Used to like this place. The food is 6/10 but it's pretty reasonable. Called three times recently to place a take out order, was put on hold, and then hung up on. Obviously they don't need my business. I won't be calling or going there again.
Food was good but service subpar. Sat next to previous owner. Staff including manager so far up his butt that our food took forever. Service was awful. Following example of leader. Won't be back.

I'm disappointed. I've been here three times now and the first two times were amazing. I'm not kidding, they took care of us, the waiter was friendly and they even changed out my salmon when it wasn't up to their standards,again amazing. BUT this third time was not a shining star like I'd hoped it would be. 

I brought my cousins from out of town they love Italian food! I had such nice service the two previous times I just knew they'd love it here because of the good food and the good service. 

Our server was very neglectful. It took her a very long time to come take our drink order. Which we weren't ready for because they didn't give us a cocktail list. So we order appetizers, calamari and the bruschetta, and she got the cocktail menus, brought them to us, and left again. Our appetizers came and her second return took much too long again. So we ordered drinks and She carded me, my boyfriend and my cousin which is fine,I'm 26, he's 23, and he's 22, so we're all used to that and I don't fault her for it. She took our drink orders, and food orders and walked away without taking our menus from us or saying another thing. Now it was four of us sitting at our small table with two appetizers, a bread bowl and bread plates and all the extras you can think of on the table. There was no where for us to put anything let alone menus we no longer needed. My boyfriend asked the hostess who was walking by to take the menus and mentioned that our waitress wasn't really caring for us. 

Next thing I know the manager came over and apologized for the lack of caring and for her not taking the menus which seemed super nice. It reminded me of the other times we were here when they took such good care of us.  But that wasn't really why he was at our table that was just glanced over. He really just wanted to see our IDs too. I'm a reasonable person and I understand needing to be carded but by TWO different people at a very nice sit down restaurant just seems over kill to me. Especially when my already non caring waitress walked away acting like she's going to put our orders in. At least warning us that you just want you manager to check our IDs would have made it feel less degrading. Honestly this whole thing made me feel pretty down on this place. It's really disappointing and severely changes my opinion of this place which sucks because we really loved it before this. 

The food was good and thats the only reason it's four stars and not three, but I just don't need to pay that amount of money to feel degraded and unhappy after I have a meal somewhere.

Traveling with my fianc√© to visit my sister and I made this reservation on open table. When we arrived we waited a few minutes for our table which was completely fine. The patio was being re-done and while I like al fresco dining probably couldn't do it there as it was just too hot for me. The restaurant has a lively, buzzing sound to it. While I won't say it isn't for romantic nights out, it's not a quiet place. 

When we sat water was brought over for everyone. The girls ordered a bottle of wine, and we started with an order of calamari. Rhode Island style. The balance between the hot peppers and calamari was perfect. Not over cooked. And a very good flavor. I had a carbonara which I added chicken too. Fianc√© had a chicken dish that was very good. And my sister did the restaurant week menu. Everything she had was great. Everyone had enough to take home. The service was absolutely phenomenal. Raven was on point, humorous, engaging, and always there when we needed her. 

The one negative about this place, and it can't be a negative in a sense, is the Togo is done at the bar and it took me a few minutes to get a drink while waiting for a table. I wish there was another bartender on or someone just for Togo help. When I visit my sister I will try and make it back there again.

First time patrons. We were talked into sitting on the patio which was quiet at first, but as the evening ensued so did the noise level. Next time I want to try indoors ambiance. A spider came down on me during dinner. Food was good, very good. Service was just okay. He brought dinner not only before salads were finished, but before starter plates were cleared. (Servers should run their own food - not food runners).  So the food runner came running out with our plates and I lifted my appetizer plate so he could set it down and it nearly missed the table and hung there off the edge. But we'll be back to try again... this may have to be a carry out experience to be totally content.

Mama Ricotta's sets out to be good old fashioned Italian home cooking, an admirable and delicious goal no doubt.  The problem is that they don't really set them selves apart from what your average Italian girl (or guy) ::raises hand:: can actually make in their home.

The pasta special, a tilapia, shrimp and scallop spaghetti dish with a slightly spicy sauce, was the exception to this rule. It had a delicious sea flavor and I regret not having ordered it as my dinner. My penne vodka sounded enticing, promising pepper vodka and including pancetta, but the sauce ended up being unsensational.  Looking at the rest of the menu, I saw a lot of familiar characters: lasagna, angel hair with red sauce, and chicken romano to name a few, but few options that jumped out and screamed that I needed to try it.

I love Italian food at least as much as the next girl but if I am going to go out for it I want to be impressed and while Mama Ricotta's provided a good meal it didn't shine.

Mama Ricotta's is my ideal Italian restaurant. From the layout of the interior, to the style of service, to the quality of the food- this place has it all. If overall fitness and money weren't an issue, you would probably find me eating here 6 out of the 7 nights a week. Love Italian!!!

The food is absolutely great. Each table receives free bread appetizers and are served with a very tasty EVOO. Ask for a little balsamic on the side and you can literally make a meal out of this in itself! 

Additional appetizers and salads, such as the Fried Calamari & the Sicilian Roasted Pepper Salad, are also very, very good. For an entree, I had myself a basic vodka blush sauce over angel hair dish that was absolutely phenomenal. 

The menu is pretty broad and you won't have a hard time finding something you like if your a picky eater. It is somewhat on the pricey side, but rarely will you be dissapointed with the meal in comparison to the cost.

Despite the location (nestled in a small shopping center), the overall layout is perfect for Italian atmosphere. The interior is dolled-up in a very elegant, but not over elegant way. The noise is adequate and seating can be a little tight at certain times, i.e. a Saturday night. The exterior & outdoor seating are decorated with lattice and vine, has good lighting, and is great weather permitting.

They have a full bar (inside) to accomodate your choice of drink, and offer different specials per day of the week. 

Overall, this is my new favorite in Charlotte for dine-in Italian. A must!

BEST Italian restaurant in the area.  everything I've had here has been delicious, especially the tiramisu!  not only is the food authentic, the waitstaff is pleasant and at the table the perfect amount of time.

also - my husband and I brought my grandparents here when they were visiting from out of town.  they've travelled all over the world and were apparently raving about this place to my parents - weeks later!  count that as an extra testament to how awesome this place is.

we've lived within 30 minutes of this place for 6 years, but only recently heard about it from a friend.  all of our family lives out of town and we always struggle to think of reasonably priced restaurants to take people to when they visit - we'll be bringing all of our future visitors here!

Came here for New Year's Eve dinner with 12 guests.  We were immediately seated (had prior reservations), and were surprised that they had a special menu.  I had been under the assumption they had a normal menu in addition to their special menu, but that was not the case.  

Nevertheless, we all had a great time.  I had a chicken dish with polenta, which wasn't anything special, but it wasn't bad.  I would, however, steer clear of their pizza dish of the night, which was truffle oil, pancetta, wild mushrooms and fingerling potatoes.  I think it might have something to do with seeing it reconstituted by a friend later that evening.  

Good service, and good, if not memorable, food.

Phenomenal food! I don't know why I haven't heard much about this place before. I'm definitely going to be here again for whenever I want Italian. It only loses 1 star for the overpriced alcoholic drinks, otherwise it was a great experience!

The food here was just adequate. And the ridiculous part of our lunch was that the check  was delivered before the meal! What's that about? The waiter said they get really busy so they bring the check first. I've been eating out in restaurants for many years and no one has every brought the check before a morsel of food was eaten. The menu states that whole wheat pasta is available but never mentions it's a $1.50 up charge. I might return someday but I won't be anytime soon.

Wonderful meal!  Lasagne had a nice texture to it, sauce was fantastic!  Chicken parm was great as well!  Hands down great meal!  Our server was also wonderful!  Very attentive!  Staff worked as a team and all were very friendly!  The Nutella pie and cannoli were AMAZING!

We went here for the Queen's Feast a couple weeks ago - and had dinner from the preset "QF" menu. Everything was good, however I felt a bit rushed due to how busy they were on a Saturday night. I suspect it was like that because of the Queen's Feast and I would have liked a little more time in between the appetizer... and the entree... we only get a couple nights out a month sans kids after all! :)  We will definitely return for another dinner one night- it was very good.

No surprise but this is the best place in town for Italian food. Really love their lamb chops and lasagne is out of this world. I keep seeing everyone having pizza's but I'm still working through the rest of menu first.

The staff is awesome and this is a destination place for Italian food when your in Charlotte. 

BTW: In the autumn and winter they do the best bread pudding. In fact I had to stop in there the other night just to pick up and order. Beware 1 order of bread pudding is more than enough for two people.

Fantastic lunch here. I ordered the Penne Alla Vodka with Chicken and my son ordered Cheese Ravioli with Alfredo sauce. We received free bread with olive oil which had a few chili peppers making it spicy. Our food came within 10 minutes of ordering. Our meal was delicious and very filling. The service was also great and food was reasonably priced. We will definitely return again.

Let me start out by saying: I love Mama Ricotta's food. I've had several great experiences both in the restaurant and with their catering. That being said, last night's performance -aside from the scrumptious food- was not acceptable.

I went with a group of ~15 people to Mama Ricotta's for a Christmas function. I was one of the people that voted to have the event at the restaurant because I've had such great experiences in the past. I know a larger party requires patience on both ends and that mistakes are inevitable, but we had quite a few... our drink orders were mixed up repeatedly. One person ordered a salad with romaine lettuce and it came out with iceburg. The servers kept placing the wrong meals with the wrong individuals, which I know is hard not to do with a big group -but it added to our frustration. We did all get our food, but none of the dishes came out at the same time, so several people's food was cold by the time the final entree came out. 

The real fun started with the checks. Given the issues we had getting the right entree/drink to the right person, we knew the bills were going to be a nightmare -and they were. It took nearly 45 minutes to get our bills straightened out. By the time I actually received my bill (which was about 10 minutes after everyone else had paid and was leaving the restaurant) it was incorrect. I notified the server that my glass of Pinot Grigio was not on the ticket, he asked if that was a red wine. I know you only have to be 18 to serve alcohol, but it's important for servers to know which wines are white and which are red for customer service purposes. The server tried again with the ticket, which I had to go to the hostess stand to get, and it still did not have a glass of wine on it. Because I needed to leave I spoke to the manager, who was very nice and told me just to pay for my entree... but he kind of made me feel like I was making a stink to get my wine comped -which was not the case.

Will I try Mama Ricotta's again? Yes, but never again will I go back with a large group & I'll make sure not to order wine next time.

First time at Mama Ricotta's. My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night (without reservations) and luckily snagged a seat at the pizza bar. Make reservations if you can! 

I thoroughly enjoyed watching the cooks make various pizzas and different dishes. However, the cooks went from plating food and adding toppings to pizza to touching receipts and pizza boxes, and then back to plating food. I know that this would affect their health score rating...so better to fix it now then after the fact. 

Besides that, the food was amazing!!! We both ordered the chicken parmesan which comes with a huge helping of homemade spaghetti. Definitely lots of leftovers! Next time I'm ordering the sangria (authentic- made with rum and brandy) and tiramisu.  Two thumbs up (minus the food safety issue)....would give the food four plus stars.
The pollo Romano was great! I ordered a side of sauce to dip it in. The service was awesome too!!
Great lunch today!  The lasagna was fantastic.  Ally was one of the best servers I have had in years.  I can't say enough positive things about the overall experience.

Mama Ricotta's has some seriously good Italian food! I went on a Friday evening at 6. The wait was 35 minutes but the two of us immediately found a seat at the pizza bar. We ordered the goat cheese app, lasagna, and pollo blanco. The goat cheese dip was so yummy, I will be ordering every time I visit. It was a large portion and came with bread slices and a red sauce. I had the lasagna and loved it. I was fairly full after the appetizer and took most of it home. It took quite a while for the food to come out after the appetizer but nothing to be upset about. Parking was available and loved the interior.
Love this restaurant! Make sure you come with an appetite but if not, always share! There will be plenty!! Great service! Pasta and pizza are equally great!!

Let me start off by saying I love GOOD Italian food, thus the reason it's been several years since my last visit here. I was asked to give them another try by 2 fellow foodies, mainly because they made the signature bread pudding sound so good and there was a $20 certificate for $5 on juice in the city.....that is the only reason I returned after all this time. I'm not sure how this place has been here as long as they have, I mean let's be honest.....the food is sub par. Again, I am a lover of Italian food and if your signature rigatoni with meat sauce can't even compete with stouffer's.....that's a problem. I mean the noodles were hard and chewy, the sauce was salty and the bread was tasteless....this is a basic Italian dish which I would think could never be screwed up........geez! The penne alla vodka was also full of salt with hard and chewy noodles......glad I only paid $5 bucks! The bread pudding, which is not on the menu, gave me something to smile about after a bad meal.......It was covered in caramel sauce I think and served with ice cream.......very good...........to bad they're not a dessert bar.

We had our baby shower here, so I have nostalgic feelings. I had the pizza, which was pretty damn good. My wife got the shrimp salad, and the shrimp was probably thawed frozen. We emailed the manager, and HE WAS SO HELPFUL and apologetic. That won me over forever. Places like this need to stay in business. I will go back for that reason.

Would otherwise give it 3.5 *'s.
Wonderful food every time we dine here!! Highly suggest eating here but come hungry!!
Awesome place I'm going to make reservations today for Saturday for my girlfriend and I...can't wait!!!
Great Italian food that's not hard on the wallet. Good portion size. Service is friendly but slow. The Nutella pie was amazing. Will visit again

Itttt's Restaurant Week - Hooray!  So, Italian it is!  Atmosphere is very casual (so much so you can bring some rugrats and they'll fit in.)  Service was very attentive (maybe our gal tried a little too hard),   The food was rich & plentiful (had salads, penne ala vodka, ravioli, & tiramisu,) but nothing stood out.  The flavors were nice, but the dishes unexciting.  And alas, the tiramisu did not have nearly enough alcohol in it (if it had any at all!)  Can I get a second that this is the best part?!  Anywho, I would come here again, but only for lunch.  I would rather spend my entree money elsewhere!

This place is the bomb. Have eaten lunch and dinner here. Neither disappointed. 

For an appetizer I recommend the in house made buffalo mozzarella.  

The Nutella peanut butter pie is amazing.  The crust is the perfect container for the sweet cream of the filling.

I had the steak and mushroom risotto for dinner. Really enjoyed the texture of this dish. The flavors worked.

Friendly bartender.
Tasty Italian food with good sized portions and nice ambiance.

Moved back to Charlotte after 4 years and I'm happy to say this place is just as good as ever. My personal favorite, the goat cheese dip, is still available. Order this and you'll see why we order it every time. Chicken Marsala is another favorite and of course the lasagna which is hearty and has more than enough cheese.

Used call ahead seating on a Friday night and glad we did because the placed was busy. That's always a good sign.
The food was excellent and we took advantage of the drink specials.
We sat on the patio which was nice.
We would go again.

This is our Italian go to. We missed good Italian after moving down from the north so we were very happy to have found Mama Ricotta's. The cheese pizza and penne a la vodka are our faves. The service is always great. Last night, Ben gave us a great wine recommendation and was so attentive to our table. Our water and wine glasses never got low. He was super sweet and helpful!

Trying to find a decent Italian place with parking for uptown meetings is sometimes tough, but you need look no further than Mama Ricotta's. An excellent location for good locale Italian food that has fantastic service and parking. Make sure to check it out!
Good Italian dishes but lots of garlic. Smells good when you walk in the door.  Usually crowded.

One of our favorite Italian restaurants. We love the penne ala vodka with chicken and shrimp and the bruschetta is the best I have ever had. Their tomatoes are so fresh. We also love their garlic rolls that are complimentary. It's hard to stop eating them...lol. Prices are reasonable considering the portion sizes. Two people can eat off one entree.

This is not what qualifies as "Good Italian." 

Perhaps there is an Italian village where this is identical to what they serve, but I have never been there. I've never been to Italy at all. 

So I'll say this instead: This is not what qualifies as "Good Italian American."

I've enjoyed Mama Ricotta's catering before, and even dinner several times over the last decade. But tonight, despite not having to pay, having two glasses of Chianti, and having the gal at the bar give me her phone number, I was disappointed. 

Jamal served us with precision and a smile. One busboy was nice enough to crumble bread on my jacket, then look down at my jacket as if its presence offended him.

The rolls...these are dinner rolls, coated in oil. They stiffened within minutes, which generally says they spent time in a microwave. 

The oily rolls also came with a dish full of oil. A dish of oil is a decent gesture in most Italian restaurants, but this oil was spicy. And more spicy than I prefer. But if you are from that Italian village where they dip oily rolls in spicy oil, this is your place. 

The highly recommended Warm Goat Cheese and Mascarpone Dip was pleasant tasting. Rich marinara surrounding creamy mascarpone, with bread of proper consistency. In fact, I wish they served a version of this bread as their dinner bread. The presentation could be better. Looked like a dying sunflower made of bread.

For the main course, I chose Pasta Primavera. While flavorful, and a big heaping plate, this was also heavy laden in oil. A deep pool of oil.

My benefactor ordered angel hair pasta with tomato basil sauce plus shrimp. She appeared pleased, although this may have had more to do with the man across from her, or her drink, or both. 

Or neither.

Looking for a good lunch stop? Try Mama Ricotta's. It's in a convenient location just south of Uptown or just outside the Dilworth area...perfect for a quick business lunch. I think other people have the same idea because there were a lot of business-dressed patrons filling every seat.

If you plan on talking to secure that business deal, sit outside (as long as the weather is accommodating). It's rather loud and difficult to hear your party indoors and I found myself smiling and nodding across the way without really knowing what my colleague was saying half the time (shhh, don't tell).

The food was good...not spectacular. The salmon that comes on the salad is of large proportion. The sandwiches actually looked the best out of all the dishes at our table! I had the capellini pomodoro with the tomato basil sauce...okay. The rolls were rolls...not french bread, but were good. 

I'll give it another try because other Yelpers have had such a good experience here...and perhaps I'll order one of their sandwiches.

Seriously one of my favorite Charlotte eateries. If you love Italian food, you'll love this Mama. The food is fresh and the calamari is delicious. My favorite dish is the penne, chicken broccoli. The lasagne is wonderful, too.

I crave Mama Ricottas! What a great place. Went tonight for my birthday dinner and it was delicious as always. The servers are always sharp and on point, salads are cold and pastas are piping hot. I had penne alla vodka (because I can't get that sauce right in my own kitchen!), my date had spinach fettuccine and his Alfredo sauce was light and delicious without being overly garlicky and thick as is the case some other places. Shrimp was juicy and perfect- also a struggle some other places (and in my kitchen... :) ) Tiramisu was perfect for dessert and enough to share. Manager Laura stopped by to check on our experience and she was lovely, as was our server and food delivery staff. Thanks Mama's!

Came in on a busy Saturday night. Our server Tangee(?) was amazing!! Fast friendly service. I could tell she was tied up with other tables, at the same time, she still gave us great personal attention. I asked for a wine pair. She was right on point!! She consulted the bartenders. And bam! perfect wine appeared at our table. Matt (manager) came and said "hi". Professional and friendly man. Absolutely perfect experience. Oh. And the food was the top of the line quality and the portions were perfect (the boyfriend and I eat A LOT!). If you're looking for a good place to sit, eat and be flattered. Come on by!!

This place is yummy! My fianc√© and I came here for dinner one night. He got the lasagna and I got the ravioli. My ravioli was so good- the perfect amount of meat sauce and cheese, I wish I could've gotten a bigger portion lol. My fianc√© liked his lasagna as well- but I think he liked my ravioli more. Also the waitress was very helpful in helping me figure out which sauce I should get on my ravioli, which I really appreciated. I will be coming back to try more dishes!

I love Mama Ricottas!! This place has been around for ages and I hardly ever come anymore but it's still just as yummy as ever!! I pretty much always get either the lasagna or the Polo Romano neither dish ever fails me and it's Italian comfort food at its finest. This is a great place for a group or to celebrate a birthday etc. Now I will say this.. If you are looking for wow factor, new innovated foods, hopping social place then this won't be for you. However if you are looking for that neighborhood staple restaurant with good comfort level food and a good staff to match then please give this place a try!!

Excellent Italian food. As close to home cooking as it comes and service was fantastic. Food came out very fast. Sat out on the patio and enjoyed the views of the city. Had chicken park family size, included 5 pieces of chicken parmigiana and a side of angel hair pasta that was enough for 5 or more people. Had a very good wine selection. Recommend making a reservation but even as a walk in we were seated very fast. Absolutely worth the visit. Feed 4 people and took leftovers home for tomorrow.

Recently moved down here from Long Island, New York.

I had a great local pizza place near my house that made some tasty dishes as well as pies.

Oh, boy do I miss that establishment... and New York Deli's, I wish they existed down here. Why can't I find a damn deli that puts bacon, egg, and cheese on a damn "kaiser like" roll? Is it the kaiser part? It's not a freaking nazi roll... Jiminy.

Anyway, I digress.

I was looking around on yelp to find a highly rated Italian place that also served family sized dishes so I could pick up takeout for me, the wife, and kids. 

My children are too young to trust that they will not bother other patrons with their "annoyingness"...


This place seemed great! We ordered the PENNE, BROCCOLI & CHICKEN and the GOAT CHEESE & MASCARPONE DIP.

Zero complaints about the dip other than most of the bread we were given was burnt. Gave those to the kids and dog... Doubt they'd notice.

The pasta dish was one of, if not, THE worst pasta entrees I have ever ordered.

I can not recall a single time that I have ordered pasta and it was a mushy over cooked travesty like this was...

Flavor was decent, lemon=yum, but the pasta tasted like it was cooking for the entire 35 minutes that we were told it would take to complete the order. I don't care about words like "Al Dente" as long as the pasta does not taste like it has been cooking for days!!

I literally had to "cook" and add salt, pepper, and melted mozzarella under my broiler so we could eat it and I still ended up throwing some out.

For over $45, I expected more. The kids ate some of it so I guess that is something...

If you don't care or have never had properly cooked pasta, then, it is edible.

If you wanted something awesome worth your repeated business then, for me at least, I'd need some proof they could cook pasta right.

I likely will not give them another chance cause the pasta was really that bad.

This is the first review I have ever done cause I have never ordered from an Italian place that couldn't cook pasta properly. I hope this was just a one off but for the cost of admission... I cannot really afford to find out.

So disappointing :(

The food gets 4 stars ... The service gets 6 stars. Our waiter was that legit.
Authentic Italian food! The Chicken Parmesan was amazing! I definitely would recommend heading here!

A friend recommended Mama Ricotta's and said it was better than Aria. This restaurant is totally different compared Aria.

Mama Ricotta is a family style restaurant for they have different sized portions from small, full to family on certain dishes.

Thank you Yelper's for suggesting the Warm Goat Cheese & Mascarpone dip. It was really good.

As for the entrees, we ordered the Sauteed Beef Tenderloin & Creamy Wild Mushroom Risotto & Linguine with Clams.

The entrees were okay. Nothing out of the ordinary. The Risotto was cooked with so much butter. Have had better Italian food than this. The is Americanized Italian Food.

Our waiter, Eric who was new was very attentive. Every time we looked around he came over to see if everything was okay. The manager came over to double check if everything was okay for we had an issue with one of the wines.

The meals came out so fast. While were eating the appetizer, the salads came out. I was still eating my meal when they placed the check on the table. Felt like we were in a diner back in NYC.

All time favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte! We love eating at the pizza bar and always have top notch service. Additionally, they serve the best gluten free pasta around! I recommend the penne, broccoli and chicken with sausage!

I ordered take out from here once when I was staying at a hotel in downtoen Charlotte for work. I found it on yelp and looked like they had some delicious menu items and were also close to where I was staying. I always try new places that are not chains and this one had lots of items I was interested in. 

I looked at the menu and ended up ordering the goat cheese and mascropone appetizer that you also got with crostini and marinera sauce, The salmon salad, and also the apple crisp dessert. When I called to order the person who took my order was very helpful and knew a lot about the menu items which almost never happens. Since I also ordered take out she made sure to tell me that everything would be packaged seperately so it would not get soggy. 

When I picked up my food it was so nicely packed and delicious as well! I loved all of the food and would defnitely love to go back there again. Definitely a nice place to just go and have a quiet dinner with some friends. The wine and beer selection was pretty great as well!

So fine...so good...every time with everything.

I broke my habit by not ordering the wonderlishous lasagne and opted for the vodka penne.  Superb.  Wife had a special:  tubes with a short rib ragu which was extraordinary and very rich.  

Yes, we were stuffed so left with two cartons that WE WILL CONSUME FOR BREAKFAST tomorrow.   Haaaa, haaaa, ha.

Ben gave us a sense of humor with his excellent service, so typical of Mama's.

If you haven't been, go.  And go early for any meal as it is popular and gets pretty busy fast.

Yumalishous to the max.

I have to preface with the fact that I'm not a huge fan of Italian food.

I was unimpressed with the customer service: the server was apparently not typically on the floor as she was the bartender. My first question is "Why?" She got our order incorrect (which actually ended up being a good thing) but was a bit slow.  I usually like all salads but I did NOT like the chopped salad. For some reason, the acidity was too high and some of the flavors did not bode well together.  

My friends raved about the Nutella pie: it was good but it was much more like a Cheesecake Factory cheesecake slice than a pie: huge and don't order more than one per table--too much. For dinner, we ordered the Pollo Bianco and since we both wanted it, we decided for family style. The family style doesn't come with side dishes so you have to order those separately--so we did. But then they brought the single serving and still brought the sides--and the single serving is served on top of mashed potatoes: one of the sides we ordered. Enter double sides of mashed potatoes. I will say the sauce of the chicken was good, but the mashed potatoes were the same as anywhere else. 

I guess it's just another standard chain restaurant. Too bad. It could have been so much more.

My family and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner. We started our meal with yummy cocktails. Our waiter Giavani was great. We enjoyed the beef tenderloin medallions, chicken parm and spaghetti. Everything was well seasoned and delivered quickly to our table. 
We will definitely will return.
This place is great. Jelani was our server and he was awesome. My wife's lasagna was terrific. The only reason not a 5 was my veal was a little over cooked. Great Italian joint.

I've been going to Mamas' for years. The food is always consistently good. Very good wine list. The little garlic knots (that come with every entr√©e) melt in your mouth. The ONLY negative is slow service at times. They are always packed so, maybe that's it.

I really debated on how many stars to give. If I could I would have given 3.5. I came here for lunch and I was pleased, not blown away but happy. The decor in some aspects is cool but in others it could use some updating. You can tell they have probably made some changes over the years but not all the ones they need to. Our waitress was super sweet and friendly which was also another plus. 
They bring bread and oil yo start when you sit down. The bread is actually rolls which I found disappointing, it's served with a slightly spicy oil. We had the goat cheese snd mascarpone dip with marinara and it was delicious. The goat cheese was present but not overwhelming. It comes with toast but I wish it had been served with something more bite size such as crostini etc. I should also mention that we came during lunch time and not dinner so we didn't have the whole menu to pick from. I had the angel hair pasta with tomato basil sauce and it was good, I was happy with it. My husband ordered the penne with vodka sauce and it was also delicious, it had some spice to it as well. I like spice but for some it may have been too much. 
I would eat here again it would not go out of my way to do so.

This place is always amazing. Great staff, great food. They never disappoint. Do yourself a favor and get the goat cheese app and the Nutella pie. You don't even have to order anything else and you will walk out happy b

Advertised as New Haven pizza. We are from the New Haven area relocated in Huntersville, NC. It's not Traditional New Haven pizza. The people were extremely nice, the service was great and it was a very busy Saturday evening. If you're going to try the pie make sure you ask for it crispy. Must admit we didn't try the reg food. I think we will so I'll get back to you. Stars are strictly based on the pizza.

I love Italian food, and I love Mama Ricotta's, so that should tell you something.
Mama's (as my friend's call it) is kind of unassuming, placed as it is in a strip mall-type of place.
The restaurant itself isn't very large, which can make for some crowded times during dinner and, somewhat surprisingly, lunch.

The food is outstanding however. The pasta is homemade, and the garlic knots are a must. I am a big fan of the angel hair and the lasagna.

Some dishes may be a bit pricey, but at least you are getting quality for your money. 

If you are an Italian fan and a bit tired of the chain restaurants such as Olive Garden and Carabba's, you should take a chance and check out Mama's.

Came into town for the Belk Bowl. Based on previous reviews me and my boyfriend chose this place and we weren't disappointed! We shared the chicken oreganata pizza and it was wonderful! Also had a side salad with their homemade creamy Gorgonzola dressing which was good too. 

Easy to find and parking available. It's a little dressy which I wasn't prepared for in my Dawg sweatshirt. :) but good and affordable. Go if you get the chance!
Found my new go to for Italian.  Food is top notch and the service is excellent.  My waiter David was outstanding and I will definitely be coming back!

Most of the time when I come here it is for lunch. I have been to dinner once or twice. For the most part my review is based around my experiences for lunch. 

I have been coming here since around 2007 and never had one bad experience. It can get a little busy so getting there for a early or late lunch is better than right at lunch time. Staff has always been excellent and never had an issue with the kitchen messing up any food. 

I tend to enjoy the calzone of the day. They are always fresh and taste great if you like the goodies that are on the inside that day. The lasagna has always been great as well. The bread has always been good too. 

Long story short great food and great people at lunch and the few dinner experiences were great too! 

Enjoy!

I haven't eaten here that many times, but I got take out last weekend and it was awesome.  I got the chicken in lemon sauce with grilled artichokes which came with creamy polenta and a veggie (it happened to be cauliflower on that day)- not only was the food fantastic, but it was enough for me to eat two fulls meals.  I also got the side salad which came with a really great homade sundried tomato dressing (also the salad was under $3 which you don't find anywhere these days).  My boyfriend had the penne with meat sauce which he liked, but his portion was noticably smaller than mine- I think the meat entrees are prob a better deal.  The entire meal came with half a dozen garlic rolls, on the house.  Oh, beware that if you go on the weekends this place is packed- I could barely get to the bar to get my to go order.

First time I went we had a large party of 10, of which 3 were stuck in traffic.  We told them this and they seated us anyway.  We called them knowing they were a few miuntes or better away.  We ordered drinks and food for them.  About 5 minutes later the hostess who sat us came back and started trying to talk us into squeezing into a table for 6.  I told her they were down the street and we had just ordered for them so there was no reason to switch.  She said there was another large party that was all here .... Just then the rest of our group showed up.  If they had not I would have left.  The server and the food that night were great and almost made me forget about the hostess.  Then we came again with some friends raving about the food.  Must have been a new chef.  The service was still great but EVERYTHING was really salted. The pizza, the calamari, the pasta. 3 of us ordered a home made pasta with portabello mushrooms, it was so salty we could not eat it. The waitress tried so hard, she apologized and even offered us a free tira misu for desert. Sorry to say cause the servers are great, but Mama's is off our list.

One of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Service is extraordinary & it's very obvious that food is fresh and top notch.  Prices are extremely reasonable also.  Some of our favorites are the penne alla vodka & the rigatoni with meet sauce.  We were just recently in for my birthday dinner & we also received a complimentary cannoli for the occasion!

We ask for our children's food first thing so they could start eating sooner and the waitress put their order with the adults so they were starving and getting fuzzy. I found a hair in my bread and they just offered more bread (without hairs), they offered the special chicken Parmesan calzone and 20 min later they said they didn't have it anymore so we had to order another pizza and wait another 30 mins to get everybody's food. We didn't get any discount for the wait or the hair in the bread or the long time we had to wait to get our food. Food was delicious but really bad service :(
Very disappointed and I don't think we'll come back
It was the first and the last time we are going there.

Food was really good and they have a great wine selection.  I will say we got there at 6:45 and the place was already packed full and the bar too.  Had to stand around for a bit.  Just my husband and I so we have some wine, waited for our table and had a really good time just of the two of us.  Great for date night, little crazy with a group of people.
It was my first time there. I was with a group and we didn't wait long to be seated. It was a wonderful atmosphere. The food was amazing and great portion size. I will come again.

One of mine and my husband's favorite restaurants! We come here for most birthdays and some date nights. The bruschetta with house-made mozzarella cheese is to die for. I love the lasagna and my husband always orders the Chicken Parm. The Nutella Pie is super rich but is delicious!

I can not say how much I LOVED my meal here tonight! Everything from the service (Matt was great), to the app, meal, and atmosphere was top notch. By a mile the best Italian restaurant in Charlotte if not the best restaurant all together. I had the lasagna as my main meal and every bite was delicious. When I eat out I always expectations that 90% of the time are not met. This was the 2nd time I've eaten here and both times they knocked it out of the park. I can't believe you can get such great food for such a great price. I highly recommend given this place a try if you haven't already.

5:13 at night, place is 3/4 empty but they can't seat us. I wonder if it because me and my wife are tattooed undesirables that don't fit in with their clientele?

Either way,  you have 20 open tables and you are only willing to sit us if we sit outside? 

I know where I am not welcome.  So if you are under 70 and not quite the old white Christian ideal... maybe you would want to find a different place to spend your money? 

I guess I don't really have a choice.

So, went here because of the reviews...as its so hard to decide on an Italian restaurant in Charlotte, and it did not disappoint. My husband and I shared the family size Rigatoni with Meat Sauce, and listen to me when I say ...ADD the homemade ricotta. If you like ricotta whatsoever...it is fantastic. We had enough food for both of us and a little to take home for leftovers. We also ordered some type of cheese bread, without realizing they give you complimentary bread...so it was bread overload, but who can complain about that? We did not drink alcohol, but it seemed like they had a generous wine selection. For a great meal on date night we probably spent around 40 bucks or less....so very affordable!

Had a craving for Italian the other night and came here with my girlfriend.  Glad that we made a reservation as things were hopping on a Saturday night - had to push through several waiting parties to get in the door!  We had expected a bit more upscale decor, so we were both a bit overdressed - place is very casual and nothing special to look at.  We were both hungry and ordered quickly - I went for a glass of Malbec, house salad (which is a smaller portion of Mama's salad), and the pasta special, a sea bass served over linguine.  Girlfriend got a glass of Riesling, house salad, and clams over spaghetti.  We munched on the garlic rolls (served warm, with olive oil and red pepper, and you can get more if you ask the waiter nicely).  Food was good and hearty, and we both were full by the time the plates were taken away.  Flavor was typical of Ametican Italian - heavier sauces, lots of garlic - and pastas were nice and chewy (pasta is not made in house).  We got the tiramisu for dessert which was typical American- style tiramisu (large, lots of creme, not super flavorful on the coffee side).  Total came to ~$70 (before tip).  Would definitely go back (wanted to try the pizza), but this place is not quite up to your NYC / Boston North End Italian standard.

Once again mama ricottas killed it with their food but tonight, waitresses chandler and Laura Ashley took care of my party of 18 like each of us had our own personal waitresses! Every order was correct, drinks were always refilled and we didn't have to ask for anything! Great work! Exceptional food combined w exceptional service make for a wonderful dinner!
Incredible Food and service, we agreed it was one of the Best dinners we've had in CHarlotte.  The location and building are very misleading, the food and staff are top notch.

We attended a planned birthday party of 25 people. I was surprised at how well it worked...from the delicious food to the exceptional service. Our main servers Cori and Abby were prompt with taking drink orders as we arrived. As soon as we all arrived and were seated, the salad course was served. Demands for bread refills were met with a swift response. As soon as the salad plates were cleared, our pasta course arrived. And before we could recover from that course, the tasty meat course arrived. Our experienced servers knew to anticipate our need for coffee in preparation for the final dessert course. 

Maybe my multiple trips to Italy create a level of expectation higher than reasonable. The penne pasta with creamy pesto sauce was disappointing and not up-to-par with their other dishes...I've had better from Pizza Hut. The alternate pasta dish (cream sauce, broccoli and penne) was excellent.

All were impressed by how well our large party was managed. There were many opportunities when there could have been hiccups in the service or our dinner could have been uncomfortably long. If I had to select a couple of words to describe the service...I'd choose "professional" and "polished". I'd definitely recommend this venue to anyone planning a large dinner event.
Had the lasagna was very good would recommend wife and son said the same Geoffrey was the waiter great personal  service

We ate here a few weeks ago, and I'm still thinking about the goat cheese and mascarpone dip.  If you could read my mind, that statement would speak for itself, but since you can't (I hope), let me tell you what you're missing if you haven't experienced this appetizer yet.  This is not like any sort of cheesy dip you might have had before.  This is a warm scoop of creamy, delicious cheese covered in marinara sauce, served with perfectly toasted bread.  The challenge here is to get just the right proportion of cheese and sauce in every bite.  We finished off the toast and were still scraping the bowl with bread from the bread basket, which is freshly baked in-house.  I don't even like goat cheese very much, but this blend of cheeses was just right.

I also had the angel hair with tomato basil sauce, which was perfectly done.  The sauce really has to stand out in a simple dish like this, and this sauce was up to the task.  I think next time, though, I might try something a little more complex--maybe the cheese ravioli.

We went to dinner without a reservation and were seated right away.  We ordered a large White Pizza and added mushrooms with a side of Alfredo for dipping the crusts.  Their food is wonderful and everything tastes scratch made and authentic.  Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a nice place to have a great meal!
Amazing food and service!! My servers name was Kim, and she was attentive and really added to our dining experience. Would definitely recommend on a Wednesday for half priced bottles!

Maybe one of the worst experiences at a restaurant. The only seating was outside on the side patio. So they brought us out to a table that was sitting directly in the sun at the end of June! We tried to sit and enjoy our food, while our waitress was not very concerned about us, and the bugs just came flying in. Flies all over my pasta, sweating perfusely, and the manager came to see how we were doing and we immediately boxed up our food a left. They should never seat people directly in the sun or outside in the middle of summer with no ventilation on the patio. The food is pretty basic. No flavor and no seasoning. Go to Dolce Restorante instead.
This is one of my FAVORITE Italian restaurants in Charlotte. REAL Italian food, great pasta, and great pizza!! They are huge portions of food with good prices. I'd highly recommend.
Super great first time experience. Karen and Beth are just delightful.. Great Conversation, Great Food and Drinks! I can't wait to come back and enjoy a great dinner here.

The food was absolutely phenomenal! The family sized caprese appetizer was the biggest We've ever been served (one of our staples). Great wine selection also. Do not let the exterior appearance or the plaza deter you. We had a great meal and will absolutely be back!

I came here based on reviews and my wife and I were not disappointed.  The food was better than the well known national Italian chain and the prices were less - you can't beat that.  The lasagna was to die for - best I have had out.

Is it me or has this place gone downhill?!?! I've been a mamma Ricottas fan since day 1. But today what I picked up for takeout was a real disappointment. I ordered a full mama's salad and added chicken for an up charge. It looked like half the amount of chicken as usual half of which was gristle and/or skin. 2 I added extra olive and artichoke hearts which was another up charge (which they didn't tell me it would cost extra) but there weren't extra of either. 3 I got extra dressings and were charged for those as well and they weren't even correct. For the price point of this restaurant I'd expect them to get orders correct and to tell me if something I ordered had an extra charge. Just really disappointed in what used to be one of my favorite Charlotte restaurants

Where do I began today I had a phenomenal dinner at Mama Ricotta's my server Hayley C was the absolute BEST her food suggestions and attentiveness was STELLAR! I had the Bresaola and the Lasagna (A-M-A-Z-I-N-G). If your ever in the area you must come here and you have to ask for Hayley C. I WILL be back again and I hope she's my server! Thank you Mama Ricotta's for providing such amazing authentic Italian food!!!!!  phenomenal

We went on a Sunday evening for our anniversary and it was busy. Server was okay but a little too laid back. We ordered a goat cheese app that was very good. Our entrees were chicken marsala(good) and a chianti-braised short rib over gnocchi (very tasteless). My bloody mary was also about the worst I have ever had. On a positive note, the chocolate torte with cannoli cream was out of this world.I dont know if we will go back.
Friendly waitstaff, quick service, and great food! I tried the angel hair pasta with vegetables and tomato-cream sauce. Loved it!

Mama Ricotta's is an Italian joint that seems to be pretty popular with the locals.  I was there with a large group (work) so I got to try a lot of items (but no pictures).  We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share: Tomato and Mozzarella,  Calamari, Chopped Salad, Bruschetta.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  I particularly loved the Chopped Salad.  It had a lot going on, with many ingredients, but it really worked. 

For a Main I ordered the Roasted Grouper.  I did not care for the way the fish was prepared. The fish was served with stewed beans, kale, guanicale, and butternut squash. I thought that sounded interesting but I did not like it at all. I did try some of my team mates's dishes. The Chicken Romano was very good. However, the star of the night was the Chianti Braised Short Rib....so tender and flavorful!  We also shared two desserts, a bread pudding and a Nutella pie. Both were sinfully delicious!  

The portions were huge!  You can order individual or family size portions. We ordered individual but the portions were large enough to share!  Service was very attentive. They honored our reservation , and our food came out very quickly, especially considering we were a group of ten. Great place to take a group or family!
Great service and delicious food. David was outstanding waiter and was very attentive. Will definitely be back for a weekend out.

Yummm Mama Ricotta's! One of my best friends worked here during my first years of college so logically (with the food discounts and everything), we would come here for lunch or dinner a lot. If I could fall in love with a restaurant, it'd be true love between  me and Mama Ricotta's. Apparently a lot of others feel the same way so maybe Mama's is cheating on me. Oh well. I'll tolerate it this time- I'm still in that infatuated stage and I don't think it's ending any time soon. I always have a ton of options here and everything is always absolutely perfect. I usually hate eating pasta with only tomato sauce and no grated cheese, but I was forced to try their angel hair pasta with tomato basil sauce WITHOUT parmesan cheese and it was perfect. I was truly amazed. Who knew tomato sauce could be so good that you don't need or even WANT cheese?! And the tiramisu? In the past, I've personally described it as the equivalent of a tiramisu-flavored cloud. Perfect texture, perfect combination of flavors and perfect density. Best tiramisu 've ever had by far.

However, with that said, I am bummed about two things. First off, their Mama's Pasta is NOT on the  menu anymore. Apparently they can still make it, but it's by special request only. Also, the tiramisu has been lacking in cloud-like quality the last two times I've gone in to eat. It could be that I'm just getting the last slice of it or maybe they just changed their recipe. Either way, I've been slightly disappointed. Hopefully it'll be back to the same thing next time I go. *fingers crossed*

After reading all the great reviews I was very excited to try this restaurant. My wife and I decided to eat here for our 21st anniversary. First, the good. The service was excellent. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and very attentive. Second, the house made mozzarella was delicious. My wife had the dinner special that was an angel hair pasta dish with cream, ham and peas. She really enjoyed it. Now the bad. I had the grouper. The grouper was a small (obviously frozen) filet over a medley of beans, veggies and kale. The fish was small, thin and bland. The vegetables were significantly over cooked. The dish was $24 and in all honesty it was not as good as a piece of baked/broiled fish from Captain Dees or Long John Silver. I had to put a lot of salt and pepper on the fish as it was just so bland. 
Normally I would have no issue sending the food back or telling the server about my dissatisfaction but it was our anniversary and my wife was really enjoying her dinner so I kept mum and ate my fish. 
Bottom line for me, when in an Italian restaurant go for a menu item they specialize in but I didn't mention I am not physically able to eat pasta so if I go back it will definitely be a salad dinner for me.

Mama Ricotta's did an excellent job serving our department for our Christmas luncheon. We have about 30 people and they were able to secure an area in the back for us. The servers were very attentive,  friendly and quick. 

Our meal was served family style and we had a pre-set menu. The bruschetta was our appetizer.  The tomatoes and basil were fresh on top of a slice of garlic toast. My bread was a tiny bit soggy so this one needed to be eaten quickly. Then we had the Tuscan salad. The house made mozzarella in this salad is to die for. 

For our main course, we had turkey prosciutto meatballs, rigatoni with meat sauce, penne,broccoli and chicken, and pasta primavera. The meatballs are huge, like almost as big as my fist. They have a good Italian meatball flavor and you forget It's actually made with turkey. All of the pastas were amazing, each with a different flavor. My favorite was the rigatoni with meat sauce. It had an amazing tomato flavor infused with seasoned meat and the pasta was cooked just right. 

My ultimate favorite dish here is the penne alla vodka which we did not have. Most of the time I come just for the penne alla vodka and never try anything else. So it was great to try other foods here. 

And again hats off to the staff. They even worked around us playing games between activities.

Best, most authentic Italian ever?  Well, perhaps not.  Dang good, dang unhealthy Americanized Italian?  Yes, indeed.

Ok, people... if you're going to a place named "Mama Ricotta's," you shouldn't be expecting it to be terribly authentic.  But it is much better than Olive Garden.  The food is horrible for you, but delicious.  On our first visit, I had the tortellini special, which really impressed me.  The little pastas were perfectly cheesy, and the meat sauce was amazing.  It actually had little chunks of steak in it instead of ground beef.  My mouth is watering as I write this review, honestly.

The only part of the experience that was less than ideal was the goat cheese appetizer.  It came highly recommended, and it was tasty, but it lacked tanginess.  I probably wouldn't have been as let down if my expectations had not been so high.

Mama Ricotta's is comfort.  Good ol' Americanized comfort.  Mmm.

Mama Ricotta's is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte and one of the best Italian restaurants in the QC. Their food is delicious and I've always had positive experiences there. Try not to fill up on the bread, even though it's really tempting. I'm a devoted fan of their lasagna, though all the pasta is good. Their pizzas are good and a cheaper route to take for dinner at Mama Ricotta's. I always leave feeling full but with plenty of leftovers to eat the next day for lunch.

It's a great spot for group gatherings too. My office had its Christmas party here last year.
Four great meals with great service. Loved my chopped salad and special-of-the-day shrimp linguini in a sherry cream sauce.

Table for 1 tonight and the service was impeccable from the hostess to my server/bartender Ally. Mozzarella & tomato appetizer was ample, fresh and yummy. My Pizza was hot, because she waited for me to start my app before ordering, and very good. Ally was especially nice to everyone who approached the bar area...very even. I'll come back for sure.

My Husband and I dined her Saturday Evening for our Anniversary and we are still talking about it. We got there early and it filled up FAST.  A mix of couples and families.  The atmosphere is romantic and the service is top notch.  We started with a house made fresh mozzarella snuggled between thick slices of vine-ripened tomatoes, drizzled with extra virgin olive oil and fresh basil.  It came with roasted red peppers and pine nuts.  The cheese was so fresh and delicious!!  We split a bottle of chianti that was very tasty for only $30.  Our pasta dishes came out amazing.  True and authentic Italian food!!!  Our waiter surprised us with a cannoli that had a candle in it and it was the tastiest one I ever had.  Coming from an Italian NY chick, that is saying a lot!!  We will try to go once a month for date night.  Probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!!
Scrumptious. Got a personal pizza with gorgonzola, chicken sausage, and red onions. Red sangria was good too.

Good atmosphere. Good service. I ordered the carbonara. It was very heavy. I couldn't take more than a couple bites because it was too rich and overpowering. It was hard to enjoy. I would maybe come back but I do not recommend the carbonara.

Based on my first experience at Mama Ricotta's they deserve a 5 from beginning to end. The restaurant is nice and clean and very spacious with perfect lighting. The servers and staff were all friendly and professional. 

The complimentary bread which is a good indication of how the rest of the meal with be was delicious and they'll gladly bring you more. I went with the Tonarelli Carbonara which was excellent! It doesn't seem like sufficient pasta but it's enough, believe me. 

We also ordered the Tonarelli Pesto Shrimp which was also excellent! You can tell they really know what they're doing in the kitchen. 

For dessert we enjoyed possibly the best bread pudding we've ever had! No,  I'm serious! 

I would absolutely recommend this restaurant when you're craving some authentic Italian

I really liked the pizza here and having looked over the reviews and the suggestions made by the YELPERS here in Charlotte the wife and I checked it out and are pleased to say, I believe for now (only because we have not tried all pizza joints) have found our favorite pizza and the staff was awesome. Chris the manager even came out at the end of dinner to see how things were and how did the meal go. 

The fresh bread with Olive oil and red Pepper flakes was very good, we had the Chicken Garginzol...LOL...Something pizza and it was awesome, it does come with a lot of onions, just FYI

We are already planning on going back and having some pasta...

Let me say Krista was a very attentive and helpful server and we Thank her for her input.

Grazie, Mama Ricotta's

I've waited far too long to update my review, having had nothing but excellent experiences here over the past few years. Today's lunch was no exception - my salad was delightful and beyond basic even though it was "just" a side salad, and my pasta (Penne Broccoli & Chicken) was rich and delicious. Service was wonderful as well.

I don't say this lightly, and I'm surprised I'm saying this at all.

This is actually the best Italian food I had EVER (and that counts Italy as well). It was hearty, flavorful and the service was simply fantastic. It tasted like they made quite a few things on site too.

The menu was also manageable (unlike some Italian places). My favorite is how you can order items family style. Everything was delicious through and through from the appetizers (goat cheese is a plus) to the cannoli. 

The drinks specials were also delicious (I came when Mama-citas were the special).

AMAZING italian food. Will continue to come back here when I am in town.  Love the service and environment. I ordered the spinach fettuccine carbonara and it was fantastic. The made from scratch pasta just took the dish over the top. Highly recommend trying this dish in particular.

I have been meaning to eat here for a while, based on friends and other Yelpers. Boy am I glad I finally did. 

Took an out of town friend here for lunch Saturday. Sat outside as it was a beautiful day. Early on in the lunch of waiter, "Derrick", accidentally knocked a glass of water on my friends lap. Us being pretty laid back, no big deal. Well Derrick took it very seriously apologizing multiple times, gave us a free goat cheese app, which was as good as it was unexpected. And then proceeded to tell us a story about how he dumped a glass of wine on a guys head early on in his waiting experience. He turned a potential disaster lunch, into one of the best I have had.

Now onto the food, all around incredible!! Goat cheese app, fantastic. I got braised beef veg, soup, it was excellent. Had the pasta of the day which was grouper and salmon over spaghetti in a diablo sauce. Also very good. "Mamas pasta" with pesto went over very well with my friend. 

I can't wait to get back and try the "New Haven" style pizza, as I grew up in New Haven, and am VERY picky about my pizza!!

My husband and I tried this place a few weeks ago and absolutely loved it! The warm goat cheese appetizer is to DIE for! My husband ordered the pizza with in house made chicken sausage and was in love! I had the cheese ravioli and it was delicious. We will definitely be going back. Great service and atmosphere.

Very disappointed as I've heard wonderful things about Mama Ricottas. We ordered the lasagna and carbonara to go. The sauce was broken and flavorless in the carbonara. Plus the portion size was tiny. The lasagna was over cooked and made it extremely chewy. I'm only giving two stars because the staff was friendly and polite. Sorry to say I won't be back and still in search of a good Italian restaurant in the area.

Oh my, oh my... the delish goodness!  Went there for my final meal of 2010 and what a culinary treat!  The restaurant was quite busy on New Year's Eve; however, hostess and wait staff was accommodating and attentive.  

A special holiday menu was provided, and I dined on Agnello Farcito - leg of lamb stuffed with Romano cheese and fresh parsley, gently braised in rich tomato sauce with olive oil mashed potatoes and braised black kale.  The lamb was very tender, sliced from the bone, rolled, and stuffed... what's not to like with that presentation?  I substituted Fontina risotto for the olive oil mashed potatoes... perfectly cooked, creamy, and just-enough cheesy.  And, I also opted for the asparagus over the braised black kale... wise choice on my part!  Portion was decent and filling enough that I took one of the lamb rolls home in order to save room for dessert!  And, while I had heard tall mouthwatering tales of their bread pudding, I ordered the Oreo Pie instead since it was only available that night for the special menu, and since plans of a return visit during 2011 were already dancing in my head!  Please believe this decadence was some kind of wonderful!!! The pastry chef should make it into heaven based on this creation alone... thick Oreo cookie crumb layer topped with cheesecake layer, chocolate ganache, sponge cake layer, more ganache, and caramel.  Oh baby, it was saying, "Come to mama," with each layer of scrumptious decadence, and I went willingly with full abandon!!!  

Absolutely a great dining experience!   I will be back soon to partake of the regular menu, that's not-so-regular, and won't think of leaving without having the bread pudding next time!
Awesome meal - flavorful food, large portions, not overly expensive.  The Marscapone dip was outstanding and the bread pudding dessert was one if the best I've had!  Go and enjoy the gluttony!

Mama Ricotta's has some of the most authentic Italian food in Charlotte. There aren't a lot of little hole-in-the-wall Italian places like Mama Ricotta's around these parts, so it was a wonderful day for me when I found this spot.

The goat cheese and marscapone dip should probably be illegal, as it's obscene and addictive and insanely delicious. The ravioli alla Fiorintina is one of my favorites from the pasta menu, as well as the penne alla vodka (hold the pancetta for me). 

I've never had bad food at Mama's, and I can be kind of a snot about Italian food. I studied abroad in Florence just to be able to be an Italian food snob and to pronounce things elegantly off Italian menus...I'm still paying for the privilege every month!

It can get a little crowded, but if you've got the time, it's well-worth the wait.

The food and service here was terrific. The hostess was  very nice and accommodating with my daughters wheelchair.  
I tried their meatballs and their lasagna and they were both very good.  My wife and I would both give their salads (chopped and house salad both) a 10. 
We had the teramisu for dessert and it was delicious.  We will definitely go back.

The classic Italian dishes here are delicious. I tried the cheese ravioli and the lasagna - neither disappoint! I also tried the pizza which was more average IMO and the crust wasn't as thin/crispy as I would have liked. Moral of the story - stick to the basics! Be warned: the Nutella pie dessert is HUGE so order with caution. My only other entirely personal complaint is that I wish they had a tortellini dish with the family recipe! Overall, I would definitely go back. The service was excellent.

We had lunch reservations on a Sunday afternoon and were seated as soon as we walked in. Service as well as the food was beyond belief good. The blood orange sangria has to be one of the best white wine sangrias I've ever had. $6 each on a Sunday or maybe everyday you can't beat especially for the size pour!! We also tried the $6 mimosa which was just ok, try the blood orange sangria I promise it's wonderful!!! The longer we were there the more people filed in although one would never notice as the noise level stayed extremely low. The four of us all had a different entree and we blown away by both the taste as well as lunch portion size. Our table shared bread pudding for dessert although I'm not a fan of bread pudding everyone else at the table said it's the best they've ever had!!! We'll be back and I promise if you give them a try you won't be disappointed!!!

A great experience for a birthday dinner. A friend recommended and said we would not be disappointed... and we were not!  Had the pasta with meat sauce and a chicken dish and both were winners. Great wait staff as well. Will return soon.

Fantastic Italian food!!  I have been going here for years and after a recent visit I realized I never reviewed it!  My favorite app here is the goat cheese and bread.
