They drizzle the sauce around the plate so you get a hearty mix of the cheese and sauce mixture for your bread - YUM.  I have liked every pasta dish I have ordered here - and the pizza is made in their wood-fired oven.  

Recently I got the pasta with vodka sauce - it is so much food!  Very delicious but heavy, you can easily split this with your dinner partner.  The outdoor patio is so breezy and cozy you will love to linger over your wine.  The fireplace is a great touch and creates perfect setting for a romantic date.

Good enough.

I have been many, many times and never had the same waiter -- it seems to have high turnover. Thus, you always have a 'new' waiter, and it shows.

I drink a lot of soda or sweet tea, and I often run dry. I resort to sending signals (ignored) like putting my glass on the edge of the table and making puppy-dog faces. Sadly my cute face is wasted here.

The food is good. I always spoil my meal with the bread and pepper-olive oil starter they bring.  As a vegetarian there are few, few options. In fact, I have only ever had 1 dish every time I have visited.

For a place that is trying to be 'nice' it would be better to update the menu periodically, and make some dishes vegetarian or at least allow them to be adapted.

The atmosphere is sorta stuffy, but I suppose typical Charlotte. People are dressier here than you would expect for lunch, but likely due to bankers coming on lunchtime and nearby Ladies Who Lunch from Myers Park.

We went to Mama Ricotta's before a play at Ovens Auditorium. I was a bit worried that we didn't have enough time to eat before the show, but the staff assured us that we would be on our way in plenty of time. And we were- they kept to our schedule while feeding us excellent food! The portions were generous and we all took extra home for another meal. My only problem was that we didn't have enough time to relax and take in the wonderful atmosphere and great wine selection.i will definitely return, hopefully to be able to savor things slowly next time!!

On Friday night the office I work for had our Christmas Party at Mama Ricotta's. It was a great time, it has a great atmosphere but the food was sub par. I think we ordered every appetizer on the menu.

Calamari - It was ok, I am not much of a fan it did seem a bit on the rubbery side. 

Bruschetta - Was very soggy with the tomatoes, not sure if that was the point but soggy bread is not very appetizing. 

Tomatoes with mozzarella - The tomatoes were great but the mozzarella slices were SO thick it was ridiculous, nearly double the size of the tomatoes. 

Goat Cheese - This was without a doubt my favorite of anything all night. Very rich and smooth. 

I ended up ordering the special of the evening: Chicken and spinach ravioli with white truffle oil. It was good but nothing to rave about. 

I have had way better Italian in Charlotte so its hard for me to recommend Ricotta's.


Oh and I dont know if it was me but the floor seemed super slippery!
best pizza in charlotte!!!! my favorite date night.

This is a very comfortable place and has great food.  They don't do anything that pushes the culinary envelope but what they do they do very well.  A friend took me here when I was relatively new to Charlotte because of my love of Nutella.  Mama's serves Nutella Pie - which is amazing.  If you want an easy and comfortable atmosphere and some great food then you have to head to Mama's

Team Appreciation Luncheon!  This was my first visit to Mama Ricotta.  The food was great, portions generous.  The servers were a little frazzled and slightly confused when delivering our orders.  I will put that down to the size of our party.  Our main server was very attentive, refilling drive and such. I had the butternut squash ravioli, which was pretty tasty.  The bread pudding for dessert was to die for.  I will definitely drag hubby here for our next date night.

Veal was great.  Lasagna could use little more ricotta but it was great.  Bread pudding the best.  Going back for pizza.  Danny was an awesome server.  The service was so much better than I'm used to anywhere.  He really does his job well.  It was a wonderful dinner.  Looking forward to pizza and linguine next time.

The taste was great that I ate it so fast and didn't check the color of the meat.  thnext day when I woke up with food poisoning I looked and the chicken was clearly way more pink than it should have been... I called and spoke with the manager and he promised that he would call back and that was days ago and I haven't heard from the restaurant... Disappointed that that is how they run business if somebody gets sick.

**Bar and Drinks only**
Got to our dinner destination early and decided to pop in for a drink. Large really cute covered outside patio dining area. Inside is cozy. Hostess friendly and smiley, coming and going. The smell was amazing in here. The bar was pretty darn small (maybe a six seater). I'm now beginning to think NODA Jam Session is stalking me. I looked up and there she was staring back at me. House Cab was just okay and I thought $8 was a little steep for just okay. Bartender, cheery, polite and not pushy. Made some menu recomendations for when we come back and wished us a nice evening at Meskerem. Hope to get back soon and hopefully everything tastes as good as it smells and looks!!

Don't let the outside fool you-this place is amazing. Go inside and enjoy the amazing food and service. We had Danny as a server; I would argue he is the best server I've ever had. Without a doubt, request him! And enjoy!

Perfect location for group birthday!  Great food, nice staff, gluten free options, polite about separate checks. Burrata w prosciutto was excellent, bread is always yummy, mamas salad was good and out family pasta dishes were delicious!  Best thing there= Nutella pie!  Better than crack or so I hear!  Had to order to special for bday boy am it was devoured!

I had a wonderful dinner at Mama Ricotta's this past Friday night.  I went there to celebrate a friend's birthday, and our server Danny assisted in making it a wonderful evening! We had a reservation (which I'd recommend for a Friday), and we waited no time at all despite the crowd. 

The bread was great, our tomato, fresh mozzarella and basil appetizer was wonderful, and our two entrees (we had a mama's salad with grilled chicken and the pasta dinner special) were delicious!  We ended the meal with the apple crisp which was warm and served with a cinnamon gelato.  Everything was delicious.

Our server, as I mentioned before, made the evening great as well!  He was very attentive to our needs and engaged in conversation without being too talkative.

Definitely going back!!

We came here to celebrate my college graduation. I looked at TripAdvisor for a Italian restaurant good for kids and for special celebrations. That lead me to Mama's. However..... obviously people reviewing here and giving 5 stars don't know about Italian culinary. The restaurant menu includes a briefing about the owner's family and history. They can indeed be Italians but they have managed to create a menu based upon what us Americans think about Italian food (pasta sauces and breads with loads of garlic on it and lasagna with ricotta cheese on it). Just take as an example Olive Garden.... and I am not comparing Mama's to Olive Garden as the food here is much better, but in terms of laying down the american vision and taste for Italian food.

If there is an authentic Italian restaurant in Charlotte that is the Luce Ristorante in Uptown and also Dolce Ristorante. 

This restaurant has a decent quality of food, the service is great, but quite honestly, I have tasted better pasta than this one at Hawthorne Pizza Bar in Huntersville.

The Nutella pie that everyone claims to be "delicious" does not taste like Nutella at all. It tastes like Peanut Butter cheese cake. I even asked the server if she had made a mistake and brought the wrong dessert and she said that it was the correct one. We then said: It tastes like Peanut Butter and she replied: Really? But doesn't Nutella tastes like Peanut Butter to you??? That response made me think that clearly that the restaurant may not even know what they are cooking.

We went there for Mother's Day today & were shocked with the buffet instead of the regular menu. It was $35 per person but we stayed there just because we were already gathered there. The food wasn't good, none of my family members enjoyed it and even the lasagna was below average. Overall, I will not be going back because fancy food preparation does not compensate for poor taste.

Went to Mama Ricotta's last night with my family (there were 6 of us) for my daughter's birthday.  First turnoff was when we received our bruschetta appetizer - the bread was literally black!  Black - I'm talking completely burned to a crisp! - I cannot imagine what went through the server's mind that this was ok bring to us!???  Trying to cover it up with the bruschetta was not ok.  They did have the decency to remove the $9.50 charge from our bill.      

Second - on the menu they have chicken parmesan listed - Single serving -$18.00 and Family Style - $33.00.   We ordered one of each kind - 1 single and 1 family.  When placing the order for the family size chicken parmesan, the waiter asked if we wanted the pasta with it - we said yes.   That was all he said - "do you want to the pasta with it?"  We thought it was an odd question because when have you ever ordered chicken parmesan in any restaurant and not had it come with a side of pasta???   NEVER, absolutely NEVER.   When they brought the food to the table, my son, who ordered the single size chicken parm, received  2 pieces of chicken and pasta on the plate.   The family size order came with 5 pieces of chicken on a plate and a "soup size" bowl side of pasta.    When the waiter brought us the check, we had been charged $47.00 for the family size chicken parm, not $33.00 as the menu listed.    When I asked him about it, he said "that was for the pasta you said you wanted".  I calmly said "you did not say it was EXTRA for a small bowl of "side" pasta or that it would cost FOURTEEN DOLLARS!"   His only comment was "I can get the manager for you - I don't know - I can get the manager for you"   he just kept repeating that over and over again. It was weird.   All I wanted was clarification, because when I looked at the menu again - there was another column listed by the single and family that said "+2sides".  So I asked him again - what is the column that says 2 sides for?  If that is where you got the extra charge from , why did we only get ONE side of pasta?   Again, he flipped out and just repeated "I can get the manager"   What was his problem? Does he not understand the menu?  Not wanting to continue this scene the waiter was making, we just paid the bill and left.   I did not want my daughter's birthday dinner ruined by this idiot that can't explain the menu or doesn't understand it.  

I CANNOT believe they charged us FOURTEEN dollars for a small soup bowl of pasta not to mention - why are they charging AT ALL for pasta to go with chicken parm?    There was NO charge for the pasta that came with my son's single serving of chick parm?   WHY does pasta come with that size and not the other????  WHY???    

I will NEVER go back to this restaurant again - it is a total rip off.

Hadn't been in over a year and went on A Saturday night. It was quite busy but we were seated and had a nice waitress. My wine was sour so I sent it back. We ordered the Family Style Penne Vodka sauce pasta with Fresh Ricotta but alas it came without any ricotta. We also ordered the Polenta with Marscapone and Parm but it was Ice cold. They took it back and replaced it with hot Polenta. They also took it off our check . The Penne was good.
Just a lot of little things that went wrong for a 50.00 Dinner !

Finally was afforded the chance to try this place out.  I've heard many great things and can't say that they were wrong at all.

Started out with garlic knot bread that was delicious and warm and melted like butter.  I followed that up with a seafood dish that had Prince Edward island oysters and shrimp.  So good!  

The setting here is romantic and makes for a great date spot.  Our waiter was great, his table side manner was perfect for a relaxing and unwinding type dinner.  He did a great job selecting a wine that both me and my date really enjoyed.
The Food at Mama Ricotta's is very good!  The Pasta Entrees  are fresh and they have a wide variety of Dishes!!!!!!

My best friend was visiting from Puerto Rico and wanted pasta so I took him to one of the best places in Charlotte. It's been a while since I've had Mama ricotta's but not much has changed. The food was still great and service was friendly. Oh and the garlic bread oh my WORD hello carbs good bye diet! So very good and the calamari was delicious! Our only complaint would be the over cooked parmesan that was also under seasoned. Other than that everything was great! Thank you Mama ricottas we will be back!

Consistently great Italian food.  My personal favorites are the chopped salad, the lemon, broccoli, chicken penne (without the chicken), and the nutella pie (bigger than you can imagine and delicious).  The marscapone appetizer is also great, but I find I usually don't have room.  Can be very crowded, so I tend to go off times.  Parking is not usually an issue.  The wait staff have been consistently helpful and attentive.
What a great dining experience. David was very friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. Great drinks and great food. I will be back!

Wonderful restaurant! There is plenty of parking it's located in a shopping center area with a strip. The have an indoor and outdoor seating arrangement. I made a reservation on a Saturday night and didn't include one of the children in the party they were very accolading. Upon entering we were seated and greeted promptly. We were soon seated afterwards. The server was friendly, patient, knowledgeable, and attentive. Everything I ate was good and I'm not big on Italian. The salad, cheese ravioli, salmon, and chocolate cake were great. At the end they asked how we wanted to split the check. Very thoughtful even though one person was paying. The restrooms were clean and overall I have a great impression of this place. I will definitely return and highly recommend. This is a gem!
Had a great time here last night with family and friends. Food was awesome and the staff was excellent.  Pizza and Lasagna were both cooked perfectly.   Definitely will be back.

OMG! Mama Ricotta's! How do I love thee, let me count the penne vodka pasta with salmon! Yesterday to cap off our eclipse viewing fun, a group of new friends and I visited this amazing restaurant on my recommendation. I have been going here off and on for about 10 years and they NEVER disappoint! Everyone enjoyed their dishes (e.g., salmon dinner, pizza, lasagna, etc.) and I bought a couple of bread puddings for sharing at the table. Splendid
A friend recommended this place and it was AMAZING. Our waiter was great and timely. The food was fresh, authentic and delicious

Following a busy Sunday, I was having a serious craving for pasta. Living gluten free, I don't often get the chance to enjoy pasta in restaurants. There's no notation on the menu or on the website, but after catching a Yelp review mentioning a gluten free offering, we took the chance and headed to Mama Ricotta's.

On a Sunday evening, dining on a whim, we were pleased to be seated immediately even though we didn't have a reservation. We were placed in the back corner of the restaurant, which offered a decent vantage point for people watching and peeking at dishes coming out of the kitchen.

Our server came and shared with me that most of the pasta dishes can be made gluten free by substituting a GF penne. I hemmed and hawed and ended up choosing the Carbonara. My date ordered a salad to start, and it arrived within minutes of placing our order. The pacing was strange, though -- he got his salad, bread for the table was delivered, and our entrees came within five minutes of one another. Generally, I'm pumped about speedy service, but it created an awkward timeline of our meal -- potentially because we were dining 20 minutes before closing time.

My meal was placed in front of me in a large, black ceramic bowl. Three greasy fingerprints reflected the light on the rim of my bowl, and a long streak followed around the edge from where someone in the kitchen had attempted to wipe my plate before service. On a white plate, this may not have been so glaring, but it definitely caught my attention. The kitchen needs more clean linens, apparently.

My pasta was delightful. The flavor was perfect and it was delivered at just the right temperature. I was pleased with the portion size and with the generosity of the gentleman grating fresh parmesan over my noodles. I also sampled my date's short rib, and it was quite good.

If I wasn't so happy with the flavor, price and portion size of my gluten free pasta, the frantic service and streaky plate would have turned me off entirely. I'll give Mama Ricotta's another try when it's not so close to closing time, and hopefully they'll earn more stars from me.

Very good Italian food. The first time we went (pictures shown) we ordered shrimp scampi and chicken parm. SO GOOD! I rarely finish my meals but that does not happen here. You get bread with oil in the beginning the seasoning for the oil could be better. The second time we came (sorry, no pictures) it was half off wine bottles so we decided to do that. I got penne alla vodka with added chicken and my boyfriend got Chianti raised short rib. Mine was SO good and again I ate it all and my boyfriend was obsessed with his meal saying how soft and tender the meal was.
Great food! The penne vodka was great!  Get the Nutella cheesecake! Service was great and prices were reasonable too.  Will return
We visited today for lunch and ordered the carbonara and it tasted rancid and old!!!! It was AWFUL, we sent back and bolted!

Ok I've been eating Italian, real Italian, all my life with my friends and family through New York and New England and even in Italy and I am blown away by the authenticity and quality of the food at Mama Ricotta's - I've lived in Charlotte for about 2 years now and have missed this place until today, New Years Eve 2014. It's not really in my hood but decided I wanted some Rigatoni, Yelp'd it, and these guys came up. I've driven by it dozens of times and to be honest, thought it may be a sandwich/sub shop or some other take out type strip mall joint. DON"T BE FOOLED by the unassuming street front. Go inside and check it out!! I literally stopped at the reception (yes, I was greeted and welcomed) and had to smile. While taking in the inviting, Italian Chalet ambience that looks like it should be situated on some Mediterranean bluff, I was directed over to the bar to pick up my take away order. The kind gent behind the bar, who was on the horn taking other orders, glanced over with a quick smile to let me know he knew I was there. This is something I always notice in a restaurant or anywhere customer service is important - does that staff look past you or do they make an effort for eye contact? Based on the time frame from order to when I actually arrived (10 min) he was able to guess who I was and promptly went to packaging my order. Needless to say I was already excited - it smelled like my Auntie Rita's (not really my aunt) kitchen on Sunday afternoon. An oversized handled bag (re-usable) was filled with what appeared to be my order plus maybe another 2 patrons orders. Everything was kept in a warmer cabinet (not under a heat lamp) until I arrived which was also housing baking sheets full of tear apart rolls...they'll change your life, for sure. I had a moment to look around their bar/lounge area which I will certainly be back to. I didn't see the wine list but it appears you'll most definitely be able to find something you like - I saw lots of good opened bottles meaning you can get it by the glass. There is a wood fired pizza oven as soon as you walk in and I saw a few being carried out by the staff that looked really nice. The bar keep thanked me, wished me Happy New Year and off I went.
I ordered the Rigatoni with Meat Sauce and the Chopped Salad. Absolutely amazing!
The pasta was cooked perfectly - great texture and flavor. The gravy was bright red and full of fresh tomato flavor. The meat was tender and possibly rough chopped meatballs. The wife thought there should be more gravy but I thought it was just perfect. The salad was certainly a masterpiece. Chopped is certainly the right name for this salad. Everything in it was chopped so that it blended all of the flavors of the salad in every bight.  Olives, Pepperoncini, Tomatoes, Blue Cheese, Nuts (Walnuts??), Lettuce, Kale, Carrot, Onion, Chick Pea.....all I can say is, Damn!
Needless to say, I'll be back, lots - Can't wait to work my way through their menu. 
Thanks, Mama!

Shortly after moving to Charlotte, I fell in love with Mama Ricotta's.  I blame it on the goat cheese and mascarpone dip, which was my first bite of food on my very first visit to Mama's.

Mama's is the type of place where families feel equally comfortable as couples on hot dates.  The dining room is cozy with large family-sized booths plus intimate tables for two, vintage family photos, and a large wood-fired pizza oven.

My recommendations:  goat cheese and mascarpone dip, mama's salad, chopped salad, housemade burrata, any of the pastas, pollo bianco, bread pudding.. and so much more.. 

I posted a full review on the blog, but these are the highlights.
Absolutely DELICIOUS meal.  The best Italian food Ive had since moving from NYC.  Authentic meals, fresh ingredients and excellent little details.  Must try the chianti short ribs ~ yum

We went out with friends to try this restaurant. We order apps of Mozzarella and Tomatoes, Bruschetta with Mozzarella (you have to ask for the Mozzarella). We did ask for additional Balsamic Vinegar. The addition made them from delicious to outstanding! The house made Mozzarella was so creamy and smooth. As a group of 4 we decided to do the family portion Chicken Parmesan with angel hair pasta. There was very little tomato basil sauce, but we asked for additional and they gladly brought it. The flavor of the Chicken Parmesan was on point. The side of angel hair pasta was enormous and way more than 4 adults needed. 
If anyone left hungry it was their own fault. Portions generous and very tasty. Our waiter was very attentive and made sure we had drinks full and cleared dishes to keep things tidy. 
We will definitely be back again!

I think I will just get right to why it was given a one star because other than the one really big bad part it was an okay evening (nothing to write home about) that I would have probably given a 3 star.  

Our food arrives, I ordered the cheese ravioli but added shrimp to it for an additional $6.  When it comes I begin to eat my first shrimp and see it doesn't look cooked.  I really inspected it, like always the lighting is low for "the mood" so it was hard to see.  I look through my other shrimps and they all still look very gray.  I ask others at the table and they agree.  When the waitress comes by to check on us I genuinely asked for her opinion as well and she too says it doesn't look cooked - it's raw shrimp! She takes it to be re-cooked and it comes back all well and good but now I'm not really feeling the shrimp so I avoid it.  The manager comes by and asks "is the shrimp to your liking now?" To my liking? I don't feel like this is like beef where I confused rare, medium, and well.  Shrimp is either cooked or it's not.  

My bill comes, and though I didn't ask for it I somewhat expected them to comp the $6 shrimp charge.  Nope.  It was still one there.  I looked up the possibilities of what could happen from eating raw shrimp and it stated that it would most likely cause food poisoning if anything.  Call me crazy though, but I would hope places I go to eat would help me avoid getting food poisoning from their food.  I felt like I got no apologies, no customer service for a fairly big screw up, and I could have gotten really sick from their mistake on a holiday weekend no less!

I don't think I'll choose to go back here again from this experience.  I might if a member of my party requests it (because other than that it wasn't terrible), but I will NOT order a meat dish from them again.

Delicious!! I heard so many good things about this restaurant and finally tried it! Now it is one of my favorites in Charlotte. Their pork ribs are outstanding and I now crave the goat cheese and mascarpone appetizer. The portions were huge. My boyfriend and I splitt the pork ribs and we were both stuffed. Everything I've tried at Mama Ricotta's has been fabulous!

I loved this Italian restaurant and thought it was extremely affordable! That being said we got 2 glasses of wine, 2 beers, a small Tuscan salad, penne alla vodka with chicken, polka alla griglia, and the chocolate cake-- and spent about 60ish dollars. We loved every single bite. Service was extremely nice and we got our food quickly. They also had delicious garlic rolls they give you in the beginning. Loved the experience.

It has been about a year since I've been back  only because I live in south Charlotte  and this restaurant is not close to me 
The food is wonderful fresh and I've been  The food is wonderful fresh and  delicious. Came here today for lunch and there was hardly anyone there. Nick was our waiter with excellent service and selection. I was pleasantly pleased with the chicken pasta dish and  short rib cheesesteak sandwich - awesome.
Will not wait another year to return.

FYI - - - lunch is a excellent time to come here

This terrific casual Italian place in Charlotte's Midtown neighborhood is a great spot for lunch, dinner, or a couple of drinks after work. The food is wonderful, particularly their Penne Alla Vodka and their humongous calzones. Service is always friendly and prompt, and the covered patio overlooking the Greenway is a great spot in warm weather. There are better Italian restaurants in Charlotte, but for the price, Mama Ricotta's is consistently on target.

We have enjoyed this restaurant several times before. Last night was definitely a change. We had the calamari as an appetizer and was disappointed. It used to be spicy with peppers but was pretty plain last night. I also had the Lasagna for my entree which was not what I expected. Another party in our group ordered a large salad as their meal and was brought a small salad. The waitress didn't know how to handle this mix up. Very disappointed with this visit.

I absolutely hate to write negative reviews, but in this case, it's unfortunately unavoidable.

I honestly have no idea how this restaurant has the rating that it does, because it is an extremely poor example of what Italian food is.  The best way for me to sum up the food here is: One step below Olive Garden and Ragazzis.  The food is watered-down and bland, Americanized 'fake Italian' dishes that cater to those patrons with unsophisticated palates who don't know the difference. 

I ordered the Pasta Carbonara when we are here, and I have no idea how they classify what was placed in front of me as 'Carbonara'.... It was basically a fake from-the-jar Alfredo sauce on top of undercooked vermicelli with some frozen peas and bacon thrown in.  In order to be Carbonara, the dish must have a sauce comprised mostly of whisked eggs, pasta water, Parmesan, and seasoning.  Calling what was served "Carbonara" is just wrong, and is an unfair representation of Italian food.

The wine was actually fairly good (I think we ordered a Pinot and a Riesling), and our waitress was very kind.  She was so nice that I felt bad about hardly touching my food, and didn't want to tell her how bad we all thought our meals were. It really wasn't her fault that the food was awful!

There are several other Italian cuisine restaurants in the area that are actually real Italian, and are far better than Mama Ricottas (for ex: Vivace, Fiamma).  If you enjoy real Italian food and/or are a foodie, save yourself the time and money and search out another option.

Sadly, the only reason that I even gave this place 2 stars is because the service and the staff were pleasant and attentive.

I was back here a little while ago as a friend loves the place and though I can think of several other Italian places I like better, I do like the folks and the food here.

Portions are good sized and service is good as well.

My wife and I went to this restaurant based on a Yelp recommendation. It was awesome. The penne Ala vodka was delicious. The tiramisu was unbelievable. Nice size portions and delicious flavors. We will definitely be back again.

This place rocks.  Great chopped salad, full of flavor.  Incredible house made ravioli, perfect texture to the pasta and perfect cheese.  Top that off with a delicious dessert and stellar service to boot, and it all adds up to a flawless experience.  Wish this was located where we live.  We would come here every week at least.

Purchase several dishes for a family gathering, and the family size shocked us all as it was small...2 portions worth/dish.  The taste was good, but -for the price- expected much larger portions.  For family orders, there are better deals elsewhere.

My experience here was good. Host or owner was very nice at the front, helped me with anything needed. I ordered the ravioli in a vodka sauce. The sauce was thick buying felt like they used a meat sauce and could have been creamier. They bring bread but it just looks like seasoned frozen bad, not bad, just not something for a good Italian restaurant.  I would probably try somewhere else next time or order something different. It is not a bad restaurant at all just I have had better
Best most authentic Italian around, and I'm a picky NYer.  Great food, but book ahead or the waits can be long.

Great place, I love the atmosphere, and the food is delicious. One of my favorite pasta restaurants in all of Charlotte. There's a server named Ben that has provided us with excellent service, he recommended a great Malbec for me since I told him I like dry reds. Ben, as well as Mama Ricotta's, have always exceeded expectations!

I can't say much about Mama Ricotta's location, because it's in a little strip mall type area, and I hate those. Moving right along....

Mama Ricotta's is great, some of the better Italian food in Charlotte, as far as I'm concerned. It's a really popular place (if you can't get a table, try the Ethiopian place in the same complex--great food, never packed, yummmmy), so try to make reservations or show up either earlier or later in the night. Once you're at your table, though, everything's all right. 

Great beers and wines available, so you're always able to get well-lubricated over the course of a loud, heaping Italian meal. And the meals are ALWAYS huge. Their pastas are great--that's what most people order, as far as I can tell--as are their typical Italian restaurant salads and appetizers. You can get everything served Family Style if you like, which makes for portions that you won't believe. Great value, especially if you don't mind taking home large amounts of food to nibble on for the rest of the weekend. I love their Chicken (forget what it's called, but it's grilled with lemon), and I got like three breasts of it last time I was there, which is  nuts. 

If you love Italian, and love eating lots and lots, check it out.

I LOVE this place. My hubby and I visit Mama Ricotta's fairly frequently. We chose to have our NYE dinner here with friends... and couldn't have chosen a tastier place to wrap up 2017. 

We were seated in a booth on the far side of the restaurant against the windows, and were slightly concerned that we'd be a little cold given the wintry temp outside. The heat was on full-blast, though, and we were SO happy about it - seriously, when are you ever actually warm in a restaurant?!

I highly recommend splitting the Chopped Salad -- the small ($7) is great to share with two people if you're looking for a little green before carb-ing out. Hubby got his usual lasagna and considering his plate was clean in 5 minutes, I'm betting it was awesome (didn't get to sneak a bite). I chose the Pollo Carciofi and it was seriously incredible -- my new favorite go-to meal for sure. Even better, I only ate half and have a super yummy lunch to look forward to this week. 

Thanks for yet another great experience, MR!

I would rate this as the most authentic Italian food in charlotte. During the winter there is a great fire going on the patio making the patio still nice to eat. The portions are large which is great if your going for a family style dining, Prices are a little high but for the amount of food your getting its completely worth it. This is the type of Italian food you expect the traditional large Italian woman (and I mean large large not just slightly overweight but very rotund) to be making food in the kitchen. I have been to Italy two times and gives this place a thumbs up for best Italian food in charlotte - please do yourself a favor and go there maybe even bring your own marshmallows to roast :) .
We loved it here! The family style entrees was great in portions. The ravioli and carbonara was excellent. We got calamari spicy and it probably was the best calamari I've had!

My party had a reservation and we were seated immediately. I ordered a medium white pizza with chicken & #noregrets. It was so good! Bread and olive oil/ red pepper is brought out while you wait for your food. My cousin ordered the penne ala vodka and she really enjoyed it. Our server was super friendly and polite. I love the atmosphere or this restaurant and I'd eat here again.

A great place to take the family for an Italian night. They have portions big enough to share with the family or you can get an individual dish. I suggest not getting an appetizer if you're looking to finish your meal. It's still a big dish for one person. They bring out Fresh bread and oil before dinner, so that can be your appetizer. For dinner, I ordered the Penne Alla Vodka with chicken to give it some extra protein. For a red sauce it was actually very light. I also got their sangria which was delicious and highly suggest if you are looking for something light and fruity. The service was great and it didn't take long for our food to come out for 4 people. This is also a great place for a date or if you are looking for catering, they do that too!

I have not had the pleasure of eating at Mama Ricotta's in a long long time until the night before a half marathon came and we were looking through options of where to "carb load" before the race.

We made reservations as our group of 7 was fairly large, they accommodated us and even called about 3 times to make sure we were still coming.  With a small dining space I guess they need to ensure their bookings so that they don't end up holding a table when they can really seat customers waiting for a table.

Fresh rolls with olive oil and red pepper flakes were a nice surprise... usually it's just the generic bread with oil and balsamic.  I found it to be a nice twist to an old favorite.

The restaurant itself has an old neighborhood-familiarity to it and everyone working makes you feel welcome and happy that you are there sharing a meal with them.

Its Italian, I don't know about authentic, but the portions are ginormous and the favors are comforting.

I'd say the only crazy thing about the place is the wait since it's so popular, but there are ways around it, reservations... eating an "early" dinner.  I'd say the earlier the better since it will give you more time to burn off all the yummy calories consumed.
This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Try the Ravioli or the Angel Hair Pasta w/ Meatballs.

I can't remember the last time I've been to Mama Ricotta's but I promise not to stay away so long anymore.  

Mama Ricotta's has been in Charlotte for years and definitely is one of Charlotte's better family friendly Italian places. They have a decent sized dining room, a bar around the pizza oven, a regular bar and a nice sized patio that is enclosed in cooler months.  

I was here with my dinner group and there were 10 of us and at first our waiter seemed a bit off guard but he quickly got into gear. He explained draft beers are $3 on Tuesdays! Yay! There were 4 selections of which 2 were local of OMB and NoDa.

I went with the ciopino which I thank the Food Network for getting me interested in trying the dish and also ordered a small chopped salad. Even though the restaurant seemed busy, the food came out fast. I was only half done with my salad with the meal arrived. The salad was delicious and probably one of my favorite Italian salads. The ciopino was almost too beautiful to eat but I managed very well.  And then the tiramisu for dessert was light and slightly sweet which is just what I was looking for to finish the meal.

I enjoyed my time here very much. I plan to come back to try their other specialties and pizzas.
I ordered Salmoni Arrostiti Olivada. Oven roasted premium filet of salmon. Absolutely amazing. Highly recommended. We also ordered a few appetizers that was also excellent. No disappointments at all.

Another great meal at Mama R's. They serve consistently great food and as usual, their sauce/gravy was outstanding.

Give them a try if you're looking for some great Italian food.

When you think of a nice Italian restaurant, you don't think it would come in a strip mall, but Mama Ricotta's bucks the trend. Not only does the atmosphere & decor give the impression of a nicer Italian place, the food is pretty good.

While you may be thinking that this is a dinner only place, this is actually a really popular lunch place. There is usually a line during lunch, but it moves pretty quickly, especially if the outside seating is open. While the food can be a tad on the pricey side, I have yet to have a meal I haven't been happy with. They have plenty of selections for all Italian lovers so don't expect just the obvious options. 

I'd suggest this place as more of a dinner place, mainly because of the prices along with the portion sizes. If you lunch it here, it may be a long afternoon at work trying to stay awake. And with their wine selection, making this a date destination isn't a bad idea either.

I loved the atmosphere of Mama Ricotta's. The bread was so delicious, but when we were out, we were never offered a refill..bummer. 
I ordered the grilled chicken entree and it was really good. The side items were only decent, spinach and broccolini. 
The BEST part of the meal, the dessert! The cheesecake was AMAZING! I only had a few bites and it was enough to satisfy my sweet tooth.

This was our first time eating here and we loved it! We came in on Friday night during the dinner rush, but we never felt hurried. My wife had the rigatoni with meat sauce while I opted for the ravioli with meat sauce. Our server, Ben, suggested we start out with the tomato and mozzarella appetizer and he even pointed me towards the Malbec, which was perfect with my dinner. A really great night, we look forward to coming back!

Mama's is solid Italian food.  Great wine selections by the glass & bottle. 

I love their Tuscan Salad & add shrimp.  The small is plenty for a meal.

They have a great patio with a fireplace table that is cozy.  The patio can be enclosed & heated so they use it all year round.

The servers are always friendly and helpful as are the staff at the host station and mgmt.

For the first time ever I ate at mama ricotta's tonight with my family, I went because my cousin told me it was good.  We ate family style and it was pretty good, I wasn't a fan of the caesar salad because the dressing taste like a tangy mayo.  Other than that it was pretty tasty food.  The service was excellent, our waitress was really nice and very promp.  We were in and out really fast, the longest wait we had was to be seated and that was about 10 minutes or so.

Mama Ricotta's is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Here's why. I like the atmosphere and I love the food. I like Italian and MR has some if the best Italian food in the city. The staff is good as well. My favorite dish is the chicken meatloaf served at lunch? It's a must try? Promise you'll like it.

Once again I had an amazing experience at Mama Ricottas. I made a reservation on open table via the restaurants website and it was so easy and convenient.

We started off with the Goat cheese and marscapone dip because - of course! It's so amazing, I always order it. My main entree was the Pollo Bianco, a delicious chicken breast dish served with melted mozzarella, prosciutto, and a mushroom cream sauce. It was served with a side of garlic mashed potatoes and steamed squash and zucchini. This meal was melt in your mouth delicious. My friends loved their dishes as well, one of which was the same Pollo Bianco and the other was the Pollo Carifoci. Not sure if I spelled that right but she loved it. This dish was chicken with artichokes, capers and a lemon butter sauce - their version of chicken piccata. 

Dessert was great, however I did get it to go because I was stuffed! Chocolate cannoli cake. Absolutely amazing. 

Our server Abbi was attentive and extremely welcoming and did an amazing job. 

We will be back as soon as possible!

We are repeat visitors here as we love the Main dishes. The salads are amazing, too. Previously, we have had a few blips on the radar with soggy veggies and spotty service. Our visit a week ago was stellar. Everything was completely on point. Our request for a booth smoothly managed. Our salad order taken and filled immediately. And the entrees with accompanying sides were delicious and perfectly seasoned. A great night out!

This is not real italian food to me. The sauce isn't right. The chicken parm is so thick it's like an entire chicken breast, and the seasoning on the breadcrumbs is so salty it took away from the rest of the dish. Chicken parm should be super thin and crispy, and this was just a disappointment. The sauce tasted plain and sweet, like it wasn't seasoned. I was surprised that our meal was so lackluster considering the number of 5 star reviews this restaurant has. We probably won't come back to Mama Ricotta's. I'll stay home and make pasta from scratch.
As good as it gets, in my opinion! I absolutely love this place! I take my family whenever they come into town. Great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and great food.

Everything was EXTREMELY salty. I could kinda see how the flavors might have been good, except it was buried under a ton of salt. I would write more but I've got to put my feet up so they don't swell.

Consistently good, very reasonable prices. The service is not always great. I guess it depends on what server you get. But the food makes up for any bad service. Highly recommend the pizzas, chicken parmesan and lasagna. They make a terrific meat sauce!

Our server Leslie was a perfect waitress and very knowledgeable about the menu items. 

The appetizer was decent, the entrees were also good, not the best I have ever had, but really good overall. 

Where this restaurant shines the most is the dessert, every dessert I've had/seen was well priced for the huge portions you get. The cannoli was very good, probably the largest cannoli I have seen, the shell was very fresh and the cream inside was good. I think it could have been more sweet and less ricotta but still I very much liked it. 

I definitely will be back, if you go no question get a dessert.

I've eaten there twice now, and really enjoyed it both times. This IS exceptional because I'm not a big fan of Italian cuisine! We ordered our food "family style" both times. Lots of food and lots of fun that way. 

We had the Chicken Parm, the Chicken Carciofi, and the Cheese Ravioli. All were outstanding, especially having been preceded with the Tuscan Salad and "Mama's Salad". Fanatastico!

Great food and great service. I'll go back again if I'm in downtown Charlotte in the future.
Plastic in my food ,and the MOD wasn't that accommodating.. I use to be a fan !! Things happen,but Terribly disappointed in how management handled the situation.

Ive had good and bad experiences here- Ive been three times: Overall I would go back ive decided 

Decent prices and decent (not wonderful) Italian food. 

The first time I ordered the vodka riggies- which came recommended...While they were ok I make much better at home so I wasn't impressed. My family didnt care for their lunches either 

2nd time- I was sick so I ordered soup and salad- I dont think its fair to judge on this- my boyfriend raved about his meal (he has a special pasta with lobster sauce) 

3rd - I finally found something I really enjoyed here ! I had the Pollo Carciofi ...delicious! I did substitute the polenta but the chicken was fabulous ...I will definitely come back!

I also had the red sangria which I enjoyed more than Maggianos 

Service has always been great- try to call ahead if you can

This is a great Italian restaurant! I've been here a couple times now and have always had wonderful food.

Note the portion sizes are pretty large so come hungry or with a friend or group! (They do come in individual portions or family size). It's great if you're looking to try a bunch of different things.

The two times I've gone, I've seen birthday parties, girls night out, date night and big family gatherings. 

As with almost all Italian restaurants, they serve dinner rolls. These are delicious plain but even better dipped in their oil. If you're sensitive to spice, be wary as the oil has some heat to it.

Their salads are also generous in portions. I went with my boyfriend and we split a small Tuscan salad prior to our entree. We ordered the family size ravioli with meat sauce which is enough to feed 2-3 people. The cheese filling is delicious!! 

I can't wait to go back and try some of their other dishes like lasagna and pollo Romano.

Ps: if you're an Open Table user, they are on there!

When the craving for pasta hits - you just can't let it go unanswered- you turn to your trusty Yelp app to figure out where to go. After seeing the pictures of giant plates of chicken parmesan smothered in cheese we decided on Mama Ricottas. 

I was shocked at how busy they were on a Sunday night! We were seated immediately but after sitting down we saw people waiting. The atmosphere was great. A dimly lit Italian restaurant just as we were hoping for. Service could have been better, but I think our server was just over it by Sunday night. He probably worked a double or two over the weekend-- I get it. 

We ordered a bottle of wine and started in on the bread and olive oil. The calamari sold me because of the cherry peppers. However, I didn't realize we needed to order it Rhode Island style for it to come out this way. In my excitement I didn't read close enough. Was disappointed when it didn't come out with the peppers, but now I know for next time. My server offered to have it tossed, but since it was our mistake, I declined. 

The chicken parm was just as big and beautiful as it was in the picture. Took over half of it home. I would prefer a little more sauce (the marinara was great), so next time I would just ask for it. Boyfriend got the lasagna, which he loved. For $12 it was a great deal. 

Overall, I felt like the food quality and atmosphere was a great value for the price. Great place for a date night-- we will definitely be back!

The anipasto app is the best thing you can get outside of Brooklyn. There is no Italian south of jersey that can even compare. Trust me. I have searched north Carolina for 7 years to find something even tolerable and this is above and beyond.

Mama Ricotta's has a big downside - notably it's in a strip mall right on King's Drive.  That makes it easy to access, but it also means that you are likely to dismiss the place as having no atmosphere.  You would do yourself a disservice by doing so (it is worth noting that Villa Antonio has a similar problem on South Boulevard).

Assuming you step inside - rather than dining on the patio - then you make a transition into a great little Italian haven, and you won't regret your decision.  I'm not sure about the patio.  Perhaps once the construction in the area is done and you can see the Little Sugar Creek greenway (assuming that is possible), then it will be okay.  For now, the view is pretty bad.  For now, sit inside.

The service of the staff is great.  We have never found ourselves wanting of anything.  The second the glass is missing an inch or so, they are right there to ask if we would like more (or just refill it).  The bread is plentiful.  The food is delivered promptly.  Even the wait to sit down has never been a problem - but we usually arrive early.  I would suggest reservations if you like to eat later.

When it comes to the food, prepare to eat heartily, because you'll get plenty of it, and it will be full of lots of stuff you probably shouldn't eat.  So if you're on a diet, you might want to think twice.  Otherwise, dig in.

Executive Chef Tom is inventive, creative and a proponent of using locally grown ingredients as evidenced by the exquisite mushroom ravioli I just scarfed that was adorned with a myriad of different types of mushrooms all of which were hand-foraged from a local source.  Enjoy your faves from the menu but also do yourself a favor from time to time and listen to the specials.  Chef Tom is on it.  (Also, Server Sheena is my new favorite!  She's a genuine sweetheart.)

Came here for a dinner date with the hubs. We has reservations and came in on time. We waited just a few minutes. We got sat in the patio area that's fully covered. Although I don't mind the patio area, it was insanely hot. Almost miserable hot. I was sweating and this was at night during the winter time! I looked around and saw people wearing t-shirts and tank tops. I mentioned something to the server and he said he would ask them to change it and said that if we wanted to eat inside then we would have to wait again for a table. Ugh, annoying. 

It was my husband's first time here and I always raved about this place to him. Last time I was here I overheard our server mention the specials to the tables next to me. I don't know if they are doing specials again but we weren't offered any. Kind of a disappointment. We started off with the calamari. They were breaded good and the sauce was delicious. My husband also got the salad. I got the penne alla vodka with chicken and gluten free noodles. My husband got the same thing but with whole wheat noodles. We noticed our food took a little longer than normal. All the tables that got sat after us, after we got our appetizers all got their foods before us. We finally got the food and I was pretty pleased with the gluten free noodles. The texture was good and it was hard to tell that they were gluten free which is a good thing. My husband also liked his whole wheat noodles. During the whole time, our server was pretty distant. I think he was pretty turned off that we complained about the heat. He filled up our waters once and then towards the end he asked about dessert and that was pretty much it. 

I'm hoping next time is a better experience. Not just for me but for my husband. I seriously love their penne alla vodka though.

One of the last great Italian restaurants in Charlotte. Delicious every single time. A larger bar area would bring new energy to the place, and maybe some nights with live music , but otherwise, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

I have been here twice recently. Once for lunch and once for dinner. I love the patio here and enjoy the overall feel of it. The calamari is decent but the goat cheese app is something I frequently dream of!! It is amazing. It has marinara and toasted bread points for dipping. I have had the spaghetti with meat sauce and the ravioli with meat sauce. The angel hair is made in house daily and just to die for. The ravioli is cheese filled and the meat sauce is a lovely combo of meat and chunky tomatoes. 

The food is awesome and the service is good as well. I noticed they have a pizza oven as a center piece so I would love to try their pizza next time. But overall a great find for a really decent price. They also have family style dishes which is one of my favorite things ever so I plan on trying that very soon as well. A def must try at least once!

We arrived early for our reservation and were immediately seated. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and suggested their specials. The food was very good. I added a dollop of homemade ricotta to my dish and it was sublime! Will definitely be back!

Everything about our experience this evening at Mama Ricotta's was good but not outstanding. 
We came in fairly early and were seated immediately, which was nice. They provide free bread and oil, but the bread didn't seem very fresh at all so we didn't touch that other than a few bites. For an appetizer, we started with the goat cheese and mascarpone dip. The tomato sauce was great, and the tangy cheese provided a good balance of flavors. For our entrees, my girlfriend ordered the pollo bianco and I got the lasagna. The pollo bianco was really good - the mushroom gravy went well with the mashed potatoes and chicken, and the broccoli and cauliflower were amazing except for 2 broccoli florets that were severely burnt! The lasagna I had was good, but it was a bit too cheesy for me. Don't get me wrong, I love cheese..but it really just tasted like layers of lasagna noodles with a bit of ricotta between them and a ton of mozzarella melted on top with a bit of tomato and meat sauce on the side. I would have loved for a bit more flavor throughout. 
Our waiter was a bit awkward as well. He did a good job keeping glasses full, taking orders, etc. but just seemed like he wasn't sure how to interact with us. 
All in all, the food and service were solid, and I'd be willing to come back..but I also wasn't blown away by any aspect.

The pollo Bianco was delicious, our waitress was very helpful and told us we could substitute the sauces out-
Family oriented restaurant with options for family portions-
Service was great with a pleasant server, food got out pretty quickly. Server was new but knew about the options available and was overall attentive- 
Prices were reasonable

It a nice intimate setting. I love the music and ambiance- even for lunch. We had the preferred penne pasta with vodka sauce. The noodles had a lil after-taste, but the salmon was fresh. The sauce is delicious. We also tried the bruschetta- needs more bread for heavy dippers: like myself. Calamari was good.... the shrimp scampi had wayyyyyy to much basil and parsley!  The natural flavor of the pasta was taken away! I'll come back, but next time- I just want some simple salmon and maybe veggies.

Great place if you're looking for authentic, delicious Italian with good service. Our server (whose name I don't remember sorry!!) was amazing and knowledgeable. He chose a wine that was fabulous. And the special was a butternut squash ravioli that was to DIE for.

Mama Ricotta's is like a nice warm blankie in the winter: comforting, familiar and shareable. I've stopped by Mama Ricotta's many a time and, frankly, it's always been at least a good if not great meal. The service has always been friendly (especially in the bar for some reason) and even when things haven't gone perfectly, they have always offered to make it right. Big points here. 

Since I've been here so many times, here is a rundown of a few of my personal favorites:

Goat cheese & marscapone dip: Exactly the nom-ness you would expect. Warm creamy dip topped with tasty tomato sauce and served with grilled crostini.

Pasta Primavera: Pretty basic, but a light and colorful veggie angel hair dish. I've only ordered this with the EVOO sauce but I'm always adding extra spice to give it a kick.  

Butternut squash ravioli: There is a fancier name to this in house, but you'll see what I mean. Delicious, tender butternut squash raviolis with an orange creame sauce, bits of proscuitto, walnuts and sage. It's ass  on a plate and it's amazing.

It's been a while since I've had dessert here, so I really can't comment on that. However, I have been here for brunch and it was asi asi...but really, Mama, you'll know I'll be coming back. Solid resto, solid food and solid service.

I absolutely adore this place and specifically will arrange time in trips to Charlotte to nip in for lunch or dinner.

Why *only* four stars then?  Well, the last trip wasn't so great overall.

My order was fabulous - we started with the Goat Cheese and Mascarpone dip which is a necessity if you go.  Seriously.  For my dinner I went with the Pollo Bianco, which was phenomenal.  Chicken with prosciutto and mozzarella with a chianti mushroom sauce and a side of mash.  Super delish.

My wife's order was a little less fortunate.  She ordered pasta with marinara and added meatballs.  The pasta and sauce were good, meatballs just okay at best.  Super disappointing after comparing both the app and my meal.

Service was great as always, and I wouldn't hesitate to go back!  Maybe will just order something besides the meatballs next time.

Loved it! We were seated outside and I loved the cute little fireplace and string lights. Nice place for a date. Hubby and I ordered the family size carbonara pasta and it was delicious. The noodles were nice and thick. The sauce was creamy and so tasty. The bacon chunks gave the pasta the perfect salty crunch and flavor. Service was excellent!

You know my rule- if Frank Scibelli's name is on it, it's going to be delicious. 

The Warm Goat Cheese & Mascarpone appetizer is a must for a group. I also love the house made mozzarella and tomatoes. Their Chopped Salad is one of my favorites. I like to get that with a soup. Big fan of the meatballs. They are made with turkey, ricotta, and prosciutto. Delicious. My buddy Fritz always gets their lasagna. 

I like this place because it's pretty versatile. You can take your family, a date, do a girls' night, grab drinks, etc. They have a nice little bar area and their new patio is fantastic. 

Service is always is great. Super friendly staff. Thank you Mama's for being such a consistent go to spot.

Most of the Italians I have known have mothers and grandmothers that are very likely to tell you, "You're so skinny! You need to eat!  Sit down and let me cook you something."  That kind of woman, who can cook me something anytime she wants, must be behind Mama Ricotta's.

It's very warm and inviting inside, with bright reds and oranges and fun paintings, while still being dim and intimate.  The great wood stove and friendly staff that greets you certainly sets the stage for the evening.  We started with the goat cheese appetizer which was creamy and decadent, though didn't scream "goat cheese" to me.  It was very good, nonetheless.  For my main entree, I got one of the great meat sauce pasta dishes which is everything you expect great Italian food to be.  I was also impressed with the wine list (which comes to you as more of a book than a list) and the many small-production Italian wines that it contains.

Though a little tough to find, given it's strip mall locale, Mama Ricotta's is a must-try!

Service was good and the food was great. Came out surprisingly fast too. I would give the restaurant 5 stars but my only gripe was that there menu was a little short. Other than that, it was a great place. I would definitely go back.
I've been going to Mama Ricotta's for at least 20 years and the food has always been consistently good,.  The owner is a --- ---- but he does have great food.

While eating a late Saturday night dinner with my husband the entire staff cleaned around us.  From the b floors to breaking down tables.  We will never again dine at this place.  Food was nothing to write home about, average pasta.

We visited this place on Saturday and was so disappointed.  Our wait was one hour and a half without prior reservations.  We sat outside in the heat with a toddler.  When we were notified that table was ready, we were seated back outside in an open area, still hot and nats flying everywhere.  The manager explain there was a wedding party and no seats available inside.  We asked to be moved to the other side where the fans were blowing so the bugs would not get all over the food and was told as soon as table was ready we could.  A second waiter came out to discourage us from moving in a very condescending manner.  We did the appreciate the service and left.  Disappointed with service, lack of accommodation and only got to taste  a piece of bread before the nats took it.   It would be nice if you could wait in a cooler area also

Let me start by saying, I wanted to love this place. I've heard nothing but praise from locals. Tonight was my second visit, and I can firmly say, "I am not in love."

My first meal at MR was lunch with coworkers. I ordered a calzone. The crust was bland and the filling seemed sparse. I was underwhelmed but my coworkers raved about their dishes. I figured I should just order something else next time. C'est la vie.  

Tonight, a friend and I headed over to MR for dinner. I started off with bruschetta that tasted freshly made but had an overpowering acidic/vinegar flavor. The bread was already soggy like it had been sitting for a bit. My friend had calamari that she didn't care for at all.

We both ordered slow cooked brisket (I think the waitress said about 7 hours.) with grilled veggies and mashed potatoes. The entree was good, and the portion was huge...more than enough for two people. Leftovers are in my future. Of everything I've had at MR, this was the best. Still, I wasn't blown away by it. It was just good, not great.

On each visit the wait staff has been very friendly and attentive. Our waitress from tonight (wish I could remember her name) was super friendly and helpful. She did a great job.

My friend and I weren't complaining about the food but our waitress asked so we told her what we though of it. And the manager came out to tell my friend the calamari would be removed from her bill, and offered her a free dessert, which was a very responsible and nice gesture. I was mildly annoyed because I don't think she even acknowledged my presence. At this point it didn't even matter. I don't see a return in my future. 

I don't eat a lot of Italian food but next time I'm in the mood, I'm on to the next one.

Mama mia!  

Mama Ricotta's has been around for a while-vacillating between standard and pretty good Italian food.  I have to say, the past couple of times I have been eaten at Mama Ricotta's, it has been really great! They have stepped things up a notch or two, that's for sure.

The service is fast, friendly and consistent. The rolls they bring out have not changed. SO HARD to eat just one.  Impossible for some...

They have changed up the menu-adding some modern, lighter options but have kept their golden standards. My favorite is the chopped salad with romaine, gorgonzola, garbanzo beans and walnuts. The walnuts are chopped so finely, you can barely detect them. But they add this subtle nutty crunch that is outstanding. Calamari is great and the warm mascarpone dip is...drool worthy.

My husband always gets the penne a la vodka with chicken---every. single. time. The bites I snag are always excellent!

I also discovered a new favorite wine from their menu--Dreaming Tree Crush.  This red is delicious and subtly sweet.  Very easy to drink (maybe a little too easy).  It's actually a Dave Matthews collaboration!! 

If you haven't been to Mama Ricotta's in a while, you're in for a pleasant treat!!

I haven't tried that many Italian restaurants in Charlotte yet, but this one is the best so far.  Low lighting creates a classic, relaxing atmosphere that is also suitable for families (meals can be served family style if you like).  The classic dishes are fantastic, but I haven't had great luck with the more original dishes (pork with grapes, while it sounded good on the menu, was not so tasty after all).  My food did come out burned once, but the waiter responded so apologetically and the turn around on a new dish was so fast that it didn't matter.  The manager came by shortly after as well and I think my meal was free  - customer service here is key.  It reminded me that a mistake in the kitchen won't ruin your meal if the people who work there care enough to fix it (looking at you Cabo Fish Taco!)

We were looking for a casual, family friendly Italian spot for dinner and chose this place after reading the reviews. We were not disappointed. Very nice decor - the wood fired pizza oven between the bar and the dining room is a nice, rustic touch. 

Hubby and I really enjoyed the herbed rolls and olive oil that comes complimentary - the kid not so much, so we ordered garlic cheese bread. Since the kid wanted to skip the cheese, they added extra slices of the bread. That was much appreciated. The rooms and the bread were flavorful, soft and warm.  I started with the caprese (mozzarella & tomato appetizer on the menu), as that is always my measure of an Italian place. The tomatoes were ripe and the mozzarella very flavorful. I did have to add balsamic, as it only comes dressed with olive oil. 

The kid chose spaghetti with meat sauce (and a meatball). He liked the meatball a lot, though he complained the meat sauce was "spicy."  The meat in the sauce did have a kick, so heads up if you have a kid in your party that's weird about stuff like that. 

Hubby had rigatoni with a bolognese sauce (he added ricotta) that he enjoyed. The meat in the bolognese had the same spice kick, but Hubby is a grown up and loved it. I ordered the cheese ravioli with a butter and sage sauce (you get a choice of sauces). It was amazing!  The butter sauce was a thin cream type sauce. I expected the sage to be fried crispy, but it was not. No matter, it was a terrific dish. 

Definitely a good place to enjoy a good Italian meal with the family. I wouldn't suggest it as a romantic date night spot though, it's much too loud on a busy night.

Came here on a Thursday night, which also happens to be their scheduled "Date Night" deal. We decided not to go with the deal cause we already knew what we wanted. 

Calamari. 5/5 due to crispy edges and chewy squid! I was never a fan if an Italian place would overcook the squid. oh, and the marinara? YUM.

I had the ravioli and my boyfriend had the carbonara. Both super delicious, although a popular favorite is the penne a la vodka! All their sauces are creamy and well-seasoned.

Tiramisu. Holy crap this was by far the best tiramisu I've ever had, and I believe for that to solely be based upon the fluffyness of the cake, and lightness of the (whipped?) cream filling. 

the ONLY reason I didn't give this place a full 5 stars is due to the long waiting periods during our service. We were seated in the outdoor area (included a working fireplace in an insulated tent) and there were 2 waiters assigned. some times they came to our table at the same time or nonstop. then there were periods when we needed something, and they weren't anywhere to be found. very strange.

Great Italian food, carefully made with fresh ingredients. Pastas were perfectly cooked and graciously topped. I was pleasantly surprised by how great the food was and the waitress was very professional and outstanding. Portions was fairly large. The food was delicious and brought out in a timely manner (no over-lapping of courses), and we had a wonderful time overall :)

Took the girls here for Mother's Day and sat on the patio, which is even more attractive with the new greenway. Unfortunately it rained so we could not take a walk after the meal. We had a reservation and were seated within 7 minutes. Excellent waitress, good food. A local favorite.

I love Italian and this dinner did not disappoint. We went on a Wednesday, and were happy to hear it was half price wine bottle night! Our waiter was wonderful and made several recommendations, including a Barolo which was excellent. I had the Penne Alla Vodka with chicken. The menu noted it was spicy, which I am sensitive to. Our waiter offered to have the chef skip the black pepper or scale it back. I chose to scale it back and it was the perfect choice. It still had a kick but not too much for me. My Dad also had the same meal and enjoyed it. Also per the waiter's recommendation, my husband had the Chicken Parmesan, which is his favorite. He thought the chicken was a bit dry but he still cleaned his plate. Our aunt had the same meal and also dry chicken. Overall we had excellent service and a very good meal. We will be back!

We had such a lovely meal at Mama Ricotta's on Christmas Eve! We are very relieved to find such good Italian food here in Charlotte, NC...this place is on par with what we were used to having in Northern NJ/NYC and Chicago. Angel hair pasta was cooked to perfection with an absolutely perfect marinara sauce and phenomenal turkey prosciutto meatballs. We also had a lemon, white wine, artichoke chicken; very juicy and served on a bed of fluffy, cheesy, Heavenly polenta. Ratatouille was also cooked and seasoned to perfection and they did a fantastic job with the bread pudding and house made gelato. The portions at Mama Ricotta's are very large, prices reasonable...good drink menu too. We had very comfortable outdoor seating in front of a fireplace and prompt attentive service. I was totally impressed with what a saw in terms of their pizza menu and the indoor wood fired pizza oven which diners can sit near, in a bar type seating style. No question we will be visiting again soon!!

My coworker and I were in town to visit a client and decided to check out this restaurant based on yelp reviews. Well we were not disappointed we both had their penne vodka with slight variations and it was amazing! Their cheesecake was also delicious!!

A Charlotte Classic!  Everything on this menu is awesome!  I've been training for a race and have been "carb loading" I can't get enough of the Rigatoni with meat sauce and the Penne, Broccoli and Chicken.  I always end up with a to go box for lunch the next day.  

Mama if you read this bring back the Spedini Salad!

Oh and the pricing is pretty good for Catering!  We ordered several platters of pasta for a birthday bash.  Hot and yummy and way easier than cooking.

My wife's favorite Italian spot. She loves the penne ala vodka, made with pepper vodka!  Fresh baked bread is amazing.  Tried a slice ifU daughters pizza, very good!  Service is usually really good.  The last time we were there the server was slow but very friendly.  I would put this in the top 5 Italian eateries in Charlotte.

Love the remodel. The food here is a bit simple but good for the style of Italian.
By simple I mean a bit bland. But the portions are excellent and the service is very good. Best for families. If you are looking for something creative or inspired this is not your place. But if it is a family dinner this is an excellent choice .
Loved this restaurant years ago. The food is a little on the salty side my last two visits. But it has very good classic Italian dishes.

I went here with a visiting cousin in early December. He had gotten a recommendation from another business traveller, so we gave it a shot. The meal was very good. The service was OK. The bread and oil were good, but the waiter was very puzzled by the request my cousin made to add grated cheese to the oil. The beer choices could have been better, but that is a perennial concern I have at most restaurants in Charlotte. Portions were reasonable, sauces good. It was a happy surprise to find out that the owning family was from the same area of NYS as we were, and we had a nice little exchange about "home". Desserts were killer. I was completely oblivious to the decor or muzak....but I was pretty much engulfed in a catching-up conversation with my cousin!
I plan on driving into town again to eat here...but since I live an hour out, it's not feasible for me to commute in *just* to eat very often. This is a place I would take guests to.

Overall didn't live up to everyone saying we must try. First I do want to say the bartenders were awesome and the server was nice. We decided to try for restaurant week and I think that was a mistake. Waiting I ordered a sangria, something was off and my husband smelt and tasted and agreed. The bartender tasted their mix and said the same so easy enough I substituted for a glass of wine. Got seated on time and sever was super friendly. We ordered all at once. Started with risotto balls they were really good. Then we got the penne vodka which was good but noodles were too al dente. The ravioli also came at the same time but were boarder line cold. The cheese inside was dense and not melted at all. Our server didn't bring the food so we didn't see her for 10mins. Then our food came, husband got chicken parm which was good but really can get that anywhere. I got the pork Ragu and the pork was tender but had no flavor and super dry. After 10mins of waiting for the server to check on us I finally told her and asked for a side of sauce, it took another 15 bc she had to come tell me there was an upcharge then go put it in. By the time it came my husband was done so I just had them pack it up. They said they were still working out the dishes for restaurant week since it was night one? Then we waited over 30 mins for them to bring us precut cake! We were pissed at that point because we had been then for An hour and half. Then the manager came over to basically tell me Ragu is usually dry... um no I get it everywhere and yes it's not saucy but not with a watery sauce with no flavor making the top noodles dry. They gave me the sauce with my box to eat later. The cake was ok kinda dry. Overall not impressed for my first visit. Literally every course but appetizers had an issue. I may try again not during restaurant week we will see.

The food was  good, I ordered a chicken parm and it was huge. The tiramisu was very good. I was satisfied with the portions. However I didn't find the chicken parm to be anything above average.

The service was good and attentive.

Amazing.  High quality, great prices, huge servings.  The crostini goat  cheese appetizer is probably the best appetizer I've ever had- huge portion, and delicious. 
I love their meat sauce- the combo of 3 meats is so savory, and filling.  The cheese ravioli is delicious. Their specials change all the time, so definitely ask.  You can find some scrumptious off the menu stuff that way. 
Love the servers, and the ambiance.  Great place for Date Night.

A little overpriced.  The food was overall pretty good. I know a few other Italian restaurants that I would pick first just because of price.  I wasn't disappointed with the food, just not extraordinary.  Service was good.

This was a good restaurant. I was with a group of about 10 people. Apparently on Wednesday there are 1/2 price wines so that was a plus. Appetizers were great, we had a samples platter with all the Italian staples. I had the veal Marsala which was a little sub par from what ice had in the past however I tried others' meals which were all great.  We had tiramisu and the Nutella cheese cake both of which were great but enough for all to share. 

All in all good restaurant and great for groups.

I recently went to Mama Ricotta's with a friend and a family member.  We ordered the full size chopped salad, a pizza, and a calzone.  Everything we ordered was terrific.  The chopped salad was full of vegetables and the dressing (the house vinaigrette) was fantastic.  The pizza was one of the best - perhaps the best - I have had in Charlotte.  I haven't found a Charlotte pizza place that I love (being from Chicago I am a total pizza snob), but I thoroughly enjoyed the Joe's special at Mama Ricotta's.  The bread and olive oil that they place on the table at the start of the meal are also really tasty...

The service was great.  Our server was attentive, and she was wonderful about getting us samples of a couple of types of wine.  It helped us to select a bottle that we ended up really enjoying.  

If I had a complaint, then it would only be about the cost of the wine.  The wine list is pricey, and that stood in sharp contrast to the prices of the entrees and appetizers - which I found to be very reasonable.  

All in all, this is a great find.  I would definitely recommend Mama Ricotta's if you are in the mood for good Italian food at reasonable prices.

What is it with this place? It's like a weird mutant baby of Ruby Tuesday and the Cheesecake Factory born in 1994 - I swear they even have the same mix of fun n' funky jams you've heard in your favorite RT's playing in the background. They most definitely have the same feel - messy food paintings full of edgy, contrasty colors, that damn jewel tone color scheme that immediately calls to mind fancy Mall, opulent textures bandied about, willy-nilly. I've given Mama's three chances to transcend the bad decor choices with delicious foods, and she's failed me, every time.

Dinners - universally too salty, and if salts-everything-before-tasting-it me is saying that, well. This preserved, pickled thing is inescapable - if it isn't a preserved roasted pepper overwhelming your salad, it's a pickled artichoke or so many Kalamatas (yay Greece) smothering your pizza that any chance of digging on the housemade mozz is gone. Even Bruschetta tastes like it's been doused with anti-aging liquids and sat at the bottom of a very deep fridge for who knows how long.

In true Olive Garden style, salads are overdressed before making it to your table, so it's all a wilty, mixed up mess. That ain't how they do it in Italia, kids! That's how they do it in Bottomless Breadstickville.

Service is probably where they've spent the most energy and it shows - people are quick, smiley, knowledgeable. But try three was brunch this weekend, and the Benedict was so Stouffer's (accompanied by the blandest breakfast taters I've ever not eaten, and seriously, what cheese was that under my two asparagus spears, Muenster? Srsly?!) that, like I said, I give up. Che cosa una delusione.

I met my cousin here for lunch. She loves his place but I've never been. There doesn't seem to be a lot of parking- that for me can be a tad bit frustrating. The ambiance is soooooooo nice- it's really intimate, not loud, low lighting; definitely recommend for a date or brief business get together. The lunch prices are perfect- you get a lot for what you order. As for the dinner prices I'm not so sure. They looked a bit pricey to be getting the same serving size. I ordered the primavera pasta because I saw it in yelp. Boy was is tasty! Lots of veggies , how I like. I didn't get any protein added and I glad I didn't because you really don't need it . I was given 3 sauce options and I choose the basil and tomato sauce - as the waitress recommended. The staff was extremely attentive, service was exceptional! I even say the manager just going around and making sure everyone was okay and happy. 
I will definitely be going back here to try other Hong's on the menu.

Mama Ricotta's is consistently flavorful with good service. Normally, I'm here for lunch and get the pasta primavera. They are generous with the vegetables and portion size.
