The meat option to add to the primavera is not worth it, as I find the chicken as well as the shrimp to be rather bland. Additionally, the wait it never long and the staff is friendly. For $9, this is an economical lunch option.

During dinner, the line isn't usually too long. The food is delicious and the pastas are very hearty. I recommend the lasagna, as the portion size is filling. My favorite appetizer is the goat cheese and mascarpone dip. If you're not sharing, this could be a meal in itself. Best part of any meal are the garlic rolls. 2 bites size, warm, soft, and garlicky of course.

I called and asked what the soup of the day was as was told it was tomato cream , great I wanted soup and salad. When I got there and order the server said the soup was butternut squash,I told him I called and they said it was tomato, he said 'no'. He didn't even go check and in the kitchen to see if perhaps that was the soup at lunch time and they still had some , he just said No. we were hungry so we ordered dinner which was very good, just disappointed by the staff.

Great lunch recently at Mama Ricotta's.  This is a place I dined years ago when I lived in Charlotte and was thrilled to see things were as terrific as ever!   I look forward to having dinner there when I am back in Charlotte!

If I could give a 4.5 star I would. Fantastic! I've been here a few times and each experience has been great. Let's start with the staff. Friendly and helpful. Beth, behind the bar, is so nice and really knows her stuff. The food. Ok, I'm jumping straight to dessert. Nutella  pie!! I could stop my review right there and still be at a 4 star. That's the real deal. The angel hair pasta dish does not disappoint. It's the pizza that has won my heart. The first time I ordered it, I glanced at the price for a large, 14 inch pie and was surprised at the almost $20 price tag but said to myself, everything else here has been unbelievable, so I'm going for it. Reminds me of the scene in Pulp Fiction when Vincent Vega asked "Is that a $5 milkshake? We're talking milk and ice cream, right? (after tasting it), That's a great f*%@ing milkshake".  Yep, you get what you pay for! I ordered the Joe's Favorite (no, it was already named that when I arrived). The homemade sausage is out of this world good. Great crust, wonderful flavor. One of the best pies I've ever had. Can't wait to go back again!
The waitstaff were very nice but the food fell short. We had the bruschetta, shrimp scampi and Joe's favorite pizza. All of them were just okay, not great.

After living on Italy for two years I've just found a peace of Sicily in Charlotte. Because I like antipasto I order a plate that wasn't on the menu. The gently waitress did her best to convince the manager that accepted the request and thanks for the Chef that did a great job. It was an original antipasto that any Italian could value))) They have great wines and fresh beer.  But the service got from me this five stars review)))

I used to work here about 10 years ago and it was and is the best Italian restaurant in Charlotte. It's not just that the food is unbeatable (I mean, who can have just one of those garlic knots?), but the owner and management are great. We always had such a great time working (it's easy when the food is good, you feel good about making recommendations). We also almost always bought some food before the kitchen closed and took it home! Now, when I come home to Charlotte I always try to get my parents to go there with me! Try going for lunch when the ginormous portions are a little smaller.

Delicious food (chicken parm and cheese pizza), paired with a bottle of wine (50% off ALL bottles on Wednesdays!)...SO GOOD! 
Service was great and the ambiance was really nice. Low lit, not too kitschy, music at the right volume. 
Highly recommended for Charlotte Italian and I will be back next time I'm in town!

It was slightly above average.  The bread and oil was decent.  I had the Pollo Bianco and it was amazing. Everything cooked to perfection!  My date had the Penne, Broccoli and Chicken and it was alright.  I thought it was a little dry and was looking for a creamy sauce that kept me going for more bites. Desert was awesome.  We had the chocolate cannoli and I highly recommend you to try that.  I thought it would be too rich but it was on point.  Our server was great and very knowledgeable. We took our time at the table and didn't feel that she was rushing us out the door.  I would definitely go back again.

OMG. I finally found great pizza in Charlotte! :) The white pizza is amazing and their pepperoni is some sort of butcher fabulousness. Takeout was easy and quick. Will definitely be back soon for dine-in!!!

It was pretty average Italian food, nothing to write home about. The bread they bring to the table before dinner wasn't very good.  No taste. I ordered the cheese ravioli and added two meatballs.  They were about the size of golf balls and pretty good but when I got my bill, they charged me $2 each for the meatballs! Craziness!

For one of Charlotte's top rated Italian eateries, Their chef has a lot to learn about serving pasta. We ordered family style rigatoni with meat sauce. When they served the large platter there was barely any sauce, maybe one ladle in the middle. In Buffalo, we like a little pasta with our sauce. not the other way around!

I'm a huge fan of Mama Ricotta's. They are the perfect place to dine with a larger group, as they take reservations and offer family style portions or individual portions.

The family style portions are reasonably priced and plenty for 3+ to share. We also love their fresh bruschetta. Their Caesar salad is great too. 

From pasta to dessert, and a date to a family dinner, we love their food!
it was good. the bread was extremely fresh. tiramisu the best i have ever had!!  will return again in future.

UPDATED REVIEW: We received a gift card to give it another try, so we went during restaurant week to get the best bang for our buck, and the chance to try more things. While nothing was crazy salty like our first experience, nothing we had blew us away either. Everything was completely average (except for the lemon blueberry tirimisu which neither of us cared for). Suffice to say, we'll be going elsewhere when we want good Italian.

This was the best dining experience that I have had in a long time!!
The salad and lasagne were delicious and the service was delightful. The servers all made me feel like they truly wanted me to enjoy my meal.
I highly recommend this place.

Literally my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. One of the few/only places to get real Italian food. Plus not only do they know what Italian beef and giardiniera are, but have the sense to combine them on an amazing brick oven pizza. You will fight filling up on the bread and apps as they are amazing, but try and have restraint for the entrees. Love love love Mama Ricotta's - we always take family when they visit Charlotte.

Here on June 14, 2012.

Had amazing food here. Chicken breast dishes give enough food to bring home another meal.  Tasty food with traditional italian seasoning. Suace homemade and delicious. Easy to park. Has outdoor seating, too.

Great service and food, but the atmosphere left a little bit to be desired.  Maybe it's because I ate dinner at 6:00pm on a Tuesday and sat in the bar.  There just wasn't much going on, but this is a good thing, because my food was out in 10 minutes!

The Rigatoni was awesome and I'm a fan of the little rolls they bring.  The hand-packed ricotta added to the flavor of my dish and the dipping oil for the bread was a nice touch.  I didn't see much on the wine list to my liking, so I got a beer.  Decent selection on draft.

I'll be back for the lasagna soon...
First time was amazing.. Great service and food!

Really didn't expect this level of food and type of dining experience! 

We started with the goat cheese appetizer. Fluffy and creamy, it was the perfect start. 

I also decided to have a whiskey cocktail and I'm always nervous about cocktails. This one was excellent! Had either Rosemary or thyme and was just perfect. 

My husband and I split a salad with salmon on top And the short rib gnocchi. They were both excellent. The short rib fell right off the bone and the gnocchi was full of flavor and pillowy. 

Last, we shared Nutella and chocolate pie slices. The slices were huge!!! Definitely preferred the Nutella pie over the chocolate pie. 

Service was great and it was just a lovely experience and sit down meal. I'll be back!

I am never disappointed here. It's so well priced especially if you get the family style. Their appetizers are so good and I haven't had a main pasta dish that I don't like. The carbonara is my favorite for sure.

Y'ALL CLEARLY HAVE NEVER EATEN OUTSIDE OF CHARLOTTE. Mama ricotta's is a 1/2 step above olive garden, now ive never eaten at an oliver garden but thats what i imagine. its pretty standard mediocre italian food that emphasizes alot of heavy cream to create flavorful dishes, which is just so not italian. 

Not that there is anything wrong with mediocre italian food, it fills you up, but 4 stars is crazy. Both times ive had the penne alla vodka, once again its pretty mediocre. 

Fried calamari was fried calamari, it did not kill me, but i laughed when they served it with hellmans chipotle mayo as the side (hello cocktail sauce? maybe a tomato sauce?). 

I will say its rather inexpensive so compared to a luce or vivace i can see this being a fan fav.

Absolutely scrumptious! One of my co-worker recommended this place to me several months ago.. and I finally got around to dining here! I love the atmosphere- family photos adorn the walls, fine, white clothes and tableware set the tables. The wine barrel semi-wall is really neat. The restaurant is segregated into various areas, such as the pizza bar with someone stretching and throwing dough in front of you, high tables, low tables and a wine cellar area. 

Now to the food- 
I started with the fresh mozzarella, tomatoes and basil- fresh and delicious. 
Pasta Primavera with cream sauce- angel hair pasta with fresh veggies cooked to perfection and tenderness with nicely seasoned creamy sauce. Oh my goodness, I will be returning! So worth it. 
I believe my friend ordered the Penne Alla Vodka, which wasn't anything spectacular. We tried each other's entrees and she loved mine. 

Next time I visit, i'll try and save room for dessert. 

Staff was welcoming and friendly.

I had a reservation for 3, I changed it to 2, but it wasn't updated in the system when we arrived (I had called too to let them know) Whatever no problem. They seated us at an awkward table for 6 outside in a cold corner. We ate here for our wedding anniversary, so I hated we didn't get a better table with our reservation. 

Service was average. I had the chicken parm and goat cheese polenta & it was very good. Big portion sizes. I tried their chocolate martini & it was SOOO weak they might as well have given me a glass of milk. :(  ! 

All in all a good meal but not sure if I'll be back.
i enjoy the food from Mama's it is my go to place for a good meal and wonderful service.

The food and the Server Ben was AMAZING!!! the only thing I would change is have something like crayons available for the children for the waiting on the main course.. Other than that it was the Bomb!

I'm in NC for business, and asked around for a good italian place - This was told to me as "the best Italian in charlotte"

We took a walk over there and noticed this nice place at the corner of a strip mall. Lots of well dressed people inside, so it must be a decent place right?

Wait staff was good and attentive, and quick.

Everything was just OK. Bread and olive oil/vinagerette dip were OK, Goat cheese and bread appetizer, just ok. 
I had the veal milanese, with arugula and onions, and a  side of asparagus (4 dollars for like 7 little baby 'gus's). Only ok. 

They had a special on beers "All Italian beers on sale"
-what italian beers do you have?
Peroni. Thats it. Hardly a special.

Not bad, but wouldnt visit again. All the dishes were typical with no risks, and no reward.

One of our favorite places to go--food and service are always great.  Wednesday night, half price bottles of wine.  Families, date night, special celebration, this place is home--they treat you well.  The hostess is always pleasant and helpful.
We sat on the patio tonight.  Shared the Tuscan Salad and then the Rigatoni with meat sauce.  You will be taking a doggy back because the portions are big! It was my BDay, so they brought me a cannoli--wonderful night!  A restaurant that's great for the family to gather, the service is always happy and courteous--great food and value!!!
With this nice warm weather, maybe go on a patio tour-who has the best patio in Charlotte!!!
Food was very delicious. However, the salt content proved to be a bit extreme.  Great service!!
Great food, fine cocktails, excellent service provided by Kelly.  We noticed this place fairly close to our hotel. I looked up the Yelp reviews and decided to check it out. Good choice.

Stopped by for take out. Our Air B&B hosts suggested it as a dinner for the two of us to share. We are in town on business and dinners are late.

Ordering was easy and it was ready with no wait when we called ahead.

We split the angel hair pasta with two huge turkey meatballs. It was good and made for three meals. I ordered the Momma's salad (or something with a similar name) and it was okay. I'd skip it next time.
Very very good. A tiny bit pricy for italian food but none the less it was very tasty

I went here with my dinner group of 10 people. We were given the most delicious bread with a nicely spiced olive oil.  I ordered the ravioli, which was cheese filled and offered a choice of 3 sauces.   I chose butter and sage.  Very good and quite a sizeable portion.   I did leave one ravoili on the plate to be lady like ; )  But, I wish that I had better less greedy so that I could have enjoyed leftovers the next day!

Most over-rated Italian food (or just restaurant in general) in Charlotte. 

I would say that Mama Ricotta's is just marginally better than The Olive Garden. Don't even bother wasting your time here unless you like burnt, watery, flavorless sauce. 

I got chicken parmesan. The chicken part was really good however, the sauce was AWFUL. 

My wife got pene ala vodka and it was just OK. 

The service was excellent for how busy they were! 

Nothing special here.

My favorite part honestly was the salad. They had a really good dressing. 

If you want the real deal, go to OGGI!!!!! 

(I am 100% Italian and grew up eating home-cooked Italian food so I am pretty picky when it comes to this)

Oh my gosh, this place is SO GOOD! I came here for New Years Eve and ate my little heart out!  Everything, from the appetizer of bread with ricotta and tomato sauce to the pasta and salad, was absolutely DIVINE. An absolute must try!! I can't wait to go back.

Someone at the photo shop down the road recommended Mama Ricotta's for lunch, so my son and I went. My son is a college kid, so he wanted pizza. It was fabulous. Now we go every time we make the trip to Charlotte (an hour) for camera gear. He has taken a couple of friends as well.  

My son could eat the bread and flavored oil all day. It is really good. The pizza which is what we always get is terrific too. So, I can't speak to the other dishes, but they look great. I want to try some of those soon. 

Every server we've had has been terrific both inside and on the patio. They have a cover on the patio and a fireplace going when it's cold. That's where we ate last time and really enjoyed the outdoor feel.

Recently, my husband and I decided to grab a quick meal prior to the theater. We chose to go to one of our very favorite restaurants- Mamma Ricotta's.
We can always count on a delicious meal and great service. Friday night was no exception. The wait staff is generally very good, however, Friday we had Ben and he was exceptional. From the moment we were seated he was attentive, efficient, knowledgeable and fun. He made certain  we had  a scrumptious, meal  and excellent wine and still had plenty of time to get to the theater!

I must start off by saying we have enjoyed the food very much each time we have ate here!
Tonight we really weren't happy with the service that we received while eating dinner. I asked a few questions about the menu and the servers response were incorrect or asking me a question back. When you are paying $20+ per dish you want to make sure you will enjoy your food or at least I want to know. I asked what polenta was because obviously I've never heard of it and servers response was "you never heard of polenta" and than goes on to tell me it potatoes that had a sauce on them. Well hate to break it to you but I goggled it as soon as she walked away and come to find out "she didn't know what is was either". 
I find it kind of rude to ask the same question to a customer that they asked you than make up what the food is and not go ask what it was. Few other questions we asked about the menu such as do you have a house salad? Response was you can just pick any of them. Well come to find out the one we picked dressing couldn't be changed than goes to tell us which one is the house salad that we could actually pick our dressing for. I could go on and on of smart remarks and incorrect information that was given during this dinner but I will stop here. With this said hopefully they see this review and get their servers on board with knowing their menu.

What a nice treat! The bread, to start, was fresh and seasoned with Italian herbs, and served with olive oil & red pepper flakes, yummy! The shrimp and crab risotto was delicious, creamy & buttery, a true risotto. We also ordered the Pollo Alla Griglia, a seasoned grilled chicken, served with mashed potatoes & the vegetable of the day, which I substituted for the grilled asparagus, delish! The service was great and the wine selection perfect! An enjoyable evening in the patio, and somewhere we will return!
Went during charlottes restaurant week, it was just OK. The marinera sauce was bland...their pizza is great tho :)

Went with a huge group, where we dined family style. I was able to try multiple offerings, and every single item was fresh and delicious. A great staple in the Charlotte area for a night with friends, a place to bring out of town guests, and bigger parties for a special occasion.

Absolutely amazing!!!! Thank you Yelp for the recommendation. My daughter and I felt like we walked into grandmas kitchen as we entered the front door. The smell alone brought back so many memories. Our waiter Ben was top notch! The service was by far the best I've ever experienced. Our tastebuds were in heaven the entire meal. The bruschetta and homemade mozzarella is to die for as well as the Rigatoni with meat sauce. This will be a regular spot whenever we are in town. It's totally worth the wait!!!!!! I must admit that all of the other diners left with to go boxes except us. We were so full, yet kept saying just one more bite! Thank you for a awesome experience and the perfect ending to our mother daughter day.
Perhaps they need more staff at night. I waited 15 minutes for them to cut 2 pieces of tiramisu to go.

Had lunch there today with my wife. We started with the bruschetta and the toppings were good. The bread was very soggy as if it sat on the line for a few minutes, but overall it was good.
We both ordered the pollo carciofi which was good. The mix of flavors and the lemon were smooth and we enjoyed. It was however pretty salty. I believe artichoke hearts are salty and were included, but if you know that, back off the salt. Would go back again, service was really good and friendly staff. This was our first visit here.

Very good local favorite for Italian.  The bad news is that everyone else in Charlotte knows that.  The good news is that they accept reservations.  

Like Buca Di Beppo, they offer many of their dishes as large family style options. Unlike Buca Di Beppo, they also offer everything as an entree for one.  And the food is significantly better.  

I loved the complimentary bread brought to the table which tasted like small soft dinner rolls brushed with garlic.  The olive oil with a hint of crushed red pepper was a great companion to the bread.  My chicken Parmesan was excellent, although with a slight imbalance between cheese and sauce. (More sauce please!)

All in all, an excellent option for a great Italian meal in Charlotte and one I hope to revisit on a future trip.

Bookmarked for six months, I was finally in this part of town and in the mood for Italian food. It was an excellent choice and I have to double recommend the warm goat cheese and mascarpone dip to start. Excellent, excellent, excellent!

I had the ricotta with meat sauce as my main. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was excellent. I asked for the added scoop of ricotta cheese but it really wasn't necessary with the freshly grated cheese on top. Lots of pasta, it went home in a box and was a full lunch meal the next day.

My wife chose the pork chop special, which was served with sliced apple in a delicious sweet gravy. Absolutely excellent and again, more than enough to take home.

Service was excellent and the food was excellent. I'm sure we'll be back!

Mama's is participating in Restaurant Week with a four-course meal for $30.00.  I took a peek at the menu and thought I'd give it a whirl.

I made reservations (which were probably not necessary) through Open Table for early Sunday evening.  I was seated immediately and my server came out to take my drink order.  There were three options for the first course, two for the second, four for the third and three dessert options for the final course.  I made my selections and the waiter left to put in my order.
He returned quickly with what appeared to be some soft yeast garlic rolls with some olive oil for dipping.  Soon the bruschetta, my first course, arrived.  It was the tastiest bruschetta I've ever had.  Heaps of diced tomatoes and basil protecting two pieces of toasted Italian bread, drizzled with olive oil.  They set the bar high up front.  Unfortunately, the next course didn't meet the same status.  I had chosen the penne a la vodka pasta which was rather mild in taste.  The one saving grace was the pieces of pancetta scattered throughout the dish.  The third dish helped bring us back closer to our starting point.  The veal milanese was very simple with a veal cutlet pounded out, lightly breaded and fried, topped with arugula, cherry tomatoes and Parmesan cheese.  The cutlet was huge and left me enough for dinner the following night.  I ended my meal with the nutella pie, a delightful combination of nutella, marscapone, and peanut butter in a graham cracker crust.  Fantastic.

The food was very good and the service was excellent.  The location was a little difficult to find, but it's worth the reward.

I moved to Charlotte almost 5 years ago and just had my first Mama Ricotta's experience. I know, this practically still makes me a Charlotte rookie. I have heard so many of my friends rave about this place, and it's been on my list for some time now. When my dear friend Jessie invited the boodle and I to join them for NYE dinner at MR's, I just couldn't say no. Mama Ricotta's and good company... sign me up!

We had a 6:30pm reservation and the boodle and I arrived about 15 minutes early. I wasn't sure what to expect with the place being in a strip mall. It was warm, inviting, and beautifully decorated inside. Exceeded my expectations for sure. 

We were seated promptly at 6:30pm and our server was incredibly friendly. MR's was offering a NYE menu as an option, but it was not required. Jessie and I did order the NYE cocktail special which was a black cherry champagne beverage; it was delicious. The fresh bread that came to our table was a garlic-y, buttery bread. It was so good! 

I am rather plan when it comes to meal time. I stuck with the classic Angel Hair Pasta was homemade tomato basil sauce. It was so good! Boodle ordered the short rib over gnocchi and it was amazing. I had a few bites and wished I had ordered it. 

There is plenty of parking at Mama Riccotta's and everyone there was really friendly.

My friend and I came here for restaurant week last week. It was delicious! First off, their menu had 4 courses and all the portions were large! I took my entree for lunch the next day. I chose the blueberry lemon tiramisu. This isn't normally on the menu, but I think it should be. It was delicious! I also enjoyed the chicken piccata. What really made the experience was our waiter, Ben. He had to be one of the most friendly and happy waiters! His energy completely made the night! I can't wait to go back for another dinner.

Since last Queen's Week fiasco, I've been ordering the lunch penne alla vodka to split with the bf and it is delicious on the regular. 5/5 stars for this. I decided to return for Mama Ricotta's new Queen's Feast Menu since they have been doing so well with their normal service and food. We decided to have an early dinner before they were overwhelmed with Restaurant Week diners during their normal dinner hours. 

At 5:30p, we were seated in a booth right away and our server filled our water glasses and brought out those meh tasting garlic buns (might want to season the oil dip)...The server was very attentive throughout the meal and filled our water glasses more than a couple of times despite the incoming dinner crowd. This was kinda of an odd meal for me and I couldn't evaluate it as much as I would have liked because I got my first medical school acceptance phone call before the first course came out and I was a little dazed (but yay!) sorry not as many pics this time! 

Appetizer: 
Tomato Soup: nothing special at all..very rustic style tomato soup. This comes in a very small cup and I never received the crostini that was supposed to come with it. 
Arancini: the bf liked it but, I thought it needed more seasoning. Good sized portion though. 

Second Course: 
Penne alla Vodka: definitely not as good as the regular penne alla vodka quality. The sauce was a little soupy and a tiny bit bland. 

Entree: 
Tomato and Shrimp Risotto: very al dente, almost undercooked. The shrimp was cooked and seasoned perfectly though. The bf didn't really like the fishy taste from the risotto, I'm guessing they used seafood stock for this. I didn't mind it as much. 

Dessert: 
Lemon Blueberry Tiramisu: I was hesitant to try it but, it was actually really good. Very refreshing with its take on fruit. 
Nutella Cannoli: Very good! The filling was delicious, the perfect combination of crunchy and sweet. 

It was an ok Queen's Week Meal. I wouldn't really get anything again besides the desserts and the penne alla vodka.
Great food! And they probably have one of the bet lasagna a in Charlotte!

On two separate occasions I have attempted to come to this establishment.  The first time was Restaurant Week so I understood they were busy and there were no tables available...no problem.  Saturday solidified  the fact that I will never attempt to go there again.  We were searching for a dinner spot and decided we wanted Italian.  We are aware it's usually packed so  we called first to assess the wait.  We were told by the person on the phone that there was no wait so we headed right over.  We arrived 10 minutes afterwards and there was suddenly nothing available nor did the hostess offer to take our names just in case something came up.  She kept telling us we could sit at the bar. When we explained we just called the hostess began to tell me about other patrons that had reservations, which had nothing to do with the fact that I'd just called and confirmed availability.  Ultimately there was no sense of customer service and I was very disappointed with her tone and the way she handled our visit.  To avoid ruining a perfectly good day we left and found a location that could offer the level of service we deserved.

My husband read this is the best Italian in NC, so we didn't mind driving to Charlotte to see for ourselves. It is wonderful! Great food, Amber is a fantastic server, ambience is lively and lovely. If you haven't tried Mama Ricotta, please do!!

Wow. Looks can be deceiving. I avoided this place (even though I heard it was good) b/c of the name and location.

Lucky for me, I was bored on a Monday and felt daring. Very nice interior, extremely friendly/hospitable service, and very good food.

Mama Ricotta's (or as I call her, Mama) is literally one of the first places I ever ate in Charlotte.  Unlike a lot of places in Charlotte, they got better over the last 15 years, not worse.

The best way for me to describe their changes over the years has to be: intelligent.

Their growth was intelligent because they kept the items which were successful, and rotated in new favorites while changing with the times.  A lot has changed over the past 15 years regarding what people in America are looking for in food, they've been able to stay relevant while not losing their credibility and identity.

As for value, it is in line with other quasi-casual Italian restaurants around Charlotte, which (IMHO) are all generally over priced, there are some more fairly priced options but you do have to look for them a bit more.

All in all you should not be upset with your experience at Mama's.
Excellent place.  Food is solid.  Service is great.   Just outside uptown - Uber cost covered by the non-uptown prices.  We are going to be here regularly.

To start off, the front of house staff is amazing, we were a few minutes late for our reservation but they held our table and seated us with smiles. Very friendly and helpful. Our waitress Diana, pointed out her favorites on the menu but also gave us information about any other dish we wanted to know about. I never once had to ask for a refill, it's like she knew what I wanted before I had to ask for it. If I'm not coming back just for the food alone, it was for the outstanding service.

I made a reservation a couple of hours before we planned on arriving - a Thursday evening.  We got hungry, so we decided to go early - assuming it wouldn't be THAT busy on a Thursday night.  We were pretty wrong.  We were told that it would be 30 minutes (basically the same time we had reserved).  No big deal - to the bar to grab a drink.

Four minutes later, we were told that our table was ready.  Great - except, I need to close out at the bar...and if we would have known we would be seated so quickly, I would have waited and just ordered a bottle of wine.  Oh well, to the table with my beer in hand.

Sat down - got waters and bread/olive oil (which was great).  I ordered a small Caesar salad and the chicken parm.  The other three split a full salad (it was huge...if there's three of you, you don't need the family size salad) and had their entrees or pastas.

Pastas can be single serve if you're hungry.  I was able to finish half of the chicken parm (basically one piece of chicken and half of the pasta).  We all ended up taking three boxes home after passing on the desserts.  

A couple qualms.  Even on a Thursday night, the place was crowded (not so bad) - but it was loud...very loud.  We would have probably stayed and had dessert or another drink, but we could barely hear each other anyway - so we did not.  The restaurant is very dark.  Maybe people (other tables) were using their phones to read the menu.  Many it is part of the ambiance - but, other restaurants have "light up" menus.  

Was the food good? - Yes, it was great.
Service good? - Yes.
Good value? - Yes, chicken parm entree was $20 something, but gave me two good size meals.
Other issues? - Yes, loud and dark.
Would I go back? - For sure, with the right set of people.  It's much more of a friends place to go.  I wouldn't do a first date or meal with the rents.

P.S. - I ate the leftover chicken parm for lunch today - it was still great!
